text:
Went for a casual happy hour and thoroughly enjoyed my $8 (normally $12) cocktail.
$3.25 for a club soda.  Ouch.

Also loved the seared tuna appetizer with - get this - portabello "fries" - so tasty.

Excellent food, service and one-of-a-kind atmosphere.

Perfect for a date or romantic dinner for two.
Great for a proposal or special occaision.
Expense-account-worthy.

Boy can they throw down!

N.B. - I can't get any cell phone service up here.  Oh well - with that view, who cares.

So glad that Angela and the gang are still going strong after 2 years, delivering wings, ribs, corn dogs and FABULOUS fried shrimp to Drexel/Hahnemann students and others.

Wednesday is 1/2 price boneless wings and Monday is the Shrimp deal.

Love to take my 6 year old here - as I, probably should not even contemplate eating this.  It's an OCCAISIONAL treat only.  And we get celery in lieu of fries - and I get a salad - so I feel a little less guilty.

Bring on the fried shrimp!
And corn dogs. (Big and slightly sweet batter.)  Umm!

Saget's has been picking up and dropping off my dry-cleaning and this service is pricey - but so worth it as a timesaver for me.  John (the Manager) is terrific and custoimer service has been gresat - they bill me monthly and charge it right to my card.

Best of all the cleaning is expertly done and my clothes look great.

We had such a great time.  Our host was a great guy and we (12 of us) escaped from the "Speakeasy" with seconds to spare.

I would recommend trying this for sure.

Once again, Eyesite and Gene have gotten me a WINNER!!!

I am in love, love, LOVE with my new glasses.
They are from Belgium and very unique looking.
They make me feel like a butterfly when I wear them.
They are so light and comfortable - and GORGEOUS.

I absolutely love to shop for eyewear - and I go to lots of higher-end shops, but EYESITE is where I purchase my frames and lenses.

Simply the best.

What a remarkable gem in South Philly - and a perfect event space for the MANNA PA fist annual Guac-off.

Friendly staff at reception, clean restrooms, small kitchenette.

Good stuff!

You can even have a wedding here.

Went there again tonight - and while the decor sure ain't 5 star - the food absolutely is!!!

Shrimp Scampi .
The world's BEST baba.
Simple grilled veggies with chunks of feta.

So cheap (cash only at this location) and so tasty.

Killer waitresses - they attack - beware!

I can not say enough good things about Gene and the staff at eyesite.
They are the ONLY place I get glasses now.

I have 4 pairs and 1 pair of sunglasses and 2 clips (one was custom made).

Excellent!

Xo-Cheat on your diet!  It's Xo-worth it and Xo-great to come here.  I love the Oaxacan cuisine and kick-y cocktails with real tropical fruits used in making them.  I have been here twice already and, although pricey - and sometimes unbearably crowded, I will be back again and again.  It's Xo-Good!

The Aussie Bartender is muy, muy caliente!
Try a couple of Dona Florinda cocktails with fresh prickly pear cactus fruit.  Super Yum!

Fresh local produce - and a summer must for corn and 'maters.
They even accept credit cards - a big plus these days.

Love it!

Came in for my 5-6 month prophy and saw Kara - who is a new hygenist and TERRIFIC.  She took text-book perfect bitewings (digital, baby!) and Dr. D is great as always. Plus I love LeeAnn (sp??) - the office manager.  Such a well-run place!

Plus I got strawberry prophy paste.

Wheeeeeee!

Went back to see Ruth, RDH for my 4-5 month prophy and it was a dreamy, easy-breezy $85 experience as usual.

The staff is very nice and appointments are confirmed in advance.

I LOVE THIS PRACTICE!!!!

Philadelphia's Chinatown may not be the largest - but it has many wonderful things to explore.  Of course, the wonderful food - restaurants, tea houses, pastry & bake shops and grocery stores.  Also Chinese culture - and gifts galore.  Much fun to come here during the Chinese New Year - but to me it is even better to come here when it is NOT a celebration - just a "normal" day - like on a Tuesday or Wednesday in the spring or fall and stroll the streets and have a leisurely lunch.

Must explore Chinatown!

A few lucky PWCG members took part in a share of delicious, sustainable salmon from  OTOLITH SUSTAINABLE SEAFOOD in Philadelphia.  The 15 lbs of Salmon came in convenient (approx.) 1 lb portions.
 
With my first lb (I have gotten 3 lbs so far) here's what I made:
 
Karen Flam's "Grilled Gravlax".
 
Since I hadn't the time to do a proper "cure" here's what I did:
 
Dry-rub the clean, thawed salmon with:
 
1.5 tsp. Penzey's Shallot Salt
1 tsp. Penzey's Vanilla Sugar (yes, really)
A few healthy shakes of granulated Garlic
A few cracks of fresh black pepper
LOTS of fresh or dried dill.
 
Then, squeeze on the juice of one (or two) fresh lemons, or use 3-4 TBSP of bottled lemon juice.
 
Wrap in plastic and refrigerate for 4-6 hours (I couldn't wait any longer) - ideally - cure longer (and add some juniper berries - I didn;t have any).
 
Heat a skillet with 1-2 tsp of good olive oil and pan-grill (or use a real grill or grill pan).
I seared mine (First with skin side down, then flipped and seard the flesh side).
 
Slice thinly and serve.
 
Do not over cook!
 
My 6 year old gobbled up the small slice I gave her and asked for more right away.
She proceeded to eat about 4 oz!

I am giving 5 stars not so much to the coffee shop (which is about 3.5 stars) but to the FABULOUS customer service we got from Nicolas Capes at the MAIN site of La Colombe.

You see, we wanted to have individually wrapped foil pouches of coffee as wedding favors for our June 2008 nuptuals.  DiBruno Brother's couldn;t help us.  Neither could Dunkin Donuts, nor Cappriccio (though the manager tried).

The coffee favors available on "wedding" websites as favors is sub-par pre-bagged swill.

We wanted QUALITY - and with La Colombe - our guests got it - for reasonable coin, too.

We ordered a case (96 pouches) of the house blend and bagged each pouch in a cute little tulle bag, and added a Yankee Candle "buttercream" votive.  Between the coffe and the cream - our closet smelled heavenly.

The coffee favors were a huge hit and La Colombe is the ONLY Philly coffee place to come through for us.

OK, Brace yourself.  It's gonna be a long review.

3 of us went to R2L for an amazing dining experience last night.
And even though there were some problems (big ones) with service, the exquisite food more than made up for it.

Danny & Zaga - you "make your mamas proud".
That semi-open kitchen was running very nicely.  Your garnish chef, poultry man and line crew were in a good groove.

Daniel Stern's newest creation is in a gorgeous, dimly lit (and on a hoppin' Saturday night - very loud but still, surprisingly, comfortable) space.  The light fixtures, sculpture, bathrooms, stainless steel salt & pepper shakers (unused and unneeded) even the jacket of the wine list - all set off the gorgeous floor to ceiling views of the city.

Our lovely female bartender mixed us excellent drinks (brandy soaked cherries that are simply divine - I could eat a handful easily) and explained the menu while we waiting for our friend to arrive.

After we were seated our new and VERY nervous waiter (I think he had been there 3-4 days) explained even more.  We forgave him for using his notecards.

What was not so forgivable was the service snafu.

2 of the 3 of us ordered apps which were brought in short order after a delicious house-made bread.  The apps - which I truly recommend (those here with low food reviews - man, I think you may have ordered the wrong things) were the steak tartare (served in a rough chopped with plenty of shallots.  I ordered mine "not too spicy" and it was delicious.  Accompanied by crispy toasts with sort sort of butter (I think she said "beet butter" but it must have been golden beets as the color was a pale yellow).

My friend was not yet even finished his appetizer - crabcakes (which I did not try but he liked them and they looked great.) and his entree and side were brought out.

Then we sat.

And sat.

And finally said - "go ahead and eat it while it's still hot".  So he started to eat his (signature dish) Veal 5-6 ways.  So fabulous.  YOU MUST TRY DAN STERNS famous veal plate.  Accompanied by crisp butter-tossed broccoli florets.

So while he ate and my husband and I sat there and stared around - I said "This is a screw up". 

And, indeed it was.

First our (now petrified) young server came to apologize.  Next the manager came and said that our entrees were "3 minutes away" and apologized and said that they would do something "special" to make it up to us.

When our entrees did arrive - they were so worth the wait.  The filet accomanied by prociutto (I always spell that wrong) wrapped leeks (divine) just melted in your mouth - and the shortribs (want a little beef with your beef?) were good, too.

I opted to get an app as an entree - and had the unqiue -and uber-rich - lobster mac 'n cheese.  It was more like mezza-canelloni each topped/stuffed with small, buttery lobster medalions.  Served with it was a copious amount of rich, creamy cheese sauce - cheddar, gouda and something else.

WOW.  Don't miss the lobster mac!

To make up for the weird dinner service (AWKWARD!) they comped our desserts, cappucinos (delish - La Colombe)  and 2 of the 4 glasses of wine.

The pineapple cucumber sorbet was simply perfect.  Refreshing and "sang" on the palate.  Served over diced honeydew and plums.  The blackberry verjus sorbet was also good - but nothing compared to that Pineapple Cucumber.  It was capogiro worthy and obviously house made - served in perfect quenelles. (Can't wait to try the Kalamansi icecream and of course - who doesn't love a good gianduja?) Oh, my thighs!

My friend ordered the chocolate cream and apple pie (with a decadent sour cream quenelle beside it.

Also to make things "special they gave us an amuse-bouche pre-dessert of cinnamon panna cotta with a lovely rose-water sugar crysal topping and two picture-perfect fresh raspberries.

After dinner they served us each a crisp (not rock-hard) house-made cinnamon biscotti and - the best yet - buttery blueberry financiers (OK I can't spell that either).

KUDOS to your pastry chef.  He or she is a keeper.

Oh and Zaga is really a master - wow.

Such fun to watch y'all work.  If you can fix a few kinks in your service and have a more welcoming hostess stand - the 5 stars will stick!

Good work!  We can't wait to try your place in University City.

Oh - and they have a small private party room that seats 12 or so - and I hear a big one that seats about 100.  This would be a great wedding or rehearsal dinner setting.

And I bet plenty of marriage proposals will go down here.

Swanky, urban, romantic, high quality American classics with a BIG twist.

What a find!  What a lucky break!
My 11 year old recently enrolled in dance lessons and needed shoes, tights, leotards - the works!

DanceLine and their terrific staff saved the day.
They even have "Foot Undies" -  like little underwear for feet -used in lyrical dancing.

We'll be back!

OMG I echo Emily A.  I just discovered the Italian Market (I know, I know -what took me so long) and I went to Claudio's for home-made ricotta (so creamy, fresh and good - and CHEAP - $2.99 a lb.) and mozzarella.

Can't weait to pre-order a Burrate for later this month.  Burrata is Mozzarella with a creamy-buttery cream in the middle - so decadent.

I have FOUND my source for mozzarella.  Hooray!

OK, I bit the bullet and joined as an Unlimited Member for $50 per month.  My 9 year old kids loves it here too (but refuses to take the kiddie classes - she wants to take the ones I take - including Piloxing - a cross between boxing and Pilates - which is a terrific class.

I love the instructors here and many of the ladies who go here (there are a handful of men -it's mostly women) have become casual acquaintences.

I have nothing but great things to say about Fuel House.
Try the Zumba - but also try the non-Zumba offerings.

Jodi, Stephanie & the team are terrific!

Three cheers for the kielbasi boys (one of them was smokin' hot!) and their CHEESESTAK filled pierogies.

They gave our group of 11 a tour of the smokehouse - and we got to sample the turkey kielbasi, and several other varieties.

You gotta check this place out!  This is the real deal.  

$8.00 a dozen.
Cash only.

The Doylestown Farmers Market runs from late spring through mid-autumn in the parking lot at Oakland & Hamilton Streets.  There is a good selection of produce, meat, dairy, egg & beauty product vendors.  

I love coming here early in the morning when they are first setting up (don;t come too late or many of the goodies are sold out) and getting whatever looks freshest - Berries in June, Greens & Beans, and goat cheeses.

Great for kids & dogs.

Support your local farmers and farmers markets!
Bring cash - but a few places accept plastic.

Yes, they are high-end and expensive - but the frames are gorgeous.  (My French frames from face a face were 420 alone - plus 200 for the lenses and 150 for the sunglass clip which was custom made.)  Gene the Owner and Ala the optician were very easy to work with and the glasses were ready quickly.  (Just got  the matching custom sunglass clip.)

Ok that's $770 for 1 pair of glasses.  Egads! (Do NOT tell my parents who would FLIP out.)  I spent way more than I could afford - but they offered to charge my credit card in 2 installments - so that helped me out a wee bit.

I look great and am so happy.  Alain Mikli - eat your heart out.
I am so lovin' this place.  I will be back for sure!!!!

OK, I''m doin' it.

I am giving this mom 'n pop, cash only BYO the full 5 stars - based on that 5 star food.

Simple, fresh flavors - like a party in your mouth.

Yes - it's cramped and close quarters.  And there's a sign on the back kitchen door that says, "Beware Attack Waitress" and they are not kidding - those ladies can work it!  Yes - there are 3 terrific Laotian cooks, grilling up greek fish.  And it somehow all just works.

Perfectly.

A close friend and I (tip - do not come with an odd number of people - a single gets stuck at the counter, and a 3 will be forced to do a deuce with an extra chair) ate dinner here.  We split everything and ordered just right.

Mozzarella & Tomato salad was delicious, fresh, easy to eat and cut up home-style.  Perfectly seasoned.  Baba (no Ghanoush - ha, ha!) was some of the BEST I've ever had, bursting with charred eggplant flavor, olive-y richness and fresh garlic zing.  Not too oily.  Just AWE inspiring. (Great with that char-grilled pita.)

Next came a perfect Scampi (or Gambas if you were in Spain) with an abundance of fruity olive oil, garlic  and paprika.  Delish.  (Dip some of that pita in the oil when nobody is looking!)  And they are not skimpy with the shrimpies.  We had at least a dozen.

And a platter of grilled veggies - mostly Zucchini and Green Bell Peppers, but also a few red onions, pepperocini & olives.  It also had 2 BIG hunks of fresh (bulgarian or greek??) feta. I would have liked to see some RED peppers and EGGPLANT in there.

Drinks & Desserts are mothing to speak of here - and I coulda used a nice Lemonade - but the house brewed iced tea (in a teeny tiny glass) was good.  I had 2 of 'em.

I can easily seeing just giving this place 4 stars - it is NOT fine dining and there were a few service related flaws, but for pure, simple Greek/Med cuisine (and perhaps the East Coast's BEST BABA) I give them 5.

And I can't wait to go back.

And I kinda want to try the other location on 22nd Street, too.

Pick your own Strawberries in season has given me and now my little one spring after late spring of red-stained -face bliss.  None Such has great, fresh, farm-raised, seasonal produce.  (That means berry bliss in May/June and Corn late summer.)

We love it.  The same family has owned and run None-such for years!

I recently discovered the Italian Market (I know, I know -what took me so long?) and I went to Claudio's for home-made ricotta (so creamy, fresh and good - and CHEAP - $2.99 a lb.) and mozzarella.

Can't weait to pre-order a Burrata for later this month.  Burrata is Mozzarella with a creamy-buttery cream in the middle - so decadent.

I have FOUND my source for mozzarella.  Hooray!

Dr. Barry Dubin is the MAN!!!  He is a kind, compassionate dentist who does GREAT work and is up to date on all the latest dental techniques and technologies.  His hygienist, Ruth, is terrific (she's basically who I see - 3 times a year for cleanings.).  The office is well run and well managed.

Plus Dr. Dubin provides great marketing campaigns and incentives for referrals - like Dubin-Dollars.  He even sells gift cards!  What a great idea.

I love going to see Dr. D!!!!

Honestly, this place's sorbettos and gelatos rival Capogiro in Philly and any of the joints in NYC.  The Biscotti, Vanilla, Irish Whiskey (tastes like Bailey's) and Banana varieties rocked my world.

I had a first-class affogato with a delicious espresso pulled just for me.

EVERYthing is home-made - cakes, novelties - even Pizzelle.

Can't wait to return and so glad a local chick turned me on to this place.
Cheaper than Rita's.  No comparison.  JUST GO!!!!

I have to agree.  Carrie, our "minder" Jen and the staff of Monster Minders are, indeed, pros.  Sure, they cost more than having your neighbor do it, but they walked our 14 year old pug every morning for about 6 months prior to our move to the burbs.

I am very thankful to Monster Minders for being there when we needed them.

Being able to book online is great, too.
And automated billing to your credit card is super-easy!

Thank you, Monster Minders!  Woof Woof!

OMG!!!!  I can't even believe I am the first person to Yelp this.

Do I dare tell you all how really, really, really great this place is?  It's crowded enough as it is - if I tell you I'll never get a table.

OK, I'll tell you a little bit.
It's a no-decor, little atmosphere place run by a genuinely NICE family (the hostess/daughter is marrying the pizza chef in August 2008 in Brooklyn).  They make their own mozzarella, and bake fresh brick-oven pizza on a thin - but not-too-thin crust.

The shrimp scampi is ENORMOUS - they give you over a dozen shrimp.
It is garlicky & oily - so if you order it light on the garlic 'n oil it's even better (IMHO).

The Veal Parm is a flam-family (that's FLAMILY) staple and my mom & I can easily split it.  (Comes with a side of pasta.)

Fresh (onion-y) bruschetta arrives on the table nearly as soon as you are seated.

Cappucino is light and frothy.  (mmmn, mmmn good.)

A great place for families and kids.

I LOVE IT HERE!!  So much!

Lots of fun and nature's beauty for the whole family.  We take the kids here for a 'feeding the ducks" play date and mini hike (2-5 year olds) and they just love it.  Especially in good weather (not too hot or humid or raining).  Don't miss it!

OMG!  Dr. Dubin moved into a gorgeous new office at the Medical Tower at 16 & Walnut.  His staff is wonderful - and they even threw a lovely dinner party tonight for his patients who have referred people.  (And next week there is a cocktail party for all of the patients at large.

Who ever hears of a dentist doing these thing?

Dr. Dubin is a great dentist (first and foremost) and also a lovely person.

My next cleaning is in November - and (believe it or not) I can't wait!

I am permanently hooked on eyesite for HIGH quality, high end eye wear.
The glasses you buy here are a fashion investment - this ain't no Lenscrafters, baby.

Gene and Alya (forgive me - I bet I got her name totally wrong) are the best. I literally say - pick something for me - and they do.  And it's always FAB-u-lous.

This last time I splurges and not only bought my glasses here - but also a pair of real prescription sunglasses (not a clip like I usually get).  I feel like the fat, Jewish version of Jackie-O.

Wow.
Wow.
Wow.

If you like Modern Eye (and I do) and Alain Mikli in NYC - try Eyesite in Philly.  

Worth every dollar spent. (And I dropped almost $1K this last time.  OUCH.)

Passero's morning (and 3 PM - 4 PM ish) crew is wonderful - they move the line quickly and get my order (which varies0 correct easch and every time.

I love the iced coffee, cafe au lait and teas here.

Such a world of difference here vs Charbucks.
I also love Old City Coffee - but Passero's is right in Suburban station so I can stop there to (and from) work so easily.

Love it here!

Lily and Erin (the owners of ACW) are two sweeties who MAKE sweeties! The cupcakes are custom decorated - and the cake itself is moist and yum-a-licious. 

Need cupcakes for your kids party? Come here? Need something more upscale or elegant? Like for a wedding? They do that, too. A real find!

I especially love that I never have to bake again!  (I am lazy and need home-made cupcakes at least twice a year for my kids school) ACW to the rescue.

Give these ladies a try - MUCH better than Brown Betty!  (Sorry, Brown Betty - their cake is moister.)

Lily has a new partner now and brand-new digs in Port Richmond.
Her cupcakes won her the $10K prize on Food Networks Cupcake Wars - and she also appeared on Cupcake Champions.

Her decorations are gorgeous - but more importantly - the cupcakes taste amazing!!!

We love you, Lily!!!

I met Dr. Hopper because our kids go to the same school and when he explained his patient care philosophy (No Inurance needed) I was an instant believer.

I am so glad to have him "on call"!

A family favorite for years - and now our kid is nearly 9.
Salmon over angel hair with fresh tomato and spinach is divine.

Veal parm platter is large enough for 2 to share.
Cappucino is some of the best around.  (GET ONE!)

We love coming here at lunch time (when there is less or no line).

The owners just had a 2nd baby - Congrats!

Customer service and fine, fine, high quality eyewear from Gene at Eyesite is a luxury and a treat for me.  I now own 4 pair and I literally walk in and just have them pick out a style for me.  Really.

They always get it just right.

LOVE this place.

When I hit it big I am coming back for more!

While no longer owned by the Luberto family, the food is still magnificent here.  Our favorite Italian spot in the D-town area.

Try Chicken Marsala, Veal or Chicken parm, Crab Ravioli (a special - if they have it, get it) or anything in pink vodka sauce.

Delicious! And big portions to take some home.

Casual.

I have to give props to the 20th Street location of Whole Foods.  They did an event with my daughter's school and we raised just under $5K.

This was an awesome gift and a great way to work with the community.

Whole Foods - you have my undying support.

Andie, Amber and Especially BRIAN WONG are fantastic.
The entire team at elements provides top-notch massage therapy (and OK facials - they still need work and I can explain why...) in a relaxing environment for decent prices (Not over-priced/over-hypes like Joseph Anthony, and not "budget massage" like some other places.  Definitely NOT like Massage Envy/Hand & Stone (The "USA Today" of McSpas).

Go.  See.  Brian.

Do it now.

Your body with thank you.
He is a gifted healer.

I even send my 12 year old competitive athlete to him (I stay in the room with her the entire time.) and it has helped her so much.

We love you, Massage Envy.
When you get "rich and famous" please don't forget us!

I can not say enough great things about Gene and his staff.

My frames that I bought 2 years ago still look good as new.
Plus he adjusts them for me whenever I drop in.

The next time I need glasses (probably next year) THIS is where I will go.

It's GREAT.

Go Phillies!!!  Let's win this year's World Series.  OK?
"Nuff said.

I was a patient of Dr. Dubin's (JFK Dental) before they moved here and eventually he retired.  Leanne - the office manager is just terrific.

We moved to the "burbs - so I don't come here any more - but I was a patient for years and had some great cleanings by caring hygienists and staff.

Love. This. Practice.  (Miss Dr. Dubin, though - he is living the life in Mexico now.)

I am radiating goodness.

i will say it again.

I am radiating Goodness!

I knew right away that Brian was going to be an exceptional massage therapist.  Not only does he take great care of his clients, he is very knowledgeable about numerous techniques. I can not wait to come back again as see him for treatments.

I feel amazing!
So glad to have discovered elements.

And Andie (sp??) at the front desk is terrific, too.
So happy!

Now our dd is 7 and this place is still a multi-generational family fave.
The pizzas, pasta and (my fave) veal parm are served in huge portions (prices are not cheap but an entree for $14.95 feeds 2 easily.)

Oh - and don't miss the cappucino here - it really is a well-kept secret - what a treat!

Be prepared to wait on weekend nights.

I am never disappointed with Elements.  My daughter and I both get massages here with Brian Wong and recently I tried a facial with Candace which was very relaxing and used (good) Jan Marini products.

The front desk is great - especially Holly and Brittany.
There was a lady who was not great but she seems to be gone.

Prices are fair and the service is just terrific.

If you want to see a truly gifted healer go see Brian Wong at Elements in Media.

Can't say enough great things about Maki Motors.  Maki did a complete interior detail on my old vehicle and made it look like a new car inside.  Amazing.

Not cheap but to me, well worth it.

He was prompt, polite and thorough.
I will call him again when it's time for an exterior detail.

Great work!

A fine kettle of fish, indeed!  Otolith provides sustainable seafood (much from Alaska) - in my case, specifically salmon as a CSA-type "Share" to my group of women from the PWCG (Philadelphia Women's Culinary Guild.)

This year, I am sharing my share through Panache Foods - a home-delivery service of fresh, local produce.

Can't wait to get my individually-wrapped 1 lb packs of fresh, delcious, heathy, sushi-grade salmon!

YUM!

#ServiceStarShoutOut

Maki is amazing - I had him come a second time - this time for an exterior detail (and he vaccuumed the interior also - which I always need).
I really hope to use him again on my new car once it needs detailing.

#ServiceStarShoutOut
Always 5 star advice from the Petrillos about what type of dryer to buy or when to replace a dishwasher.  Got appliance questions?  They know their stuff.  It's a family business that I support.

It's all about the Dr. and location.
We saw Dr. Nordone in the MEDIA, PA location and my 16 year old had all 4 wisdom teeth removed under general anesthesia and had no ill effects.

She received great care.

But I would never go into Philly for this.

A delight ful lunch at a table (A TABLE!!!!!) at 11:45 AM on a Tuesday - before the crowds began, along with a stellar veggie burger (with guacamole) and divine pickled beets with heavenly (or devil-ish??) lemon ricotta has made me give them that ellusive 5th star.

A friend and I also shared the tater tots with a smoked onion creme fraiche dip (yum-city!) and our service was spot-on!

The bathroom was even cleaner - again - we were there at 11:45 AM on a Tuesday.
By the time we left at 12:45 PM - the place was PACKED.

Go today!  Get a burger!  Get some pickles. (Beets, green beans or tomatoes - all are great.)  Get happy!

OMG!!!!  We ate here (again) tonight - party of 7 including my 4 year old daughter.  Reasonable prices and just terrific Italian-American fare.  Everything from my little one's hand tossed mini Margarita pizza to classic Chicken Parm to my MIL's Lobster ravioli (a special) was wonderful.

Friendly service and just GREAT!!

Everyone in Dublin and Doylestown (and all points in between) should know about this fabulous find!

Saget;'s customer service - especially from John - the manager - is top notch.
They hand deliver and pick up my cleaning every week (or other week) right to my door.

LOVE THEM!

I stand by my words - I have now tried 6 local dry cleaners and Victory is the BEST - bar none.
I have even used their tailoring services several times (twice for small repairs on an emergency basis) for my daughter's fragile and expensive figure skating dresses and costumes (lots of sparkly things that can be pulled off.

The tailor-lady (I wish I knew her name!) is just amazing and has literally saved my kids neck (she adjusted a neckline at the last minute) just before a performance.

Missy and the other ladies behind the counter are terrific.
And the cute golden that comes in from time to time.

LOVE. IT. HERE.
As much as one can reasonably love a dry-cleaner - without it becoming weird.  Or creepy.

Anyhow - you need dry-cleaning or alterations? Prom gown stuff?  Wedding gown stuff?  Big, heavy comforters or rugs that if you try to clean at home will break your machine?  Stains?
This is the place.

No issues yet - and I have completed 2 orders so far.
Open on Sunday!!! Drop off by 11 and pick up by 4.

10% discount if you pay at drop off.

So far, so good.

I can't say enough good things about Victory - the folks who own the place and those who work here treat me so well (and candy for my 9 year old when we come).  Even their dog is wonderful.

And they clean and alter clothing just right!

Prices are high - so come on a discount day or pay in cash for 10% off.  (Stil pricey after that!)

We arrived just before Happy Hour (5 pm) officially starts and what an amazing evening of food, drinks and stellar service we experienced.

We began with expertly mixed drinks, tasty devilled eggs and always terrific pickled beets. Service from Katelyn was just perfect, but what really stood out was when Candace presented us with those delightful pickled beets, served in a mason jar on a beautiful wood platter accompanied by delectable whipped ricotta and olive tapanade.

We also sank our teeth into a well cooked yet juicy burger on a potato roll with cheddar, lettuce, tomato and house made dressing.  Recalled that backyard barbecue from childhood.

I am not a burger person, but Village Whiskey after 10 years, is still nailing it.

We love you, Candace!!!! Clearly, after 21 years in the biz, you KNOW what you're doing.  Brava!!!

A nicer ambience than El Primo (right behind it) but higher prices, too.
We had a muy authentico lunch including excellent Guacamole Morita, Tacos al Pastor (terrific flavor and the tortillas were fresh) and a sope on a scrumptious home-made masa base.

Many choices of meats and great veggies.

The star of the show was the whompin'-huge Burrito Suizo ($14 but 2 people can easily share it).

Friendly service and a great choice for super-tasty Mexican fare.

This is far and away the BEST Dry Cleaners in the area - and I have tried 4 or 5 other places.  Service (with a smile) is prompt and courteous - they even let my 9 year old used the (staff only) restroom once during an emergency.

Cute dog is there during the day.

My clothes are already clean, pressed and ready for pick-up.

Love it here!

Year after year, week after week, Victory cleaners gets it right.
Every time.

I actually look forward to (what????) dropping off and picking up my dry cleaning to chat with Missy and the other lovely ladies.

The owner is (very cute - ahem) terrific, too and even worked with me when I lost my job.

Tip - Bring cash and pay in advance for 10% off. Or - Ladies Day is Tuesday (I forget which day is men's day) and your order is 10% off.

Excellent service.
I have tried 7 (yes, seven) local dry cleaners and even though they are not the closest one to my house, I go out of my way to come here.

Seriously - they're that good.

We refer to Masquerade as "The BALLOON Store" because for us - that's mostly why we come.  They do balloons for all our parties (Helium Latex and Mylar.)  The latex Balloons come in a wide variety of colors at two for 75 cents.  Mylar are 1.99 each.

My daughter also loves the large selection of toys here.

Warning:  During the Hallowe'en rush this place is INSANELY busy.  Call ahead or come in ahead to pre-order prior to pick up.

I agree with Joy G.  The cannolli are filled to order, the taralli are the real deal, sfolliatelle,  EVERYTHING is delicious and amazing.  Be sure to order in advance for holidays like Xmas and Easter - they get BUSY.

Can't wait to visit the original location.

I just had my daughter's birthday party here and it was FAB-U-LOUS.
Allegra and the staff were all top notch and tereated us like family.  We had the entire upstairs party space which is lovely and roomy enough for our group.

The hand-frosted cupcakes tasted as great as they looked and the sugar rush was enjoyed by kids & grown-ups alike.

Can't say enuf good things about having an event here.  THANK YOU!!!!!
the owner was sooooo sweet to me when i tried on and nearly purchased a Lela Rose gown.  Stunning clothes.  LOVE IT!!!

OK, I think I may have found my new spa-home in Philly.
I followed long-time Massage Therapist, Rachel Garcia, over here from my old place, and for Rachel's massages I would follow her just about anywhere.  Love you, Rachel G! (Love Anna, too.)

I had a long, luxurious 90 minute aroma-therapy massage (Swedish with a bit more pressure just where my back needed it) and hand-selected citrus and lavender essential oils. There are over 40 oils you can pick from and they'll blend you up a customized synergy for your treatment.  Nice touch.

BLISS.

The waiting area was spacious - and even though there were 6 (yes, six) people waiting for 10 AM appointments on a Sunday, it was quiet and calm.

I was NOT offered a robe or to change, so I guess they just have massage clients change in the treatment room - which I am OK with - but it may not sit well with everyone.  One lady was wearing a robe (she was having a facial, I guess) but the rest of the 5 of us "lowly" massage clients just sat in our regular clothes.

They also sell Yeah-Baby slippers - which are super comfy.

The spa uses Yon-Ka skin care products and carries a nicely stocked array of aromatherpy products, candles and gift items.  I succumbed to a Persimmon scented jar candle - which at $6.50 (small/votive size) wasn't too bad.

There was NO pressure to buy - which was GREAT.

The owner (Jeff?) seemed cordial and the boutique person/receptionist (Stacy? Stephanie?) was very welcoming.

I will come back for a SERIES (Saves you $10 - $30 depending on the series you pick) of treatments next time.

If you are a tourist visiting Old City or a local who lives near here - Terme di Aroma is worth checking out.  And - they validate parking for select garages/lots.

Curds & Whey catered a small dinner party (9 people) for a charitable organization that I support.  The salmon, cold broccoli/craisin salad, pasta salad and enormous cookie/rugelach platter were all terrific.

The salmon was moist and perfectly cooked - accompanied with a garlicky-herby-yogurt sauce.  YUM!!!!

The owner is somehow related to one of the ladies on "the board" of the group I am in so, I bet that's why they use them - but related or not - this food was "as good as it gets".

Great job C&W!  One day I will come and eat there - I can't wait!

Such a cute little pink shop.  And the scents wafting from the window on a crisp fall day just made me HAVE to go in.  (Note:  they have sporadic hours - so read the door).  Super-friendly gals (and one guy) were baking and glazing before my eyes.

Ganache coated cookies, cupcakes, tarts.

Love it.

So glad I walked by and walked in.  Bring cash - they don't take plastic.

Absolutely thrilled with the food, drinks and fabulous service for my picky-picky all female happy hour party of 11.

Hottie bartender Paul is still there and mixes up terrific margaritas, Palomas, Mojitos and more.  Order before 6:30 PM (weekdays) and get a happy hour "classic" marg for just $5.  Also a bunch of $5 apps and $2.5 single tacos.  (The fried shrimp is good, but really bad for you.)

Tableside guac (Pricey at $11, Jicama sticks are $2 more) is always a big hit.

We had STELLAR service from Israel and all the hostesses.

Can't wait to do it again.

Yum, yum, yum, yum, yum!

Yum.

Oh yeah.

Did I mention this is the real italian sorbetto / gelato.  The sorbettos are all dairy-free and still have a fabulous rich texture.  The flavors - sublime - like Blood Orange (the real McCoy), and Campari Grapefruit.  Last year they had a summertime offering of Lemon Opal Basil.

Want something fattening and decadent?  Get a cone (the euro-style crisp cone) with a scoop of Dulce du Leche or Butterscotch and 1 scoop of deep, dark, ciocolatto sciurro (bitter dark choc.).  FREE home-made whipped cream is UNSWEETENED and compliments most selections.

Or - get a BRIOCHE, baby!  And fill it with frozen bliss.  The unsweetened whipped cream is complimentary.  You can feel your arteries clogging with each decadent mouthful.

OK, gotta go do cardio now...

Ok, now normally I would have given Under the C 4 stars - as the prices are HIGH (you are paying for that gorgeous high-rent store in the Comacast Center, BUT...

(and I usually have a really big BUT)

Now that we have met Bruce - the world' best fishmonger - the get 5 stars and our business for sure!  Bruce showed my 5 year old's Pre-K class the lobsters in the lobster tank, and even let one of them hold one.  Alas, my little one was not that one -but Bruce came to the rescue.

My little girl got her picture taken holding a huge lobster.
Plus she loves to eat the cooked shrimp.

And we love the convenience of having fresh tilapia, salmon and snapper to take home.  We are glad you are here, Under the C.  And we love Bruce.  GIVE HIM A BIG RAISE!!!

Friends of mine from High School own this fabulous local farm - and Halloween/Harvest time is a great tome to visit - also good for spring plantings - flowers, seedlings and trees/shrubs.

Terrific!

Much akin to the Tubby Olive - but better prices (and a few different sized bottles) and better tasting balsamics.  Olive oils seemed similar and some identical to Tubby Olive.

Also sells a few tapanades and Italian (pricey) honeys.

A fun place to taste and shop.
Try the Meyer Lemon infused Oil and the Fig or Cherry Balsamic.

Yum! (And great for a gift for that food lover in your life.)

Hadn't been to Capogiro in a while - and thank goodness I went today.  They have FRESH BLOOD ORANGE JUICE (squeezed to order - while supplies last - and blood oranges are around) and Blood Orange, Pomegranate and Papaya Sorbetti in stock this week.

RUN - don't walk for a taste of mid-winter sunshine.

Philadelphians - we are truly blessed to have Capogiro right in our own backyard.  Some of the best gelati and sorbetti on the Planet (better than many in Italy and NYC!).

Go, Go, Go!!!

For family theatre and accessibility to the arts, you can't beat the Arden.  We are subscribers and just saw "The Borrowers" and are planning to see "The Flea & The Professor" this spring.

Small theatre (2 stages - a small one upstairs and a larger mainstage) and there really are no "bad" seats.

Lots of fun for kids and adults, plus they offer unique classes and programs for all ages - and the FUN (forget what it stands for) lets your kid be an usher for a day and have a backstage tour.  Neat-o!

Took our 7 year old to see Robin Hood - and she also participated in the FUN (Family Ushering Night) Ushering program.  She loved it!

A great production with 5 actors playing 14 characters.
Neat!

We even got a chance to talk to the actors after the play - and saw them again eating dinner at Revloution house.

Arden is expanding to a new building for theatre camps and classes.
Can't wait to see it!

They did our 3 tiered, multi flavored wedding cake and the results were picture-perfect and so yummy.  They are pricey - but you get what you pay for.

Customer service was terrific from initial cake tasting and consultation, through color and design selection.

Perry (the pastry chef) is a master!

We loved our wedding cake.

Boy do we ever love and value the Arden.
Our 7 year old was an usher (part of the FUN - family ushering network) at a performance of "Charlotte's Web".  She learned so much and had a blast.

We all enjoyed the performance.
It's good theatre - children's or not.

Go see Charlotte's Web before it's gone. (Even if you don't have kids)

A great production!

It's such fun here.  And a good place to enjoy a cigar in peace.
Terrific, classy service (see Alexandra T.'s review).

Sexy.

Fantastic theatre in Chester County - with a lovely cafe and gift shop areas.
there really isn't a "bad seat" in the (medium sized) house.
Certain productions are geared toward families with kids.  They also have a "Teen" theatre camp.

You can even hold events in the Bistro/Barn area they own.

Wonderful staff and volunteers.

We support you!

Took my mom and my 6 year old here for a perfomrance of "The Flea & the Professor", not only was this great Children's Theater - but it was great theatre in general.  All 3 generations laughed and enjoyed.  Great actors and very good for introducing kids to the love of live performance.

We love it here.  This was our first year as subsricbers and we will subscribe again next year.

We also had awesome seats - there are NO bad seats here - small theater with good sight lines.

We loved every minute.

I can't believe that kitchenette has been here for 3 years and I have never noticed it before.

As I die-hard cookery junkie, I have shopped at many similar stores, but the lady who manages kitchenette was so cool and patient.
They were having a sale (75% off ) on selected porcelain items, and I snagged a quiche dish for $3.75.  Three seventy five!  What a deal.

I also picked up 4 basic six-ounce ramekins.  (Needed 'em to make flan.)

Attended a catered event for8-10 people and it was amazing.  A delicious pasta salad with tomatoes, spinach and feta (not too salty).  Green salad wth nuts, cinnamon pears and a Maple-Walnut dressing that was so good you could drink it.

Desserts and more!

Love this place and wish I lived closer.

I can not say enough good things about the brand and the dealership.
Maserati of the Main Line, Robert and Rick treated us so very well showing us cars that mere mortals only dream of.

Along with new and pre-owned Maserati they also carry a few Ferrari and other luxury vehicles.

You can design your car from the "ground up" down to every last detail, if you so choose.
This is a one-of-a-kind car buying experience.

Wow!

You must rush over to Capiro THIS WEEK for the most delicious and unexpected flavor yet - butternut squash.

YES, my goodness YES.

A creamy, butter, slightly squash-y (vegetal) but not too much.
Unexpected and delicious.

Oh - and the fresh fig sorbetto was amazing, too.

We are truly blessed and lucky to have Capogiro right here in our own back yard.  Some of the best gelato in the nation and maybe the world (I have had the real deal in Italy - and Capogiro is the real McCoy!)

G-d bless you capogiro.
And G-d bless the multiple-piercing-wearing hipster servers who graciously and patiently allow me to sample these exquisite flavors.

PLEASE bring back the mini cone!!!!

Now I think I am reviewing the right place - I saw a movie last night at the "Landmark East" theatre on 2nd Street between Chestnut & Walnut.  It was clean and there were no ticket lines.  Hardly anybody there - which made it nice.

Restrooms were clean - but I bet if it were crowded that it would not have been.  Concession area offered hot & cold beferages, popcorn, candy and snacks - plus you could purchase DVDs to take home.  The staff was friendly.

All in all we had an excellent viewing experience

Took gorgeous candids of my (then) 6 year old at a yelp event.
Wow.

I hired Meredith (very affordable and super timely) to take about 2.5 hours worth of candids for my mom's surprise 70th birthday.

Less than 4 days later, I had the disc in hand with over 200 images to choose from/

Great work!  Great pricing! Great Photography.

Thanks, Meredith!

OMG!  I just had one of the best lunches I have ever had in a long while.
I think whether you rate this place a 4 or a 5 can depend on your viewpoint.  The service on a non-busy lunch shift is quite different than the after-work bar scene or dinner or brunch.

Décor is just lovely and service was fine - the busser was new and clueless, but the female server was terrific.

But for lunch?  Albeit a pricey one ($70 for lunch for 2 - not including drinks or desserts, including tip).  We got 2 entrees (The crab/seafood louis - which is DIVINE) and 2 apps.  The devilled eggs (We got all peppadew - normally you get one of each in a sampler, peppadew, bacon and truffle) and a crab-stuffed piquillo pepper app (2 pieces) which was ABSOLUTELY marvelous.  Not too spicy.  Akin to a crabcake with luscious sauces on the plate.

I.  LOVED. LUNCH.  here.

I'll be back as soon as my wallet can recover.

(I am thinking Bar for Happy hour.)
A 5 star, new, clean, spacious SUPER WAWA.

I joined Philly Foodworks in the spring on 2019 after taking a few years hiatus from my old CSA.  I love that you can customize the boxes and add meat, dairy and pantry items.

The user interface is not super easy, but the customer service from Dylan and the team is so great that I don't care.  I just email changes to them if I can't get the website to work, but I almost always can.

I get an egg subscription too, and if I need to cancel it one week or three?  Nobody minds.

There is a $28 minimum (easy to meet - organic veggies are not cheap) but everything is fresh and so delicious.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!

I had an amazingly good first experience with Sweet Freedom.  I spoke to a very pleasant lady on the phone who put aside 6 vanilla cupcakes for my vegan teen's birthday.

When I came to pick them up they were boxed and ready.   I also wound up getting 6 more cupcakes in assorted flavors, chocolate, salted caramel and triple berry.

My kid loved them and shared with her friends.

Good vegan desserts are a blessing.

Thanks, sweet freedom, for supporting our animal-free diet.

Good news!  Media Bean Company now brings their fabulous breads, pies, FOCCACIA PIZZA ($4 a slice and worth every penny) and artesanal baked good to the Media Farmers Market on Sundays from 9 AM - 1 PM.

We just love that pizza - especially the kind with fresh mozzarella, fresh basil (with or without a balsamic drizzle).  My 13 year old gets 2 slices to go from the market and they are usually mostly gone by the time we drive home.

Soooooo delicious - and supports working people with disabilities.

Keep it up, Media Bean Co!

Absolutely "as good as it gets" for an "adult"  (AKA sex shoppe).
The owner was a bit chatty - and I'm really, really private about this kinda stuff - but DH & I had a nice browse through that got us thinking.

Some of the items are kinda pricey - but I am not really a comparison shopper of sex toys.

Need a new Rabbit Pearl?
Come here.

I can't say enough great things about Dylan, James and the entire Philly Foodworks team.  I am a subscribing member now and I just love this service and the best local, seasonal produce around.  So great!

OK, here's the secret to having a 5 star experience at Amada - go on a slower night (like a Monday during the summer) so that you can be seated comfortably and the noise level won't be too deafening (this is a LOUD, busy place).

Go with a crowd - we had 7 ladies and ordered 2 plates each.  Sounds like not enough?  WRONG!!!  Many of the choices are heavy. (Even at tapas size.)

Standouts amoung the 14 different items we tried?

Gambas (your basic garlic shrimp - done just right), Flatbread with Artichokes (divine), Yellow tomato gazpacho (perfect on a summer night) was garnished with crab salad and avocado ice cream (Yes - a savory icecream pluche).

The crab-stuffed peppers were so incredibly creamy, crabby and tasty we ordered one more plateful.  (So I guess we had 15 dishes among 7 ladies).

The plate of veggies (can't remember the name) was simple and perfect - tomato, pepper, onion and a delectable eggplant dip.  It was accompanied by crispy-thin bread smeared lightly with a chive goat cheese.  HEAVENLY.

Lamb meatballs were too rare (nearly raw)  for most of the groups liking, but the sherry cream sauce and fresh green peas were tasty.

The salad with figs and blue cheese came literally wrapped in Jamon.  Weird and not my bag - but it, too, disappeared.

Meanwhile, they ARE heavy handed with the salt and the (salty) cheeses - so if you KNOW this (you, smart -yelper-who-pre-reads before you go, you!)  Ask for items light on the (salt) (Cheese) (Sauce) etc.

I can't wait to come back here - at an off time - with more than 2 other people.

2 dishes apiece for 7 people came to $280 (including tax 'n tip) including ONE sangria each.  (Well, not I, I had 2 virgin mojitos with a splash of pineapple juice).  

Jose, baby,  you live up to your hype.

And I have now been to all 5 Philly Garces joints.  Huzzah!

Oh - and if you don't eat pork or shellfish - you'll have a TOUGH time here.  And if you are vegan - fuggedaboutit!  (Dairy is hidden in things)

This is pretty much "As good as it gets" for a Dollar Stiore - huge, clean, spacious, well-run store - complete with $.99 balloons (great for parties - order 1-2 days in advnace), convenient hours (even Sunday) and school supplies "on the cheap".

My 9 year old gets goodie for her "goodie bags" for her parties here - and also paper goods for some parties (Party City has more and is a bit higher prices).

My one caveat?  NEVER purchase food/consumables at Dollar Stores.

But for a Dollar Store?  This one is GREAT - and they have a nice big parking lot.

Heather is well qualified as an aesthetician and explains things very well.
Try the Hydrofacial - it is pricey but visible results!
She is a caring, kind and patient practitioner.

Excellent!

Still the best bang for the buck THAI food in the entire city.
Salmon
Curry
Tom Kha that ROCKS.

Love it!!!
And still lovin' it years later and after trying lots of Thai places in Philly. (And elsewhere)

Oh wow!!!!
Went here for a private event 4 course lunch yesterday and it was phenomenal.

The pastry chef did a baking demonstration for our group and the owner is a class act!

We started with the incredible humus on fresh baked bread.
4 types of delectable veggie salads: Carrots, beets & walnuts, red peppers & tabbouleh.  All were yummy.

Next the haloumi (fried) cheese with fig compote arrived along with crispy fried cauliflower & an heirloom tomato & sable salad.

For the entree we had either grilled eggplant (infused with pomegranite) or salmon.  Both were super tasty.

The desserts included a home-made cashew baklava with white chocolate pannagotta and fresh peaches.  Also a labneh semi-freddo (I did not care for it's tang) garnished with cucumbers and fresh diced summer melons.  The garnish tasted better than the dessert (to me).

FABulous service and a great, great meal.

G-d, I love it here.

Just got all my knives done (the ones that needed it) by Neil at the Media Farmer's Market.  He  is there once per month and worth every penny.  He does Scissors and Lawnmower blades, too.

LOVE HIM and we value his work!

Yep.  It sure does live up to the hype.

Decor:  classy - nice flooring and cool light fixtures
Service:  GREAT!  Hostess was pretty and not too icy, Chef was welcoming, servers wore cute Hebrew-emblazonned Coca Cola Tees.

Food:  Sublime!

The 4 types of hummus (we tried 2 - the one with a glob of Chick peas in the center and the Buttery one served warm which was just heavenly)

DOn't miss the salad sampler - so yummy.  8 types of cold veggie salads.

The Sabra chicken and the lamb skewers were tender and terrific.  Perfectly prepared.  The jeweled rice that accompanied the lamb was a treat.

The "old school" and "new school" phyllo desserts were terrific, too.

We did spend a bundle through - $290 (incl. tip) for 4 adults and a 3 year old who just picked off our plates.

An unbelievably excellent meal and service at Dos Gringos Mexican Kitchen. Those short-ribs were meltingly tender, and the veggie enchiladas and tostones al pastor are Da Bomb! Shout outs to Danielle and your new expediter/busser. Terrific. A +! Wonderful birthday celebration.

Greg treats us like old friends.

Much love.

This is a GREAT place to buy beef.  (For chicken I like Harry Ochs - also on the Market).  The steaks are gorgeous - and you certainly pay for that care & expertise.  The butcher will custom cut and package the meat for you (which is great for our small family.)

I love to shop at RTM and Giunta's is a welcome addition (or mainstay -  should say!).

Nice selection of ground beef, pork & veal, too.

Lovely looking veal chops - but alas, I could not afford them that day.

We had an absolutely 5 star experience today - because we got there at 8:55 AM (it opens at 9 AM) and were literally the first people in line.

My 6 year old brought her sketch pad and we sat (and sat) and she sketched the bell from front and back while the throngs walked around us.

The security guards were terrific with us - and we even took a picture with one.  

GREAT fun today!  Better than usual.

Our membership has paid for itself this year (We 've been members for many years but, thankfully, we don;t need to call often.)

We got a severe flat tire (literally, we were "screwed" as a metal screw pretty much popped the driver's side rear tire and tube) and called AAA at 1:10 PM.  They guarantee service within an hour and Ricardo Blanco from New Castle, DE arrived in 36 minutes.  G-d bless him.  He changed our tire (using our existing spare) and inflated the spare properly.

We are so grateful.

Everyone should join AAA - for real!
As always - fabulous food and service.

I can't say enough good things about Lori & Victoria at North Bowl - also John and Erin and everyone who helped make my 6 year old's birthday party with 14 5 & 6 year olds a smashing success.

The food was good - plain pizzas from rustica, veggies 'n dip, the famous tots, chicken fingers.

The bowling was great!

And the single shot on Absolut Vanille hit the spot.

Got a party to plan?  I highly recommend you consider North Bowl.

Now on my 2nd visit - I am on my way to becoming a lobstah mobstah.  This time I got 1 lobster roll and a side ($6) of Jonah Crab claws. The taste of summer in New England.

Can't wait to take my 8 year old here - she'll love it.  She's a lobster roll fan big-time.

So awesome!!!!

Even better than the original Shane's!
The fabulous guys who run the Franklin Fountain have re-opened (and gussied up) Shane's.

It's a REAL  old-time confectionary shop - replete with barley sugar (toy) candies (made in molds), chocolate creations and "penny candy" (that starts at $4 for a generous small).

My daughter (age 7) proclaimed the large plump, multi-colored and distinctly multi-flavored gummy bears, "The best I've ever eaten in my entire life!".

We are so gleefully happy that Shan'es is back - and better than ever.

See you at Valentine's Day!
And Easter!

And whenever I get a hankering for Necco Chcoclate Wafers...

Thank goodness for the new & improved Shane's!

OMG!!!! Do not let my secret out.  $2.00 Tom Ka Gai can not be beat (the most addictive Thai Coconut Soup - with chicke or shrimp - for $2.50 - or just vegetarian.)

I love the pad thai and curries, too.

CASH ONLY and you don't need much - for around $6.00 you can get a full delicious Thai meal.  (Bring some home tonight - the eat-in ambience leaves something to be desired.

YUM!!!!!!

I still go to Francis - since 2006 - and occasionally I stray.
I have "cheated" on him at high-end places and lower-end places.
I always come home to Francis - and twice I have had him rescue me from botched color jobs from other salons.

Francis is still the BEST old-school mid-priced  place for a cut and color.
I love Frances as a person and respect him as a stylist.
Over the years we have become good friends as well.

I have ALWAYS been pleased with my color here.
Love it!

We LOVE this place and always will.
The Berley Brothers rock!

Excellent gummy bears (seriously - the best my 11 year old has ever tried) and great chocolate treats.

Packaging, music, decor and experience is second to none.
LOVE IT HERE!

I get all my cooking knives sharpened every year from Neil at the Media Farmers Market.
he is a pro and can also handle scissors, Axes and even pinking shears!

Fantastic service! Fairly priced.

A five star experience with Greg & the gang (the entire crew was top notch and working hard).  Even Greg's parents were sitting next to us at the bar and enjoying their BYO Eggplant.  Jess was terrific, too!

Our 10 year old, once again, devoured her plate of surf & turf fajitas.  She loves this dish.  DH had the Seared Tuna special - and I had a bite, too.  Delish!  My enchilada was superior and the salsa verde just makes the dish.  They even had PERNIL on the menu.  Real PERNIL!  So impressive.

The service was just terrific and we were made to feel like family.
Thus - a 5 star dining experience all the way around - even on a super crowded Saturday night.

We're coming back in 2 weeks - but this time we made a reservation using their new, cool app.

THANK YOU!!!!!! (And thank you to Greg's parents for the gift of Greg.)

I concur with Carrie E and the many other 5 stars seen here.

WOWZA!

I just had my very first meal (lunch) at La Croix - and it will not be my last.
Service is top-notch.  The server called me by name (Ms. F.) numerous times during the meal.  Attentive without being over-breaing and just perfect.

My dining companion started with the onion soup - which looked marvelous, and I had a delectable tuna tartare.  The swimmingly-fresh fish was cubed and tossed with a wonderful blend of herbs and red peppers (bell peppers), It was artfully plated with tiny cubes of fried diced potatoes.

For entrees my friend had a deliicous - if a bit salty for my taste - dish of baked ham & cheese risotto - so comforting on a winter day.  I had an Or-Gas-Mic and perfectly medium rare, sliced DUCK BREAST (Don't miss this) served with halved ripened blackberries and house-made gnocchi that were heaven on a plate.

Desserts were petit amuse-bouche style including profiteroles, chai creme brulee (miniature) and a sublim Opera torte (complete with the classic gold leaf garnish.)

I was having flashbacks to my honeymoon cruise in Europe.

What a TERRIFIC place.  Much like Arnold Scwartzenager - I'll be baaaack!

I gotta try that brunch.

Twelve Baskets Cupcakes has set up a stand (again) at the Media Farmers Market on Thursday afternoons selling their pricey ($3.50 a pop) but gorgeous and most importantly moist & tasty cupcakes.  Packaging is very fancy.

The Lemongrass Blueberry intrigued - but since I was buying for the kiddo - she opted for Chocolate.  She loved it.

Many thanks. Support your local markets!

I adore much this place.  Everything from the decor and service once inside (the receptionists rudely demand that EVERYONE in your party be present before being seated - and they don't reserve for small groups.  BLAH!!!!).  The waiters are so entertaining - and even balance drinks and tray of drinks on their heads.

(Maybe one of the pre-requisites to employment there is to have a flat head?)

Anyhow, the food is really great - especially the Molcajete dishes and Guacamole.  The appetizers are great too and for lunch try the (affordable) enchildas.

Expensive - but so worth it - for true haute-Mexican cuisine.  This ain't no Qdoba and I am glad of that.

Oh - and the tequila selection and CLASSIC Margaritas are perfectly balanced, fresh and re-freshing.  LOVE 'EM!!!

This place is a true hidden treasure.  I am almost afraid to review it, lest I can no longer get an appointment due to the mad rush that will ensue

At first, when you walk by the small red-letters "Francis" are nearly un-noticeable.  Francis Salon is next door to Primo Hoagies in a row-home on the first floor.

It is a small place with 2-4 "chairs" and a single shampoo sink in the back.

Francis, himself is a maestro - a master colorist with Clairol (yes, ladies - this is old-school Clairol which is impeccably applied.)  His assistant ggives a great shampoo and massage (now don't get dirty thoughts in your head.  it's not THAT kind of massage.)

Francis sells NO PRODUCTS - but simply charges $40 for a cut $75 for a cut and single process color or $105 for a cut and a few highlights.

WHAT A DEAL and waht a life long f friendship/hairdresser relationship has ensued.

My little daughter had her very first h/c here and I had Francis do my pre-wedding color and cut. 

I love Francis - the man and the salon.

A-men!!!

I love Sook Hee's!  Even moreso now than when they first opened. Sook Hee herself is a sweetheart and the juices and fresh salads are a must when I need a healthy pick-me-up in the Comcast Center.

I just got a fresh small salad for $3.99 and it was delicious.

Now that I have explored lots of deli options in PHilly and South Jersey - I goot say - for corned beef?  Hershel's is absolutely 5 star in my book.  I often will get a 1/4 or 1/2 lb of sliced corned beef to go along with my fruits & veggies from Iovine's or Fair Food Farmstand.  A few decadent slices are all I can handle.

This is GOOD stuff!

Consistently terrific - Mama's also offers tuna, stuffed grape leaves and a variety of salads and veggies in addition to the fried eggplant, latkes and falafel.

Tahini and hummus are always a treat here.

LOVE it at Mama's - and for $9.50 including tax I can eat like a queen!

OK, maybe I am biased - because not only am I a patient, but I used to work for Dr. Snyder waaaaaaaay back when.  She is always at the forefront of cosmetic and restorative dental procedures.  She just does damned good denistry.

The office environment is clean, state-of-the-art and at the same time, warm & welcoming.  Her staff is helpful and friendly.

I have since moved away - bt anytime I am in Doylestown and need a cleaning - I go see Dr. Snyder and her hygienist.  It's a terrific practice that I endorse most highly.

This places ROCKS!!!  (And I don't really like falafel - there's is great.).

I usually get a fresh-baked whole wheat pita and a few slices of the most YUMMY friend eggplant.

The hummus is smooth and flavorful - not overpowering.
I hate tahini - so none of thast por moi, but bring on those valuable veggies.  Crisp and fresh always.

And hot young men are often manning the counter.  A-men to that!

The side bar with olives and delctable fried (a bit oily) cauliflower [and I am not normally a fan of the 'flwoer] is wonderful, too,.

Great latkes.
Great pita
Spectacular Sandwiches - and don't miss that eggplant.

This is middle-eastern/kosher paradise for vegans, veggies & carnevores alike.

You really haven't lived until you've had brunch and dinner (they are different experiences) at Commander's.

Bananas Foster is a MUST try here.

The service is white-glove and attentive.

The classic dining rooms (even post-Katrina) recall a bygone era.

It's worth the money and time to come here.  FOR REAL.

It really IS ALL THAT. Yes, it's small & loud - so if you come on a weekend call in advance and STILL be prepared to wait.

Chef RED did his thing tonight.  As did Steve, our server.
In fact, all the staff were "on point".  The sweet lady who gave us the marvelous bread (infused olive oil with a blob of lemon ricotta in the center) and kept our water glasses full is a doll. The hostesses even helped to clear plates.  Everyone pitched in and ran their asses off!  A great team.  We noticed and we love ya!

One warning - this meal is a diet-breaker.  Nothing we had was "light 'n healthy".  They should have an MD onsite to perform emergency angioplasties.

I had heard of Modo Mio for a long while - but when I tasted the Mozarella en Carroza at the "Taste of Philadelphia" event in July, I knew I had to come here.

Our party of 4 had the 4 course menu and everyone LOVED everything they had.  The house-made pappardelle with brussels sprouts, the bistecca, the skate wing - all of it.

Chef RED even sent out a platter with 6 glorious desserts on it.  Standouts were the flourless chocolate cake, tiramisu (theirs is light and wonderful), pumpkin bread pudding and home-made crusts, cookies, cremes and panna cottas of all sorts.

A near orgasmic experience at Modo Mio tonight.
Only one complaint, at 8:50 PM (We had a 6:45 reservation and were seated closer to 7 PM), they made us leave to seat the next table.  Politely.  Overtly.  But I only had like 2 sips of that wonderful coffee I wanted to enjoy.  Ah well - next time we will come on a weeknight.

WOW!!!!

Can't wait to come back. Can't wait to try Paesano.  (You do own that, right??)

Since my initial review I have been blessed, lucky and fortunate enough to dine for breakfast, 2 lunches and one life-changing dinner at LaCroix.

Last night my husband and a good friend and I shared in a wonderful meal, with top-notch service by Woody & many others.

After a round of delicious fresh-fruit laden cocktails (blood orange, blackberries, basil, lemon) we sat at a lovely table overlooking a snow-covered Rittenhouse square.  (We could see doggies playing in the snow!)

After an amuse-bouche of squab, fois-gras and horseradish foam, we had some appetizers.  My friend has the LaCroix Salad, and I enjoyed the Lamb carpaccio.

Another amuse of yellowtail was brought, followed by a lovely, simple beef consomme with a few pieces of udon, mushrooms and a single raw oyster that was gently cooked by the broth.

The main course was truly the star of the show.  DH enjoyed perfectly cooked shortribs accompanied by ricotta filled pierogie (yum!), our friends had a simple chicken and I again indulged in a lovely duck sous-vide.  

Oh - and the desserts were marvelous.  Piecrust ice cream!  Chocolate tart!  

Every bite was perfection.

A dreamy evening!

Fantastic service!  Changed our locks on-the-spot.
Woody is great and the guys are so helpful here.

Will definitely call if we need them in the future.

Please note that they did our wedding from the main HQ in Willow Grove.

They did our wedding flowers and came in at just under our budget of $1,000.  Amy was terrific and the flowers were upscale and just what we wanted.

They were excellent in their communications via email and phone.  We paid for our wedding in 3 installments, in advance.

Most of our flowers involved Bluebird roses, blue hydrangea and different colored irises (light & dark blue and purple).  The colors were vibrant and the arangements, bouquets and boutenieres (all but one - which contained white freesia) survived our 96 degree wedding day.

The flowers on the cake were gorgeous, too, as were the 10 six inch bubble-bowl centerpieces.

We love Kremps.

Right near our new house - and no lines (even on a Sunday morning).
I got the exterior wash plus interior vaccum.

For $12 this was fine - and I even bought a book of 5 washes so I can come back a bunch more times.

So far, so good.  Very pleasant experience for a car wash!

Update:  I also sprang for the $99 ($105 with tax) interior detail and they did an AMAZING job.  It looks like I have a brand-new car.  LOVE IT HERE!

The 5 stars goes to John for his incredible customer service. He personally delivered meals for my and an office mate to our office up toward Claymont, all the way from New Castle.

My friend had the Penne Florentine with Chicken and I had a delicous Veal Platter with a side of fettucine.  Everything arrived piping hot.  (Unfortunately, so did my side salad - I put it in the fridge at work to re-chill.)

Wish they weren't so far away.

Inexpensive, SIMPLE (not 5 star fancy, but 5 star tasty), classic Italian/American faves.

My little girl enjoyed her 6th birthday so much that we are having her7th here as well later this year.

Meanwhile, DH, DD and I bowl a quick couple of games today and ordered a single order of tater tots.

A fun afternoon - and even worth the 25 minute wait for a lane.  I forgot that Saturdays can be a zoo here.  Best to come at a quieter time.

Good clean family fun (and mama can even get a cocktail).

#ServiceStarShoutOut

Mike Cangemi has been my go-to plumber for almost a decade.
He is fair, honest and does quality work.
He has saved us in so many ways from a kitchen sink issue to a leaky old shower.  He even swapped out my shower head when I moved - and recommended exactly which shower head to get for my budget (There are hundreds out there.)

Can't say enough GREAT things about Cangemi and his crew.

#ServiceStarShoutOut

Still amazing food at a great (cash only) price - but you gotta go before the 12 noon rush.  We were there at 11:30 on a Monday and the place was still busy - just not crazy yet.

I got a stuffed grapeleaf platter ($9.50) and my friend got a fried egplant sandwich (I love Mama's eggplant but I just wasn't feelin' the fried today.)

The condiments on the side bar are great - don't skip those!

Cool folks runnin' the show and keepin' the line moving.
Great fun and food at Mama's!
And they always play great music in the background (if you can hear it over the crowds).

We came during an off-peak time and the park rangers were so kind to my then 5 year old who brought her easel and pencils - they let her sit and sketch - which I bet is unusual.

There was practically no line on the random weekday morning when we visited.

Mike came to give us an estimate on several small plumbing jobs.  So far we had his team complete one of the jobs (a toilet repair).

We hope to work with them for all of our residential plumbing needs.

I finally became a member in 2010 and now live much closer so I visit much more often.  The fireworks shows andconcerts are expensive - even formembers, but oh - the gardens and conservatory - every season is great. Spring with it's bulbs, orchid days and tulips, Summer with so much abundant flora and water lily\ies, Autmun with its crisp folliage, and Winter (the holidays here are amazing.)


LOVE IT HERE.

Still love it and still a member.  I now buy 2 year memberships at a time (slightly cheaper).

Even with 10% off the cafe and gift shops are pricey - but all in all we just LOVE it there so much.

You must come during all seasons.
Spring (orchids/bulbs) Summer, Fall (Mums) and CHRISTMAS is the best!

Note:  Main fountains CLOSED until 2017 for a MAJOR (and so needed) modernization.

I love Longwood Gardens.  (The do not accept a discount for PHS members though - Pennsylvania Horticultural Society).  So fork over the admission fee and wear comfy shoes.  It's an ALL DAY affair.

There is so much to see here - each season is special.  (Winter has a wonderful display in the conservatory.)  Spring is a must!  I love to wander the grounds when all my favorite bulb flowers bloom (tulips, hyacinths, daffodils, etc.)

What a national treasure.

We are members now at Longwood - as it is cost effective after 3 visits and we plan to visit 3 or 4 times this year.

The Christmas spectacular is truly amazing - but plan ahead and reserve early or you will see your favorite dates/times sold out.

Bring your own water/beverages and snaks as a hotdog is $6.50 here and the "good" food is even higher.  The over cans of beer for $8 - $10 each.  Whoa! 

The foliage, Silver Garden, Pierce Woods, Meadow and Flower Garden walk are not to be missed.

We just love it here.  Wish they offered reciprocity with PHS and other garden clubs, but they don't.  They don't need to.

Bring money for the garden shop, too.

Another delectable lunch at Matyson - house made gnocchi were light and pillowy in a light garlic and wine sauce with fresh summer veggies.  Smoked Trout on black bread is always a hit.

Can't miss at Mat-y-son.

We love you, Mai!

And we love the treats from BTH - especially the 70 cent egg tarts and $1 chocolate croissants.  The sponge cake treats in the fridge are a fave for our 7 year old.

Still some of the best tapioca pearl tea in the city!

BTH rocks!

I just can't stop raving about Matyson.  Just had lunch today - House made pappardele with kale and shortribs.  Delectable.  

Go there NOW!

Wow!!!!!  I am gonna go out on a limb here and give these fine people the full 5 stars (some may argue its a 4 star experience - but what we had last night was truly 5 stars all the way.)

NOTE:  We also went BACK on 4/4/09 and it was fabulous AGAIN!

Starting with the bar and terrific bartender who mixed me a fine Whiska-retto Sour (That's a Canadian Club Whisky Sour with a splash of Amaretto to sweeten it up. - YUM.).  The bar has a retro feel with colored shelves that slant at different angles to display the bottles of liquor.

Next we (there were 4 of us) were seated by our gracious host/waiter/manager (possibly owner?) and ordered lots of tasty treats.

We started with an appetizer course.  I had a terrific goat cheese (mild - not too goaty) and beet salad.  2 of us has the slightly salty but very tasty French Onion Soup, and we all tasted the Chicken Shumai (obviously frozen - but tasty nonetheless.).

Also the stuffed portabello mushroom is SO TERRIFIC.

Since one of the entrees - Pasta "Mikey" appealed to all of us - we ordered one order and split it 4 ways on 4 little plates as a pasta course.  The pasta was penne, coated in a rich, creamy pink sauce accented with shavings of proscuitto.  Very tasty and perfect as an app.  (May be too rich to eat a big plateful.)

For entrees the standout was the lamb - a gorgeous frenched rack of 8 chops total, served with airy riced potatoes and asparagus spears.  The meatlof entree (with more of the delicious mash) and my husband's "special" of flaky-crusted chicken pot pie, all disappeared.

We were nearly stuffed by now, but stayed for delicious rich cups of freshly brewed coffe and decaf.  And split amongst us 1 cheesecake (classic and creamy) and a decadent chocolate bourbon pecan pie.  (The crust of which was outstanding.).

We have returned twuce.  What lovely evenings we have had,  surrounded by gorgeous decorations and the classic portraits that adorn the walls.

This is a unique place that seems like "nothing" when you walk by.  Go INSIDE!!!  Go!!!

You will not be disappointed.

The Equinox cheese is fabulous!  Birchrun Hills Farm sells cheese at many local farmers market (I usually see them at Media and Headhouse.
They also make blue and "Fat Cat" - a semi-soft cheese.

They also supply veal to local restaurants.

Good local stuff!

Ok - I upgraded them to 5 stars based on our last visit (we have now been there about 4-5 times.)

This time we came with our 6 year old at night and had pancakes, a chef salad (with delicious FRESH cooked turkey breast) and FABULOUS home-made pierogi.  Do not miss them.

The re-modelled and added 2 new bathrooms (lovely) and I just love the Court Diner.

Yum, yum, yum, yum, yum!

Yum.

Oh yeah.

Did I mention this is the real italian sorbetto / gelato.  The sorbettos are all dairy-free and still have a fabulous rich texture.  The flavors - sublime - like Blood Orange (the real McCoy), and Campari Grapefruit.  Last night they had a summertime offering of Lemon Opal Basil.

Want something fattening and decadent?  Get a cone (the euro-stle crisp cone) with a scoop of Dulce du Leche or Butterscoth and 1 scoop of deep, dark, ciocolatto sciurro (bitter dark choc.).  FREE home-made whipped cream is UNSWEETENED and compliments most selections.

Or - get a BRIOCHE, baby!  And fill it with frozen bliss.  The unsweetened whipped cream is complimentary.  You can feel your arteries clogging with each decadent mouthful.

OK, gotta go do cardio now...

4 stars for the spa - but 5 STARS for Cheryl Lee - the best damned nail technician that I have ever known.  Her spa pedicure is worth every penny and is like heaven on earth for me.

Well - I am one of Cheryl lee's faithful following.  Cheryl is just about the BEST nail tech you'll ever know.  I came to spa elysium on a very hectic, very icy, overbooked day before Xmas.

The expansive salon (spa is downstairs - nails & hair upstairs) was buzzing with activity and the front desk greeters were just not paying attention.  There was NOWHERE to sit in the waiting room (it was that packed) and many stylists were running late so people were getting grumpy.

Meanwhile, sunny Cheryl was running right on time.  (I arrived by train about an HOUR early.)  I started with a luxurious spa pedicure - which I can not recommend enough.  I also indulged and got a spa manicure ($25 vs. the regular $18 mani.)  Next time I will get a regular mani.  The extra exfoliating scrub was nice - but not needed each and every time.

I just love the way Cheryl does her nail services.  Very clean, thorugh and attentive to details.  My feet were smooth and cuticles neatly cleaned up. The polish was applied precisely and immaculately.

Cheryl - you are 5 stars in my book - but please tell the spa management teamt o shore up their front desk operations.  A busy spa/salon needs freindly attentive people at the front.

I am literally in Paradiso after dining with our special-occasion graduation party of 9 last night.

We had a 5:30 reservation and the place was empty on a Thursday night - which was actually great as we got stellar service from the male server, female bartender/water glass filler and the 2 chefs in the back were really on point!

Started with a round of (pricey) drinks including Belvedere on the rocks, Stoli-O and a glass of Prosecco with a hefty splash of cranberry. Also some folks chose unsweetened iced tea.

Appetizers were monumentally delicious, especially the escargot, 1/2 order or sweetbread ravioli and burrata served with thinly sliced golden beets.

One lady ordered the special app - a HUGE charcuterrie plate with 6 different Italian cured meats including prosciutto and GUANCIALE.  Heavenly! (Plus garnishes including crostini and lovely artichokes.)

Our meal continued with entrees (A bit pricey at 25 - 35 a pop and the special - a huge steak for 2 was $70!!!) that were generously portioned.  Hamachi was gorgeous as was the stuffed veal breast.  I had the duck breast (served med-rare with the perfect amount of Quack!) and polenta.  So terrific.

Deeserts were the only place Paradiso fell short.  While the ricotta cheese cake was silken and lovely, the bombolili were heavy as lead.  (Fortunately the house-made Gianduja was lick-the-bowl worthy!).

Service was a dream.

Can't wait to return.

Ok, it's official.  We are now friends with the owner/baker Mai.  She also has an adorable 7 year old daughert and 1 other child.  They treat my daughter like family whenever we come in for sponge cakes and shrimp dumplings.

And we never spend more than 5-6 dollars - ad you get so many treats for such a small sum.

There are still only 2 tiny tables out front - and today there was a gaggle of elderly men chatting away and laughing over 60 cent cups of coffee.  This place is a gem.

My little one ate her shrimp dumplings, a hot dog bun, a piece of cream-filled sponge cake and then colored in her coloring book while I watched the steady stream of customers come in and out to pick up cake orders, loafs of freshly baked bread and lots of fresh-cut mango bubble tea.  ($3.00)

Don't miss a chance to support a terrific TRUE CHinatown neighborhood, family-run business.

YUM!

I had a party for 11 people and had Panda Express cater it.
We ordered 2 Panda Feasts and a tray of 12 Veggie spring rolls.

The food arrived hot, fresh and on time.
