Jay - the manager and Rob - who delivered the food - were great to work with and even gave us additional side orders of Fried Rice and Noodles - so we had ample food.

The Honey Walnut Shrimp was a big hit.
We also got Chicken & Broccoli and Beef & Broccoli for "safe" choices.

Everyone enjoyed the food - and the price was withing my budget.

I will definitely use them again.
I am so amazed at how good this "fast food" Chinese is - especially when they cook it fresh to order.

We are treated so very well whenever we visit the court (usually for breakfast or lunch),
Don't miss the home-made pierogies.

Good coffee and moderate prices.
Is the food 5 star (not really)?  No, but the service is so nice and pleasant.

Love coming here.

2 words:

Butterscotch Krimpets

An outstanding performance of "Down Past Passyunk" - truly remarkable. The quality of the acting and directing was high and the set design.

I can't wait to see the next play - "Ritu Comes Home".

Innovative theater at a moderate cost.
Support local theatre - thay need it!!!

I just had a 5 star, incredible lunch at Matyson.
The crab crepe app ($8) is one of the best things I have ever tasted.  A light, home-made crepe with a delectable creamy-sweet crab filling.  Basil oil drizzle and lightly vinaigetted micro-mache on top.  Mmmmmmn!

And how could I resist (I could not) the KALE SALAD.

My fave!
My love!

I love you Matyson.
You rock my culinary world.

A truly excellent source for kitchenware, cutlery and gadgetry.  They have a large selection and can order whatever you need if they don't have it in stock.  Plus, the Italian Market location makes it easy to snag some fresh ingredients to use in your newly procured kitchenware.

I also enjoy shopping at Kitchen Kapers.

Another outstanding review for nail technician extraordianaire, Cheryl Lee.  I visited the spa today for a standard pedicure (I usually get the spa pedi) and "regular" manicure.  Both were top notch.

Cheryl is only there on weekends now, but I wish she were there more.So book an appointment in advance.  She is worth it and in demand!  I hope the management there knows what a gem she is.  her pedis last for weeks - and her polishes are precisely applied.  She uses a pre-basecoat drying treatment (when indicated) that helps the base coat (Seche Clear) to bond to the nail plate.

She also uses Seche Vite top coat which is an HG (Holy Grail) product in the nail tech world.

Can' say enough good things about the nail services at spa elysium - done by Cheryl Lee.

P.S.  The spa itself is a 4 star operation.  They have a NEW front desk person (at least she seemed new to me) named Amy who was cheerful and a big improvement.

If I lived in Chestnut Hill this would be my go-to spa.  It blows Spa 3000 BC away!!!

Just had another FABULOUS Phacial with Elina and she ROCKS.  What sweet, caring, knowledgeable skin-care expert.  Love her and love her treatments.

She used a Vitamin-C exfoliating micor-powder and natural oatmeal, honey and Indian clay (not in that order) to help my face and neck look A-MA-ZING!

Can't wait to go back to Ursula's and see Elina again.  Oh - and try the Nirvana Treatment - it's heavy on the massage and feels so great.  75 minutes of relaxing bliss!!!

Cafe au lait and 3 beignets and I am in total heaven!
Be careful not to inhale the powdered sugar - I have accidentally snarfed some up more than once.

Soooooooo greasy and hot and good.

Such a zoo of a tourist crowd.

So worth it though.

I have ordered from the Broomall, Southampton (Bucks County) and 13th Street (Center City) locations of Fruit Flowers.  Ellen in Broomall is a joy to work with.  She made a "Tropical Sundae" fruit arrangement for a co-worker and it was delivered as specified PERFECTLY.

She even added 3 extra choclate dipped strawberries.

These fruit creations really do taste as good as they look - just be sure to order seasonally - pineapples and strawberries can vary in ripeness throughout the year.  Spring and Summer arrangements taste better in my opinion.

Fruit Flowers is a great alternative to simply sending flowers.  Great for condolences, thank you gifts and of course birthdays and anniversaries.

We also had one delivered to the restaurant where we had our wedding rehearsal dinner (that was handled by the BucksCounty/Southhampton store).

I love this concept and the execution!

My daughter and I come here ALL THE TIME for the gorgeous playground, fountain, sand castle sculpture and free historical stories told all summer long.

We occaisionally splurge on the $3.00 a ride carousel (that is pricey if you need to accompany your little one it's $6.00 - and just TRY telling my little one that she can only ride it once.

Good luck.

Anyhow, they also have a mini golf course and a fancy schmancy new snack bar.

Bathrooms that are relatively clean, too.

GREAT PARK.

Thankfully they restored my childhood theater, the County, in Doylestown, to its former glory.  Now they show alot of art-flicks and culturally sensitive  and independant films.  They have a great series of films each season and also show some "blockbuster" type films, too.

Best part?  I can walk here from my childhood home and graba yummy treat at Coffee 'n Cream afterward.

It is truly a blessing to have Capogiro right here in Philly.  This gelato/sorbetto is some of the best in the world!  The WORLD!  Better than places in Italy, NY, LA and many others.

LOVE!!!

Run, don;t walk, here to try some.
We return again and again.

Back again - this time for lunch - kale salad is my fave and the tuna tartare on toast (with zesty tonnato sauce) hit the spot!

Patient kind service - they now know me!
LOVE LOVE LOVE it here!

Fan-frikkin-tastic.
Super fresh foods for meat eaters and vegetarians.  4 kinds of Tabbouleh - one with Quinoa.
Lentils.  Eggplant.  Labni.  Dolmas.  Schwarma.

I'm in heaven!

One of the best La Colombe cafe au laits that I have ever had.
Puts Starbucks to shame!

Lovely!

Friends don't let friends drink Charbucks.  (Ok, Ok, I still drink it sometimes...) But not when 7 Stones is so conventient and wonderful.  Between the La Colombe coffee drinks and a huge selection of teas, fine pastries, quiche and even ice cream, this place is a WINNER in every way.

Love. Love. Love it here.

Absolute perfection (and you pay for that!).  I attended a corporate holiday soiree complete with 2 bands, a DJ, a photo booth, Open bar, lavish cocktail hour and a "stationed" dinner with Carving station, sushi, sliders, Italian/Pasta station and more desserts than any diabetic has a right to enjoy.

The coat check, restrooms, bartenders, food service folks and management were all TOP notch.

Wow.

Like a frikkin' wedding.
Or Bar Mitzvah.

Amazing!

Still great - and nice new digs.
Taco Salad is great with (small, but plentiful) grilled shrimp.

Corn Tacos al Pastor are always a tasty winner.

Friendly service and quick, too!

5 stars for service from Emily (and the male manager and a pink-haired server who's name I did not catch).

Emily served our group of 9 ladies for a long-awaited and long-planned Happy Hour.

We got a large table (a few tables pushed together) in the back and ordered apps to share (delicious fried Brussel's sprouts and thick-cut sweet potato fries with 2 delectable dipping sauces - try the vanilla sauce).

Folks ordered their own drinks and dinners - but 4 of us had the pan-seared scallops with a creamy risotto.  DIVINE.

Our only complaint?  The $15 nachos (close to $20 if you want chicken) used to be an enormous platter - not anymore.   The nachos are still wonderful but you get much less - plenty for 3 people - but not for 9.

The 5 stars goes for the tremendous service including separate checks and rushing in a happy hour order (Iron Hill's Happy Hour drink specials end at 6 PM!!!!) for us.

So glad I planned my Ladies Night Happy Hour here.

I hosted a party for a group of 20 at Iron Hill and things went WAY better than ever expected or imagined.

We enjoyed delicious nachos, wings, guacamole, crab quesadilla, cheesesteak egg rolls and a few folks ordered dinners.  There were Salmon, Scallops  - and my 9 year-old demolished a big plate of fettuccine carbonara (Ah to be 9 again and to be able to eat like that). Desserts like cheesecake and the Chocolate Brownie Sundae (it has a special name) were show stoppers. (And many pints of Raspberry Wheat were consumed as well).

We are so pleased and grateful to our server, Megan and all the expediters, servers, bussers and hosts/greeters for a wonderful and fun evening.

I would not hesitate to recommend Iron Hill to friends and colleagues when planning their holiday parties or other group events.

What a great experience.

Brava!

I see Dr. Brian Feeney (Dr. Steve is often way overbooked) as does my teen daughter, my ex husband and my daughter's figure-skating coach.

He is wonderful and has helped me to manage occipital, neck and shoulder pain.

Can't say enough great things about his work.

Limited hours and days so book early.

What a beautiful community resource! 

The library has a children's department, lots of space for adults to read and do research, computers and group activities.

They offer story time for little ones and Japanese Anime for teens.
There is a conversational French group, too.

Oh, Zama - you truly rock my sushi lovin' world.
Tonight I dined alone but was still treated well (thank you!) as I sat at the 8 chair sushi bar and watched the chefs work their magic.

A single negi-chu-toro hand roll was buttery perfection.
A $28 (7 piece nigiri) of market specials was delicious and 5 of the 7 fish I had never tried or never even heard of.  All delicious.

Perfectly marinated ikura (salmon roe) - although for $5.00 a piece - the portion was very tiny.  (Like 18 eggs or so.  Come on, guys!)

And for "dessert" 2 perfect slices of house-made tamago (none of that frozen garbage here!).

Domo! Domo!

I am infatuated (once again) with Zama.  Decor is Zen, sleek & lovely.  (Look up to see the giant Koi above you.)

$60 including tax 'n tip (no alcohol) is pretty steep though.  My husband may freak out on me.  It also underscores what a GREAT value Doma is and how high-priced Morimoto is.  (Zama is right in between.)

A great source for poultry - whol and parts (and eggs!) right in the Reading Terminal Market.  Ground Turkey, turkey and chicken cutlets, boneless skinless chicken thighs and whole fryers are some of the GREAT things I have bought here.

Great place!

Since my last update, we have been to Doma 3 or 4 times including New Year's Eve (amazing) and last night just me and my 6 year old.

She ate 2 orders of Shrimp Shumai. and a bunch of edamame.
And then she said, "Mommy, I don;t want any chocolate lava cake this time".

Smart kid.

I had the Naked Salmon roll (sans jalapenos) and it was so good, I ordered a second one.

And that was it.

2 rounds of Shumai 'n salmon.

And we were stuffed.

Dan & the guys are so great with my little one.  She loves to sit at the high-top tables in the back.  (I prefer the regular tables, but I was out voted.)

Oh - and if you go to DOMA - save room for dessert (if you can).  The mochi-coated strawberries dipped in fudge and chocolate lava cake (sounds trite - but they make a good one) are amazing.

5 stars for Zori and Tanya - the dynamic duo of nail technicians.

Yes $73 for a mani/pedi is way too rich for my blood (plus they charged an extra $10 to soak of gel - my salon charges $5 for a soak off - and I only had it on 7 fingers). 

But the results are amazing.
For a special treat (I had a gift certificate for a mani/pedi that I won in a charity auction)- I would not hesitate.

A regular mani alone is $23.  Youch!!!

Simply stunning!  George Baker provided all the floral arrangements for my former law firm - and also sent arrangements to all new hires (nice touch!).  The floral choices were always high-end and fresh.  No carnation and babies breath here.  

Fresh Delphinium, Alliums, Bells of Ireland, Lilies, Rare Orchids - the works.

I love George Baker.  Pricey - but so worth it.

Elegance in a glass container!

Doma!!!!
What a treat to be able to dine here again.

Tonight re-affirmed that Doma is one of the best restaurants in the city.
It's my fave and my 9 year kid (who has been coming here since age 3 or 4) loves it too and scarfs down salmon sushi, edamame and her favorite - BIG shrimp shumai.

I had a delectable Kalbi dinner with 9 large pieces of tender, juicy short-ribs.
DH had a variety of sushi including our love - the Naked Salmon.  (try this!!)

Thank you DOMA (and Pat and staff) for wonderful food and service for all these years - and hopefully many more.

We love you!! (And we miss you - now that we are out in the 'burbs.)

5 stars for $1 (mini) canolli day!  We stocked up on 12 canolli and they were gone in a flash.
Happy husband, happy kid and kid's friends. (We got 6 ricotta and 6 vaniall Italian cream.)

YUM!!!

We are so lucky to have Viso's right in our own back yard.

Updating my review - and once again terrific food and service (by John).
The black belt sashimi plate (great for 3 to share) had Chu Toro, Kanpachi, Salmon-toro, branzino, Saba and many other tasty fresh fish.

NY Strip Strips were amazing - especially the asparagus and "magic" mushrooms it is served with.

Calamari Salad and red miso soup are also good choices.

A  winner!

The Tobin's ROCK!  Mrs. T and her 4 kids (and 4 horses) now have an official fan club - headed by my 7 year old.  Their store offers holistic, healthy foods and supplies for dogs, birds, horses and more.  Plus- they carry California Natural - which is what our 14.5 year old pug ate for years.

We love the owners, the store, the kids, the horses.

Own horses?  Gotta check them own.
Own a dog or cat?  Same.

Oh - and birdseed?  Tons of varieties.

LOVE!

For a bar this is truly as good as it gets.

We had a Food Coma inducing lunch at TJ's Restaurant & Drinkery today - but soooo delicious. BLTC&E (Bacon, Lettuce, Tomato, Cheddar and a fried egg - on Rye with a light smear of lemon aioli. - WOW!) Everything I have ever ordered here has been terrific and the hostess (older lady) is delightful. Love this place!!!!

My colleague ordered Mac & Cheese with Bacon & Tomato - and it, too, was delicious but a full plate of that would send me straight to nappy-land! 

I wish they'd offer a side of the plain Mac or a 1/2 order. PLEASE CONSIDER THIS!!!!!

 Oh - and the Turkey Cobb is amazing too (sounds like whatever - but the turkey is fresh roasted and the composition is ON POINT.)
#FoodOnFleek

Alma, you never disappoint me.  I hade my birthday party here in March (11 women with mucho mojitos, caipirinhas and many apps.)

Tonight however was a simple evening - executied perfectly.  A close coleague and I shared the divine thinly-sliced scallop ceviche - bright with tangy acidity.

We also shared (gotta have 'em) the tuna tartare tacos and royal palm dates.  A heavy but delicious bowl of duck confit fried rice - brimming with umami goodness, topped with poached egg and studded with currants and edamame beans.  And of course, a sweet side of maduros with a drizzle of crema.  (Who needs dessert?  Heck, who needs entrees? We were stuffed.)

Instead of dessert she had a Mighty Leaf tea and I got a delicioso cafe con leche.

What a meal!  What a night!

And fabulous service from the lovely lady who served us.   I wish i could remember her name, but I just can't.

Oh - and I had 2 virgin Clasicos and my friend had a black cherry caipirinha and a Clasico Mojito.

Still on top of its game.

Love you Doug-y baby!  Even though you beat my sorry a$$ on "Ready Set Cook" in 1996.  Poor me - I was paired with a wimpy pastry chef from California.

OMG - I just went Liqueur crazy and Lambic nuts in here today - with a wide variety of every alcohol under the sun.

So enjoyable to shop at an alcohol supermarket.

No more studio fees!  Hooray!

Marcy - the former book-keeper who now owns the place, is a doll and P'nina was lovely and helpful as well.  We had a large event with 16 women there and the Expressive Hand treated us so well.

We could bring our own food - and Marcy even helped us find a Kosher caterer!

The ladies in the group all loved painting their creations.  We can hardly wait to come pick them up.

Thank you Expressive Hand.  We love ya!

(And they still teach ASL - American Sign Language.)

I preedict a childs birthday here in my future.

Zori & Tanya left - they moved to Florida, but the new ladie I had(9can not remember her name but she's been there about 8 months and is VERY nice.) did an OUTSTANDING traditional ($55 - ouch!!) Pedicure.

Luckily I had a $50 gift card so i only had to pay $5 plus the tip.
As a regular thing?  I can never afford to come here, but if you have lots of disposable income, Curries is a great place.

I came on a Summer Monday during the day and it was nearly empty - which was GREAT.  Saturdays are crazy-busy - especially around the holidays.

They have a HUGE retail area downstairs also - nothing but retail.  Wow.

I had a wonderful spa pedicure ($63 - but I had a $25 gift card so that made it worth it for me) with Zori (sp??) from Bulgaria.  She and her sister are both FANTASTIC nail technicians and this was one of the BEST spa pedi's (CND and OPI products) I have had in a long time.  I chose the Ginger Lime scent (there were 4 or 5 to choose from) and the scrub and massage lotion (plus a few drops of essential oil in the foot bath) smelled heavenly.

Reception was warm and friendly - even though the place was PACKED on a busy suburban Saturday.

I can't wait to come back. The prices are on the high side - but so far, I am so pleased.

Tons of retail products for sale (first floor is 100% retail).
ATM on premises.

Must tip in cash.

Stopped in for a mini canolli but kiddo wanted a $4.25 slab (huge slice) of REAL Italian cheese cake.  Divine.

We love Donna and the staff here.

We just can't say enough great things about the REAL Italian desserts baked here.
And thanksgiving pies for $8 - $15 that beat the crap out of Linvilla (Sorry Linvilla - we love you too - but for pies you gotta try Viso's.).

And don't miss $1 canolli day (get in line early and bring cash) every summer.

What a great place!
They make their own ice cream (not soft serve) and have great flavors.
Caramel Macchiato had a substantial swirl of sot caramel in it.
Banana ice cream was rich in Banana flavor.
Cake, Pretzel, Waffle and Sugar cones available.
Excellent and friendly service (and they get PACKED).

Cash only.

Wonderful, new & clean. Plenty of picnic tables out side to eat at.

Kudos to Chef Joe (Chef Joe Koye) for a delectable gluten-free meal for our event last night at a private residence.  We had several Kosher and vegetarian people plus the hostess is a gluten-free celiac person, so we really enjoyed the creative buffet as follows:

A gorgeous whole poached salmon - artfully presented on a bed of thinly sliced lemons.  The "scales" of the fish were thin slices of cucumber - stunning!  The accompanying cucumber/dill/cream was yummy.

On the vegan side we had a lovely wild rice salad with black beans, a fresh salad of haricot verts and red peppers (simple and tasty) and my favorite QUINOA - this quinoa was lightly dressed in a lemony/oil (but it was not at all oily) and contained halved, red tear-drop tomatoes, magical mushrooms and sweet, sweet summer-fresh corn.

That Quinoa was a five star delight in and of itself.

What a feast!

I am lovin' Wild Blue and will definitely use them when I have a need for private catering.

Now that we've moved to a house in the "burbs, how I miss my beloved DOMA more than ever.

I popped in at 5:15 ish (they don't open until 5:30) and was seated anyway - and waited a while and relaxed.

Ordered a Naked Salmon (not a maki at all - but gorgeous salmon over an avocado puree atop crispy fried (evil but so good) rice.  More like a canape.

Tuna Hwe dup bap was sublime - uber-fresh quail egg yolk, crisp cucumber and cool asian pear.  (The toasted pine nuts are no longer on it - too bad.)

I miss it here!!!

Freakin' awesome when eaten in store.
Had a $3.00 (tax included) single slice of a fresh white pie with arugula, a sungle large artichoke heart (and stem) drizzled in a sweet baslamic glaze.

For me - this is the penultimate of pizza.

Seating is limited.

Family dinner on a Sunday night (not crowded) at Doma was blissful and AWESOME as usual.  We are regulars now and they ALL know us (for better of for worse, I guess.)

DD enjoyed her shumai and a DIY Salmon roll.  Dh had a plate of various rolls including the decadent Naked Salmon roll (served on crispy rice).
I had a Negi-hamachi handroll (lightly chopped upon my request) that was sheer perfection.

A gratis hamachi naruto was our luscious gift from the chefs.

We love you, Doma - see you again May 19 if not sooner.
This is my 6 year old's favorite restaurant ever (and she's been to quite a few, believe it or not.)  DH & I love it here too. We thank you for always accomodating our family (some folks cringe when they see a family with kids).

Do you love sushi?  Do you like Korean or Japanese influences?  You MUST try DOMA.  

P.S.  If you are a sushi purist - this place may not be for you - I have learned with time which dishes to order sauceless or with sauce on the side.

Went there again!!!!  This time alone - no kid, no DH and ordered the $42 Omakase sushi/sashimi platter and nothing else (and I was stuffed to the gills - pun intended).

I poissoned myself with fresh lucious fish - hamachi, sea bass, salmon, tuna, 1 piece of buttery toro, a single sweet shrimp.  A small piece akimono (fish liver - the foie gras of sushi), a gently torched single scallop and some poppin' fresh ikura completed the mix.

A house-made piece of perfectly balanced tamago was my dessert.

And a roll - topped with chopped hamachi. (This roll changes based on your preference and the chef's choice.  TELL them what you like and don't like).  The chef here ROCKS.

Mmmmmmmmn.

Omakase heaven.

Mine, mine, mine, all mine.
Wish I had brought a split of Cava.

No kid!!!!

Bliss.

What a lovely store - with everything you need for baby, toddler, young kid and even a few things for parents.

Decor, clothing, furniture and a wall of amazing clocks.

The owner is terrific and we wish her much success.

OMG - It's a veritable grocery store for wine, beer, spirits - even mixers and snacks.  High level of customer service and a the wine tasting man (on weekends - selected hours) offers advice and tastes.

A great place to pick up some wine - or try a new one.

Still showin' the love for Doma - same great owners and some not-so-new faces on the staff (Yuli is an amazing server/hostess).

We enjoyed a plethora of uber-fresh sushi and sashimi delights including the ever-popular "Naked Salmon" and the not-to-be-missed Omakase maki.  We also shared a Bento Dinner with Salmon Teriyaki, Chicken Yakitori, a Yellowtail Scallion roll and more.

Korean Taco app is fun (also ask about the truffled-tuna nachos - we did not try but they look terrific).

The triple spicy double tuna roll is a fave with the men in my life.
Pachinko roll (not ordered this time) is a hit with the kids.

I truly miss coming here all the time and I make it a point to get a Doma-Fix whenever I am nearby.

P.S. - My now 13 year old kid scarfed down all the leftovers the minute I walkd through the door.  She has been coming here since she was 4 or 5 and it's her favorite restaurant EVER.

The real deal!  Yum Yum is a local chainette of REAL donut shops and they kick ass over Dunkin and other mass-produced chains.  The chocolate honey-dipped donuts are so great!

Crazy fattening - and try to get 'em while they are hot in the early morning (like 6-7 AM.).  

Decent coffee and hot cocoa, too.

Love me some yum yum!

OK, I don't eat pork and even still (menu is pork heavy) this places ROCKS my world.

Hands-down best Mojitos (get the classico - don't fart around with mamby-pamby-fruities) and Caipirinas anywhere.  You could drink yourself silly.

The ceviche is fresh and lovely - if just a hiar on the salty side.
The chicken soup came with fresh peas that the ladies shelled that morning.  My husband (back then fiance) had the Lechon - roasted piggy - which I could not eat - but he loved it.  The Vaca Fritta was spot-on old-school style.  EVERY BIT was worth the elevated calorie count.

Yes, it's a "scene" (what Starr joint isn't?) yes it's uber-expensive and YES IMHHHO it is worth it.

Go for a birthday - or if you can expense it, or if a date will take you - but try it - at least once.  It is an EXPERIENCE and I loved every minute of it.

For $15 you can eat like a king or queen with the lunch special.
A friend and I each chose apps (Guacamole - which is great here - albeit topped with Cotija cheese that I can do without.).  They offered a salad with pomegranates again!  (Yay - but not too many in there.) The kale and romaine were adorned with a single deep-fried egg (wow) and bits of bacon.

We both got the shortrib huarache (masa-based flatbread) and it it delicious (and rich!).

The plantanos are not available for lunch but they made them for us anyway.  Perfection!

Margaritas and Mojitos here are always freshly muddled and top of the line.

For $60 or so we ate so well!

I organized a Happy Hour for 7 women and we had a BLAST last night.
Our servers Megan & Jasmine took excellent care of all of us - and even "split off" our bill into different permutations of food and cocktails.

The Happy Hour specials ($6 apps and certain drinks) are a great value.

We had several orders of Tuna & Marlin tacos, Dates wrapped in bacon (so good), Truffled Guac, Empanadas and more.

I even got a side dish of the duck confit "fried" rice.  It came with a scary-looking poached egg on top - but man - once you broke that egg open and savored the rice, pine nuts, currants, duck confit and crunchy goodness - WOW.  It was a flavor blast on so many levels.  For $9 this "side" was more like a meal.

Definitely love the mojitos and alma coladas here.

What a terrific restaurant on all fronts - food, decor and service.  All 5 star.

Douglas - you are a MASTER of your craft.

This place ROCKS my world.
The only complaint would be the noise level (we went on a Saturday Night) and the frenetic pace in which the courses were served - but heck - with all that yumminess going around - no complaints here.

I started with a Distrito (read: basic) margarita - rocks, light salt rim - and wow - SO great.  I can judge the margarita when there is no fruit muddled in, no chi-chi twists, just pure Margarita goodness.

My dining companion and I both started with salads - the chopped salad - topped with crispy tortilla strips in a luscious buttermilk-chipotle dressing, and the GRENADA - you HAVE to try this in season - it is topped with a layer of jewel-like pomegranates and roasted pepitas.  Crunchy, crisp and fruity with a bite from the pequin.  YUM-I-NESS!!!

Then we had the House-made chips, salsa and guacamole (10 - yikes!).  The chips and salsa were top notch and re-orderable - but with all the other great things to eat this is (*gasp* - can't believe I'm about to say this...)...

...the first time that Guacamole was an afterthought for me at a Mexican restaurant.

Xochitl's guac was better - had a better flavor profile and was table-side prepared.  Not so at Distrito.

Anyhow, we had a superb side order on Plantains & Crema (De-lump-scious).

My friend had the chicken tacos (not so great - sauce seemed to be an odd concontion of Hot Sauce, Sugar and Barbecue sauce.  Not a fave - but still edible.  I had the "quesdailla" - which looked more like fried pierogies, stuffed with w super-yummy pumpkin (calabaza) and cheese mix.  So decadent.

We were sooooo full by now - but could not resist the Churros - and were we glad we ordered them.  (Even better than Xochitl's)  9 mini churritos sprinkled with a vanilla bean sugar and served with a small (wish there was more...) scoop of home-made coffee ice cream  (WOW!!!!) and a tall shot glass full of warm Mexican chocolate and a top layer of dulche du leche.  ADDICTIVE!!!!    One could have easily downed the shot and licked the glass.

On weekends (we were in luck) there is a talented Mariachi singer.  He belted out Billy Joel's "Piano Man" in Spanish.  Service was attentive but I did feel rushed - especially when nearly everything came out at once - it was like "SENSORY OVERLOAD".  Our great looking male server helped!  It was also very, very loud in there.

I would like to come back her on a Tuesday at 5 PM or another "off time" so I can hear myself think.
I hovered between 4 & 5 stars and went with the five - because it really is a remarkable restaurant.  (Much better than Tinto.  I am jonsein' to finally try Amada.)

The bill for 2 including - only 1 alcoholic drink - tip & tax was exactly $80.00.

What a treat!
I dined alone (again) at the sushi bar and (again) enjoyed the limeade.

My server, Merci, was so sweet and accommodating.
The sushi chefs are each so talented - and of course chef Zama was there doin' his thing.

The "black belt" sashimi app was sublime and included 2 luscious pieces of salmon toro.  I also tried the lobster salad (outstanding) and avocado salsa (also very good).
Home-made tamago - branded with the Zama logo - was a thing of beauty and exceptional taste.

Best of all?  Ikura that was poppin' fresh.

Simply amazing.

Went to Doma last night for a rare treat - a child-free dinner.
Had the BEST time.  (Brought our own Prosecco.)

Trio of tartares was terrific, as was my usual "Naked Salmon"  atop crunchy rice.  YUM!  My dining companion had a kick-ass chicken katsu.
I also sprang for a $10 negi-toro handroll and am so glad I did.

FAN-frikkin'-tastic.  And - I just went to morimoto a few days ago and yes, it is excellent - but for the money?  This place is a steal, a joy and a true gem.

We are planning a party here for my 6 year old this fall.  

Can't wait!  Shumai and edamame all-around!

Tres bien! Magnifique! Et c'est la verite!

I thoroughly enjoyed a sublime almond croissant.  Fresh, crisp, buttery, multi-layered, filled with almond paste and sprinkled with sliced almonds & powdered sugar.

Parfait!

The coffee drinks, chocolates, pastries and tartes here are all so delicieux!

Can't wait to return!  Mon dieu, c'est le meilleur!

They have gift certificates!!!!

Lovely service.
I can't say enough great things about this place!

Winner, winner, SALMON dinner!

My parents are regulars here and my husband and I love it here, too.
The food is truly "as good as it gets" with the exception of the canned green beans (side).  Just skip that and get onion rings, cucumber salad, mac & cheese or rice.

The seafood itself is divine - Shrimp & Scallops broiled in butter were simple but tender and delectable.  Lobster salad ($42 a lb) is terrific and the shrimp salad is fresh and flavorful.

Dine in (simple digs - you don't come here for atmosphere) or take out, you just can't beat the super fresh seafood here - fried, broiled or grilled.  Just so darned good.

And terrific service - but again, we are regulars so they treat us great.

Had a fantastic experience at Dining Under the Stars (often more like "Chaos out in the Heat") at Bittersweet.  Normally, they do not serve dinner - but I sure wish they'd consider it.  A group of 5 ladies enjoyed burgers, fish & chips (a special) and the FABULOUS (calorie bomb) french toast BLT.  A side of Brussels Sprouts (again with bacon) made life complete.

Service was amazing - even on a crazy Wednesday night and the weather was great, too.

Can't wait to try more items on this sweet & savory menu of comforting favorites.

Last night's visit was sooooooo fabulous.  We were smart and made a reservation for the 3 of us - we took our 5 year old DD who just LOVES (and ate 6 of) the jumbo shrimp shumai.

Service was great considering how frantically busy they were (they had to turn people away) on a Friday night.

My husband's sushi was great - especially the crunchy spicy tuna roll.
I had the (ENORMOUS) Zen bento box which came with delectable tempura and 4 pieces of sushi, plus kalbi, 1 shumai (we got a little shumai'ed out) and a spicy tuna roll.  (Yum!)

If you are a big eater consider the $36 Zen box - comes with miso soup (GREAT and homemade), salad (tasty soy-based dressing) and dessert.

As a surprise - and mostly why I am giving them 5 stars is that they brought our daughter a HUGE platter ($14 on the menu) called the Doma Dessert Sampler.  (FOR FREE.)

The dessert sampler came with:

Vanilla ice cream topped with green-tea cream cheese and a fresh blueberry

Mochi-covered Strawberries (home-made mochi) with a small pot of fudge to dip them in (WOW).

3 fried banana-tempura drizlled in (more) chocolate sauce and caramel sauce.

And a MOLTEN chocolate lava cake.

It was a HUGE platter of dessert - and easily fed all 3 of us (who, by the way, were already stuffed from dinner).  Somehow we managed to eat it.  (Ha!)  What a treat.  And how nice of them to do this for us.

My little one already adores DOMA and now I am quite sure it has surpassed Roy's and Swanky Bubbles (2 of my little one' faves) as her favorite restaurant.

Man, I wish my parents had taken me to places like Doma when I was 5.
(Yes, she was the ONLY kid in the joint - this is not a kiddie place.)

Kid's got good taste.  Not a chicken nugget in sight.

My precocious 9 year old is no longer interested but from ages 3 -7 this place was Da Bomb!  Swing sets, a huge castle, climbing areas.

Clean and fun all around.

Love Central Park for walking the dogs, also.  (And a big sledding hill in winter.)

5 stars for Camp Chill, Learn-to-skate and Birthday Party programs.
Our (now) 9 year old started last summer for 2 weeks at Camp Chill - the figure skating camp.  She liked it so well we got her in for 2 MORE.

Now she is in the Learn-to-skate program (weekly classes) and once she gets "good enough" she is considering the Junior Competitive program. (Her coach, Mojca, is terrific!)

We also had her birthday party here and all 13 little girls loved it - and Patty, Carleigh and the staff were so easy to work with.  (We brought our own cake - but all other food came from the iceworks snack bar).

What a great place.  So glad we live closer now.

5 stars for the Black Plate Holiday special - Smoked Prime Rib.  $10.99 and deeeeeeelicious.
The creamed corn is pretty amazing too.

Get there for the holidays.

P.S.  They cater.

We love Wolff's for fresh produce and local baked good - plus very good pulled pork (in the refrigerated case).

Family owned local business.
Great for plants in the spring, too.

What a treasure.  We were members for 1 year and then it just got cost prohibitive - so we try to visit on Sundays when admission is on a "donation" basis.

The long-time head curator just passed away.  So sad.

We enjoyed the special exhibits on Renoir Landscapes and Frida Kahlo.  Our 3 year old can recognize Renoir's works.  Amazing.  (We didn't take her to see Frida - too gory & depressing.)

We also sometimes attend "art after five" and have some over-pricedcatered apps and listen to Jazz or Classical music,  Very gentile.

So classy.

Love the Museum of art - and the "discount gift shop" on the Balcony (The Balcony Shop?).  We never buy in the main gift shop - usually if you wait a while - you'll find the item on sale in the Balcony shop.

Also the restaurant is nice for brunch or dinner.  (Dinnner on Friday nights only.)

Honestly, I had a 5 star first experience at Chrome with Abbie and the fabulous Sherri M.

I was referred to Chrome by several friends who are "moms" at my kid's school.  I never went because I was loyal to another stylist, but she recently left her place to have a baby and since I am not sure when she'll be back I decided to "try".

Well, I am glad I did.  Sherri gave me a color and blow-out (no cut this time - but likely next time) and used Redken permanent color, single process.  It. Is. Lovely.

Abbie served as receptionist and shampoo-person - and she was working hard.  I can't imagine how busy she must be on a weekend.  (They are closed Sunday and Monday).

Parking was a little tight but OK - you can always park at the nearby firehouse and walk over.

Pricing is mid-priced ($85 for color and blow-out, before tips to both ladies).

I will be back.
Thank you!

Used the online ordering for carry out and my order was complete, correct, ready and waiting when I went to pick it up.  Delicious for fast-food BBQ and so easy for a hungry crowd.

Staff are so smiley and friendly.

Great!!!

Like a supermarket for booze.
Love it.  Except perhaps on New Year's eve or right before the superbowl.  Can you say "uber-crowded"?

Also a great source for free cardboard boxes.

On weekends there can be a police presence so do not overload your car with booze and drive to PA.  Be smart, people!

Honestly - the food was exquisite my last time to Zama (in June 2017) with a colleague for a $100 (no alcohol, no dessert) lunch.  Sushi, salads, appetizers, all sorts of wonderful fish.

Delightful.

Every bite was perfection.

Wish I could afford to dine here more often.

I disagree with the 3 star people.  The landing is all about the view and the FABULOUS deck - and for this alone they could serve garbage.  But they don't.

They serve really nice food - a little yuppified and for a wedding here - the prices are way out of line.  (We contemplated having our reception here but it was just cost prohibitive - and the place is a bit smaller that we wanted for a big wedding.)

That said - I sent my parent's here for their 25th anniversary (albeit that was 17 years ago...) and they enjoyed it enormously.

Over the years owners have changed - but it's still "in the family" and a great, great place.  An all-time fave for me - with lots of nostalgic memories.

Oh - and they have a nice wine list.  Including a few bubbly selections which I enjoy.
Lore's makes the custom chocolate bars for my child's school.  They are delicious and come in Milk, Dark or White - and my kid has tried all of them.  A pleasure to work with!

Our now teenager has been skating here for over 8 years and we practically live here.  The facility is well managed and well run.  There is a focus on hockey, but the figure skating program is also very strong.  We have sunk alot of money here between coaching and ice fees, competitions and the annual ice show to benefit the IWSC - Iceworks Figure Skating Club.

Her head coach is amazing and we can't say enough great things about the family we have become a part of at Iceworks.

4 ice surfaces, locker rooms, Pro Shop, Cafe, Bar, Gym.

It's really great when you visit other area rinks who have 1 or maybe 2 ice surfaces if you are lucky.

Our kid has been a figure skater for 5 years now and we practically live here.  If you or your child wants to learn to skate (figure or hockey), this is an excellent facility.  Caring coaches, trainers and staff.

A cafe AND a full bar/restaurant.  Locker rooms.  Party rooms.  A banquet room.

Iceworks is our second home.
No lie.
Our kid has been enrolled in the Junior Competitive Figure Skating Program for 2.5 years and We can not say enough great things about the sport and this facility.  LOVE IT!

Believe it or not we had a 5 star (As good as it gets for sure) experience at the average (3 star) Folsom/Ridley Staples (next to the Acme).

We needed some last minute and CHEAP school supplies on LABOR DAY - the day before the first day of school.  We found exactly what we needed (Folders and single subject notebooks for 25 cents piece!!!) Plus a "graph paper" notebook for that pesky math class.!

Got in and out with minimal lines (WOW) and a fabulous cashier - she is brand new and her name started with "A"  I wish I could remember her name - she deserves a big, fat raise.

Staples saved our asses!

I realize that 5 stars may seem high - as it's really more of a 3-4 star place but our experience for dessert tonight was way above and beyond our expectations.

After a fairly LOUSY meal at El Camino across the way, we came over just to check out this new "retro-style" diner.  As we could not see any signage we came in and chatted a long while with the adorable, friendly hostess who said that this is "Darling's".

"Darling's"?  I asked.  As in the 20th street and the the other little tiny cute cheesecake makin' Darling's?

Yup.

Wow.  I am blown away - this looks NOTHING like the other two Darlings.  The place is huge.  And immaculately clean.  And Airy  And fabulous.  And the cheesecakes and slammin' Mac 'n cheese are on the menu.  (Con't miss the Bananas Foster Cheesecake.)

And I got quite a caffeine buzz from my STRONG and tasty iced latte.
Went well with the chocolate chip muffin style pound cake.  (Try heating it up, guys!) Yum!

To top it off the Owner came out to chat for a bit and was so kind to us.

Can't wait to come hear with my kid!  She will love it.
I wish them all the best and hope they make it.  There are some pretty bad reviews on here - but to me this place whipped the pants off of El Camino. (Service wise - can't comment on the food - but the desserts at Darling's are really AWE inspiring.)

Go to Darling's!!!!!  Any one of them.

Just a note that we still love Cafe Cret - although it is very expensive and a cup of soup is $4.75.  OUCH!!!!

BUT we have to let you know about the fabulous Le Bus chocolate chip cookies.  They are the reason my daughter is giving Cafe Cret 5 stars.  If you get them heated up (ask the guy to do it) they are heaven on a plate.  For $1.08 (with tax) it' s a great winter warm up.

Terrific service from the guys & gals who work here, especially Emily (who may have left by now).  Many are college and post-college aged students.

I am giving them 5 stars (when in reality they are more of a 4 star place) due to the PHENOMENAL service we received.  Angela - the (then) event planner helped us plan and cater a 70 person party.  They provided 2 (high school aged, but very competent) servers, all the pans, sterno and GREAT, GRAT food.

We had a fresh green salad, tomatoe pie (cut in squares on platters), Insalata Caprese, Sausage & Peppers, Pasta with mini meatballs, and a delicious Chicken Francese.

The food was marvelous and the amounts we ordered fed everyone with some (not not a ridiculous amount) of leftovers.  Perfect budgeting and execution.

Lovely!!!  I receommend them for catering for sure.  In our case (big order) they delivered and set up everything (for a fee).

Awesome and free!  And a great oplace to find a bathroom, a map, a place to rest for a bit and/or get directions to tourist attractions or general info.

Even for locals like me!

I have taken my little one here since she was 3 and we come a few times each summer - usually between trips to the Liberty Bell or Constitution Center of the National Museum of American Jewish History.

We even took the (now ill-fated) duck boat ride a few years ago (before all the problems) and enjoyed it.

But event if we are not doing "philly stuff" we know we can always duck in here for the bathrooms just in case!

Well, it's one year after our wedding already - can you believe it?
We had a special anniversary dinner at JAI last night for a party of 7.  The recreated our wedding menu and it was out of this world.

Tender filet mignon, rich smoked cheddar mac 'n cheese, tender, bright green beans and crunchy parmesan chicken in a light buerre blanc sauce.

To top it off we special ordered 12 chocolate dipped strawberries - that disappeared in a flash.   The pastry chef also sent out (gratis) 6 chocolate espresso truffles - hand made and yum-city!

Teg the sommelier and GM is a doll and there were 2 weddings that night (it was a perfect 80 degree night).  One 36 party small wedding in the conference center and a huge (for JAI) 115 person wedding in the Wheelwright room.

It was fun to re-live our wedding day again (except that ours on 6/7/08 was in 96 degree heat!).  The service was great and we just can't recommend the JAI highyl enough.

For a wedding, a special dinner - or just to come and enjoy the food or lodging.

Try the JAI - you won't be disappointed.

We had a lovely late lunch at the counter of Front Street Fountain. Andy and the other servers were attentive and patient with our 8 year old who gobbled up a pulled pork sandwich and then ate a Basset's cone with Orange Ice Cream and Rainbow Sprinkles/Jimmies. 

Instead of lunch I had a deep fried Oreo sundae.  Oy-caloric-vey.  Ice cream and 2 HOT deep-fried batter dipped oreos, home-made vanilla-scented whipped cream (rich and wonderful) and hot fudge,  El kiddo ate the cherry.

DH enjoyed a Taco burger.

Can't wait to come back but next time a proper lunch and no ice cream for me.
A wonderful place for families and kids.

Ashley Power of Power Catering events is a true professional.  She recently catered a "heavy hors d'ouvres" reception for about 50 people at my cousin's home.

The food was delicious and elegantly presented.  The lamb chops with pesto and duck 'n onion crepe were highlights.  Standards like shrimp shumai and asparagus tempura disappeared along with delectable mini-mugs of home-made creamy tomato soup served with grilled cheese triangles.

Her staff of server and bar tenders were on point in both serving and clearing.
The blueberry-mint lemonade was refreshing and perfect for the event.  (The open bar was also great.)

Stationary displays of fruit were as beautiful to look at as they were tasty to eat.

For dessert?  Butlered mini desserts like freshly torched creme brulee and petit lemon tartes.

I am considering hiring her for my own events and would urge yelpers to do the same!  She does Philly area, suburbs and South Jersey.

Love Power Catering!

We had a 5 star experience from Bill (our attentive server) and the entire staff at Capital Grille.

I was treated to a delicious birthday lunch here - and everything from the greeting by name when I arrived, to the f9ond farewell was top-notch.

The food was the star of the show - and our table was decorated with rose petals and confetti in honor of my birthday.  They also snapped a picture of me and my dining companions at dessert.

My meal consisted of truly perfect french onion soup (A cup was perfect for me - they also offer a crock), and the lobster salad.  I asked for extra tomatoes and they added a variety of heirloom cherry halves and beefsteak slices.  Delicious.  Topped with a shelled lobster claw.  Scrumptious.

Every bite was blissful.
Truly.

Can't believe it's a chain - but I have dined now at a few CGs and all are excellent.

very expensive - Lunch for 3 was over $150,  so plan accordingly.

A special treat, indeed.

Can not...

...write.

Too...

...weak

Lapsing into... food... coma...

4.75 Stars.
OMG - Have you ever had a meal that was such a calorie bomb that you literally felt all of the blood rush to your stomach to try and equalize what was happening in your system?

I seriously feel weak from my anniversary dinner at Union Trust.
Dh & I had a very romantic, dimly-lit, 5-star service (Fabian, you ROCK!), unforgettable meal here tonight.

I may need days to recover.

We started with cocktails/wine.  I had the Flyin' Hawaiian and with what little I normally drink (Being the Empress of the Arnold Palmer and all), after a few sips I was nicely buzzed and after one I was flyin'.  (2 might make me crash land.)

Once the buzz was on, out came our delectable apps.  A very good lobster bisque for DH and an icy-chilled crab cocktail perfection for me (better than Parc!).

We each had massive slabs of cow-on-a-plate.
He had the ancho-rubbed strip, garnished with salty (a bit too salty for me) finely-julienned frites.  I had a perfectly cooked cowboy ribeye (so huge I took over half of it home - and, I should mention DH took about 40% of his home.)  My major complaint (which nearly cost them a star) was the crust of the ribeye was WAY salty.  Not Arizona-desert salty, not inedibly salty - but noticably biting with salt.  Dommage!

Meanwhile the spectacular (and for $9 - $11 a pop they outta be) sides saved the meal.  Mac 'n cheese was enough for 4 people (again, half came home - which our kid will appreciate).  The crispy top gave way to bubbling, hot, melty-cheesey-creamy-yet-tender (not at all flabby) elbows.  (I had been expecting shells based on other yelp reviews - but got elbows.)

I love mac 'n cheese and the mac here is worthy!!!!  So good.

A platter of donut-like sweet, tender Onion rings - battered to perfection and (the only thing?) NOT salty.  Wonderful.  I lterally ate 1/2 of one ring and was satisfied.

DH also got a $3.00 dish of caramelized onions to go with his steak.  Not needed - but so tasty - with a light balsamic/demi sweetness to them.

The floor manager, our server (Fabian) and "bus" Valetin, were all on point with the service.  truly excellent.

Dessert (Come on now!  We have come this far - why not just succumb to the madness) was an I.V. of lipitor.

No, seriously - dessert DH had the s'mores (which did, in fact, look like a marshmallow-meringue hedgehog) atop a scoop of house-made peanut butter cup gelato.  The even wrote "Happy Anniversary" on the plate.  And put a little candle on it. Cute.

I had a latte (delicous Saxby coffee - not Peregrine, but fairly good stuff) with a few spoonfuls of Frangelico in it.

Basically everything - with the disappointing exception of the overly salted crust of the Cowboy rideye - was top-notch.

We hope to return again in about a year.
It'll take that long to recover my arterial walls.

Alcohol, caffeine, salt, fat and sugar.
A dietary disaster - but oh, so much fun.

back...

...to the sofa.

I feel a pleasant numbness coming on in my left arm.

I have been seeing Melissa M. (and nicole, Danielle and Ali) at the Shear Bliss in Brookhaven - but now they've really outdone themselves.  They've opened a brand-new second location in Center City - right near my kids old school.

I love their colors, cuts and styles.  And the new digs look FABulous.

Come check them out.

Fabulous and free (and air conditioned with decent bathrooms).
Gift Shop.

Mission Control for tourists doing the Historic Philly thing!

Oh wow.  Yes, it really is all that IF you order the right things.
(I am torn between 4 and 5 stars, but I will be generous due to the fabulous entree and app I am about to describe.)

First of all the Green Room is a great special occaision place.  The ornate, grand dining room, complete with a gilded music gallery (balcony up above) with a pianist on weekend nights.  The food and service are AAA 4Star for good reason.

Not only are you paying for the decor and ambiance, the food and ingredients are terrific as well.

The Hudson Valley Foie Gras app was out of this world, and the $39 lamb chop entree - with 2 double cut, frenched rib chops (total of 4 ribs) kicked the baaaaaa out of the chops I've had at Joseph Ambler Inn, and Tinto (2 of the places I have recently had good lamb chops).

The desserts are $8-10 and the signature dessert - a White Chocolate Amaretto & Fresh Raspberry Napolean is a work of art and worth the price and calories.  Skip the deconstructed Pear tarte Tatin - but if you like get the fresh house made ice cream (the small orb of vanilla ice cream that accompanied the tarte surpassed it with each yummy, creamy, chilled bite).

Oh my widening butt!!!!!

Anyhow - back to reality and my diet.  But don't miss a chance to have DINNER at the Green Room.  Especially if someone else foots the large bill.

Oh - valet parking is $14.00 unless you are a hotel guest.
And also - someone re-train the hostess.  She is a bit green (2.5 years in) and it shows.

We have since returned many times - including their wonderful"family friendly" new year's eve celebrations from 5 - 7 PM - complete with Karaoke for the kids and anice cream toppings bar.

They also have trivia nights on Friday's.

The now 9 y.o. loves the pulled pork sandwich and we like the burgers and grilled cheese.  

Wonderful home-made whipped cream is a treat, indeed.

Great fun for families with kids from infants through about age 12.

Still my go-to for hard Italian grating cheese, fresh ricotta and certain cured meats (I also like DiBruno's, Downtown Cheese and Claudio's).

I buy certain things certain places and Salumeria is TTOPS for selection and value of Grana Padano, Parmegiano Reggiano and many others.

Great customer service - and a tub of Marcona Almonds to snack on.

I am ALL set!

OMG!  I am beyond thrilled and delighted to find Bill's - a real 100% BUTCHER shop with custom cuts available and exotic fare like Muskrat (seasonal) and rabbit (pre-order).
I wonder what Muskrat tastes like?

The beef is top quality.
Chicken is average price - no better no worse that the supermarket.

But for custom orders?  This is a dying industry and I am so lucky to found these folks - 2 blocks from my office.

SCORE!

I will be placing an Easter Lamb order very soon!

OK - Now they get the fifth star.  If you read Pat D.'s review - you'll hear all about the yummy treats she orded when we had lunch here today.

I had the greek salad - and they were kind enough to "hold" the feta cheese for me.  The greens were crisp and 3 types of olives were used (2 green and 1 black variety) along with batons of red pepper and home-made dolmades.  The scrumptios  - and simple - lemon and olive oil vinaigrette made it SING.  Presented on a white rippled plate - very clever.  The plate allowed the dressing to pool away from the crisp greens and thus I could dress the salad as I wished.  YUM-MY!

The I had the Asian Dumpling soup.  The single dumpling had a shrimp-based filling and was scrumptious, as were the veggies in the soup.  The broth was a bit salty for my liking - but I am a no-salt added kinda gal.

Next was the star of the show - and what I was WAITING for - Chicken & Waffles.  It was accompanied by tender-crisp southern greens (with a healthy shot of garlic) and thin-ly julienne deep-fried sweet potato strings.  Damn, what a great waffle!  The pulled chick on top was tender and delicious - but my one complaint was the copious amount of bland sauce.  It nade it a bit too "a la king" -ish for me.

Dessert for me was a simple - yet perfect fruit salad of watermelon (sweet and seedless) bites, blackberries,and a single slice of orange.

Service was good - I felt so bad for the guy in crutches who had broken his femur.  What a trooper.  

I will be back - hopefully SOON. (And maybe even with Pat D!)
Visited the Art of Jim Henson exhibit.  Great for kids and grown-ups.  Not to be missed.

Last night I went over to Vietnam Palace to see Tracey Nguyen who is putting together a large (about 30 people) party for my child's kindergarten class.

Since I was there anyway, I had some dinner - including a freshly squeezed glass of lemonade (perfect on a 77 degree and humid day) and a delicious place of extra-thin bun (rice vermicelli) and grilled beef.

Tracey is terrific and will be on hand next week when we have our big dinner.  I will let you know how it goes, but as of right now - and can't say enough good things about the service and food and Vietnam Palace.  It's a great place for couples, singles and families with young children.

I buy about 85% of my cheese here (sometimes I go to Downtown Cheese a few doors down, but Salumeria almost always has the best price).  I get 100% of my grating cheeses here - Grana Padano, American Grana, Parm, Romano, and more.

Love it!

Raina Rocks!  She did my hair for a pin-up shoot.
I hope to try her place ASAP.

Alas, Nicole has moved on, but Melissa and Ali (Aly?) are my go-to stylists for cuts, color, high/low-lights and fun styles for special occasions.
It's not a fancy salon - but the prices are fair (They charge extra for using a flat iron or curling iron - so be aware of that) and I have been with Melissa for 6 years.

Love her.

Love them.

I finally found my place for good hair.

A wonderful selection of cheeses (and meats) in Reading Terminal Market.  I get fresh ricotta here as well as Grana Padano and other grating cheeses.  They have a house blend for $8.99 a lb and other types like reggiano and stravecchio for much more $14.99 or even $16.99 a lb.

Regardless, I pick up a few Olive oil tortas from spain, or Marcona almonds or figs.

A great gourmet find!

Rocky Bluewinkle.
Mr. Celery.
A great family night of fun.
Baseball.

My 5 year old adores the BlueRocks and we take her to a few games every summer.

What a nice stadium, too.

A great asset to baseball, to the city of Wilmington and to the community.  (And this coming from me - a chick who hates sports and is bored to DEATH at games.)

Well DD (dear daughter) and I visited Shanghai Bazaar again today - as we do very often.  And while upstairs a GORGEOUS, young looking woman greeted us and gave the l'il one a red balloon and a tiny, shiny pink star.

We soon realized that we were speaking with Ms. Lily Song - owner of Shanghai Bazaar, Opera singer and a great resource of Chinese Culture in Philadelphia.

That seals it - we totally LOVE Shanghai Bazaar and will come here for all things Chinese-Culture that we could ever need or want.

We hosted a large event at the College of Physicians and Catering by Design was the in-house caterer.  Our event had an open bar (3 different bar locations - so never a long line - whoo-hoo) and fancy hors d'oeurves including a pad thai bar (awesome) a slider bar - falafel, chicken and beef burgers and a goreous display (under the 2nd floor rotunda) of charcuterrie, olives, spreads, breads and dips.

Great job!
Great tasting, plentiful food - within our limited budget.
And - as i mentioned - plenty of booze flowing all night long with little to no waiting.
Another spectacular cut, color and a few foils by Cynthia.  She is a true artist.  Much love.  Enjoyed my visit to Oggi - and Natalie (Shampoo/Assistant) is a doll, too!

We were married here on 06/07/08 and everything went so swimmingly well.  From our initial site visiti in the Summer of 2007, to a FABULOUS tasting dinner in late 2007 to the actual "big day".

The tasting dinner, for starters, was such a great experience.  My fiance (now husband) and both of our sets of parents tasted 6 entrees and 6 apps, along with 4 sides.  We ound up selecting some GREAt choices which were well executed on the wedding night.

Our wedding had 79 guests (8 of which were kids and 4 of which were three year olds).  We served buffet style - but could have opted for a sit down and had 4 hours of OPEN BAR.  (Whoo-hoo.)

It was 96 degrees on the day of our wedding, so it was really hot.  We wound up having the cocktail hour indoors, to save guests from the heat.

The food, service and accomodations were all top notch.  Wendy (event Manager) & Teg (General Manager) along with our day-of coordinator (you get one included with your wedding package) Wendy treated us very well and our every need was met.

Toro tartar plus Tuna Pizza plus $75 chef sushi platter fed 2 of us with ease (and leftovers).  Fish of many varieties - and all were top quality and uber-fresh.

We still caved and split the chocolate pot de creme.

Topped mine off with a glass of the Veuve and Mama was veddy veddy happy.

Our server, Eric, was workin' it and everything was 5 star all the way!

My experiences at Oggi just keep getting better & better.
I went to see Cynthia today - mostly because she made @Susan G. look HAWT and I wanted to look HAWT, too.

Well, I wish I had a picture - b/c she just colored my hair a GORGEOUS (and volatile) shade of red and cut it to perfection.

She is a sweet & talented lady - and has been with Oggi off & on for 14 years.

Cass who shampooed (and I mean SCRUBBED) my color out was a doll and I wish her the best of luck with her career.

Can't wait to come back.  I spent just under $200 though - Ouch.
(Includes tips and a bottle of $13 shampoo.)

Cynthia - you ROCK!

I also heart cheap gas - and Like Sarah K. (who is right on!) I shop at Giant so I can get that cheap gas - right across the street from the grocery store is the BIG (and always busy - but not as busy as the Wawa) gas station.

I usually get 20 - 30 cents off per gallon.

Sweet.

I am a huge supporter of Philabundance as well as other food-related charitable organizations in Philadelphia and NYC.

Philabundance works with schools, businesses, corporations and community groups to gather and distribute non-perishable food for those who need it.

Learn more - and support Philabundance!

I had been to Oggi for hair (with the aforementioned and sublime Cynthia - she rocks!) but never for spa treatments.

I actually did not realize they offer so many great things.
So when I heard about the mid-week (Tues, Wed or Thurs) 3 treatments for $99 special, I just had to indulge.

I had a "relaxation massage" (30 minutes of swedish) and 30 minutes of hot stone with Jenna.  She is a very nice gal and a talented therapist.

After that I had a marvelous paraffin manicure with (can't rember her name - Yelena??) a very excellent nail tech.  (Russian lady who's been there for years.)
I loved it!  Seriously - the mani lasted about 6 days chip free.  Great products and flawless technique.

If I were able to - I'd come here all the time.
Love to Cynthia and Natalie for a fabulous cut, color and foils today.

What a great l'il (not so little, actually) space.  You can tell that atrsy-theatre types have made this space what it is - and it is a GREAT multi-purpose "Black box" theatre with a great array of gigs/shows & films that can be showcased here.

GOOD JOB!!!  I'm sold on 941!

Honestly, the service and food here are always top-notch.  And, yes, it's a chain but it does not feel like one.  we had a private party for 12 (in the back small room) and it was lovely.

Lobster Salad (I love it here) never disappoints.
Wonderful!

Tastes even better on an expense account,  (Alas, I was paying.)

Keystone concierge provides valuable and helpful services.  They found me a great dog walker.

I recommend them (and the owner Lori) highly.

This funeral home handled my late grandmother's cremation (they have an onsite crematory) and transported the remains to her final resting place over 20 years ago.

A few weeks ago I contacted them to ask about pre-planning and costs for other family members and they were so great over the phone at explaining everything.

When the time comes, we'll be calling Huff & Lakjer.
Just hopefully, not too soon...

Kudos to Deb, Bob and the rest of the staff who run the Cafe and watch over the "VIP" club level seats.

What a treat to have a private box.
Food is just OK (Tough "steamship round of beef" and oddly salty chicken marsala).
Baked Ziti and salad were fine.

Popcorn and soft pretzels were a hit with the kids - and of course, having Rocky Bluewinkle visit the box is a BIG hit.

We love the Blue Rocks.
The seats during the week are empty - so come out and take your kids.  Inexpensive family fun!

A very important monument.  Took my kid here at age 5 and again at 6 & 7 to play and learn simultaneously.  Plus there is a cool dog park next to it.

A painless way to teach your kids about the concepts of immigration/emmigration, famine and Irish history.

It is rare for a jaded ex-New Yorker like me to give a 5 star - especially out in the 'burbs, but Nectar really lived up to the hype last night. Aside from the gorgeous decor and scrumptious Pan-Asian cuisine, the exceptional and personalized service we received from Bruce & Laura (??) was truly top-notch.

In truth, this is probably a 4 star place, but it is a very, very strong 4 stars.
Terrific for a date night.

Wonderful for making healthier choices.

LOVE and can't wait to return.

Took my (now) 6 year old to a double header tonight and it was such fun.
read Steven B.'s review - he has it right on!

If you have kids - minor league ball (Blue Rocks and Camden Riversharks) is a great way to get them into America's favorite pastime.).

Hy husband even caught a fly ball and gave it to our kid which was a big thrill.

Please note that firm is now called Berner, Klaw & Watson, LLP.
I am a retained client of Megan Watson who is an excellent, dilligent and results-oreinted family attorney.

She has been invaluable to me during my child custody and child support cases.

I recommend her and this firm.

OK - I am rounding up to 5 stars.  Is this truly "as good as it gets"?  Maybe, maybe not - but service wise and considering where you ARE? (A remodeled residential duplex in LANSDALE of all places?).

The London Broil and Egplant Schwarma sandwiches are terrific.
Baba Ganoush was a bit lemony for my taste, but freshly made and delicious.  
Best of all?  Many dessert choices and some to TAKE HOME including pistachio Baklava and REAL birdsnests.

YUM.

Can't wait to go back. (CASH ONLY)
And the owner is a lovely man!  He made us feel so welcome.
Best Lebanese/Mideastern joint this side of Beirut.

This place gets 5 store for the nostalgia factor - although in reality it's a 3 or 4 star operation.  What I remember most are those big - and I mean HUGE - ginormous-honkin'  ice cream cones.

The ice cream tastes so creamy and rich because it's made from milk produced right on the farm.

I hope they can stay around for 50 more years.  AMerica is losing the family farms like these and it's a real shame.  

SUPPORT YOUR LOCAL FARMS and FARM MARKETS!!!

Gotta give it 5 stars (even though it's really more like a 4) 'cuz D-town is my HOME town, y'all.

This Museum was built in the ORIGINAL Doylestown Prison - in fact up until the early "80's - you could see inmates playing B-Ball in the yard if you peered into it from the top floor of the nearby Mercer Museum.

Absolutely top notch food - with the freshest and finest ingredients, plated and sublimely served by an attentive waitstaff in an ornately decorated "old school" formal dining room.

Anniversary?
Bridal Shower?
Special Occaision?
Planning to propose?
Chistmas Feast?
Easter Brunch?

Do. It. Big.
Do. It. Here.

I have studied Pilates for a long time - but recently (January 2008) started working with Jeff Prall, who is a great Pilates instructor.  He works out of a spacious studio on 13th & Locust.  The studio is owned by Karen Carlson - also a great instructor.

The studio has nice equipment - 3 reformers, 2 cadillacs, 2 chairs (No towers - they use the low cadillac as a tower) and 4 elevated mats for mat work.

There is a men's room and a ladies room for changing.

There is also a lady who practices the Alexander Technique onsite.

Jeff is a great trainer and I enjoy working with him.

I had not been to Oyster house in years and we were thrilled at the top-tier service and delicious food our work-group of 7 received.  Everything from booking our reservation (Only for large parties), to requesting separate checks for each of the 7 diners (so convenient) to attentive and friendly service from Joey.  Shout out to Joey - he was "workin' it" and was just amazing.

The ladies at the hostess desk were terrific too.
And the "shuckers" at the raw bar were shucking at top speed.

Food was swimmingly fresh - I had the pan-sauteed flounder with delectable lemon-butter green beans that were perfectly crisp yet tender. Our group enjoyed a plethora of raw-bar apps, soups (Chowdah) and lunch entrees and everything was out of this world.

My only wish?  That you could sub something for fries with the lobster roll. (I am a low-carber and can't have the roll or the fries.)  I would have LOVED to have some lobster.  One person ordered the lobster roll and it looked soooooo good.

It get's super, super crowded and noisy in here so be forewarned - but Oyster House is still doing a brisk and healthy business years later.

Wonderful!

So glad to have FINALLY gotten to go here and meet and chat with "Mom" who has run this "dead-head" institution for over 33 years.

She also has 2 great cats who manage the shop.

So many great gift ideas for music lovers and bead aficionados.
Classes, workshops, music and guests.

Wonderful!

Okura catered the sushi bar at my husband's party at Hotel DuPont.
Nigiri were super fresh and included yellowtail, salmon, tuna and shrimp (all equally delicious).

Maki cut to order included basics like Cali Roll and Salmon/Avo as well as Spider (Softshell Crab) and Shrimp Tempura rolls with fresh veggies.

Wasabi and Ginger were artfully displayed like flowers.

I could have skipped dinner altogether (but it was also divine) and blissfully grazed for hours (6:30 - 9 PM) on Okura Sushi.

They cater!  Have them cater your next party.

Special!

Went to DuRoss & Langel again last night as a special shopping-spree trip for my 5 year old daughter who literally RUNS into the tub whenever we use a D&L Bath Bomb.

Steve, you have saved bathtime for us!  Tub-time has never been more fun that when you have a Koi-Toy ($12) ducky soaps ($5 each - we got 4 of 'em) Bath Bombs ($8) and fizzies ($2.5 each -we got a bunch - my fave it the pomegranate one).

Oh, and you gotta buy a Koi-Toy (a light-up plastic koi that changes colors and swims all around the tub).  Such fun!

Lots of fun home-made (on premises - Steve was pouring soy candles that very day) bath & body products.

I LOVE THIS PLACE!  (Who wouldn't?)

Steve - you have RESCUED bath time for us!

Hoorah and Huzzah - at long last REAL juice (not smoothies from WAWA) - a high-tech OJ machine, Mom-Pops.  (Try Red, White and Blueberry or Pineapple Chipotle)  Veggie Juice.

Brand spankin' new and clean.

Fresh Wheatgrass
Ginger Lime Shots
And quite possibly the world's best fresh made low-sugar lemonades.

(Pure Fare around the corner also has good juices, but Yellow is a much, much appreciated addition.)

I wish you much success and you will be seeing alot of me.
I LOVE IT HERE SO MUCH!

A National (International) art treasure right in my own front yard.
Love it!

Best fresh juices (veggie, fruit, smoothies, banana twirl and now SALADS) in the city.
Love it here.

Fresh Lemonade - some of the best ever.
Delicious Fresh Wheatgrass shots

I love it so much and hope they prosper for years!

Just wanted you all to know that we ordered 2 dozen macaroons (Phenomenal) and 3 pies (Pumpin, Apple Crumb and a heavenly chocolate cream) for thanksgiving.

They are sooooooo delicious we will never bake again!

Seriously - try Hotel DuPont for your holiday baked goods - WOW!

It's probably only really worth 4 stars but my brother is good friends with the owner - so I gotta give 'em 5.  They treat us like mini-celebrity's whenever we see shows there.

Finally - a decent music venue inb D-town!

GO PUCK!!

P.S.  Bring money.

Can't say enough good things about the staff and owner of CMM.
My 10 year old kid and I are both VIP members and we have now brought 2 of y kids friends here who both loved it.

Very please with the products and service.  Made an $80 Christmas Tree (ouch) - but we will have it for years.

Our latest project was a 14 tile mirror that my kid custom made and hopes to take with her to college one day.

Very therapeutic.

Salon Royal Court really is a high-end salon in a unique and goreous building.  (The owners - a couple - live on the top floor.  Nearly everything in the multi-level salon is an antique and much of it is for sale.

I come here, oddly enough, for nail services. (I have never had my hair done here - as frankly, i can't afford the prices, but a friend has her cuts and highlights done here.)

I used to see Donna for FANTASTIC spa pedicures.  (They have a regular and a spa pedicure.  The only difference is $10 and an extra mask application.)  She was great - but she left, so now I see their long-term uber-manicurist, Ginny.  She is really loud and talks alot - so if you want a quient technician - she may not be the gal for you - but from a technical perspective she knows her craft.

I am still on the quest for the perfect pedi - and Cheryl Lee (spa elysium) has that title in the bag so far.

But, I sure miss Donna.  She gave me a great pedi.

Oh - and they used to sell Kerastase here but now they carry another line. (Which is a shame because I would buy my Kerastase here.)

Happy freakin' brithday to me!!!!

Ok - I'm gonna do it.  I'm giving Davio's 5 stars.  I read all the yelp reviews before we went (and many were bad or just fair) - and I have to tell you - last night we had a true 5 star experience at Davio's.  Lemme break it down...  

Before last night's soiree I had pretty much ZERO desire to go here.  I walk by all the time and the menu seemed kinda small and boring and PRICEY as heck.  I wanted to go (and still want to go) to Butcher & Singer.  (And I will - one day.)

Our party of 7 (Originally to be 9) sat at a lovely LARGE round table, and our server (Rodolpho?  Renaldo?) was terrific and gave great expalnations and recommendations.  The space (a former bank) has high ceilings and gorgeous wood floors.  Chairs are big and COMFY.  First class all the way.

After a round of drinks (2 of my friends had drinks at the bar while waiting for the rest of us to arrive - but they were offered to sit at the table by the host had they so desired.) including Bellini Martini's (YUM) and Veuve Clicquot - simply perfection in a glass - we ordered or apps & entrees.

The round of apps included several standouts.  My friend LOVED the Philly Cheesesteak Spring rolls.  I had the beet salad - which I shared with a friend) and she shared her chicken livers - sauteed in balsamic with cherries.  Both were simply popping with flavor.  So great.

We also passed a big "honkin'" slab of Insalata Caprese around the table.  Now, I have had this salad (mozzarella & tomato) umpteen times in so many preparations - good, bad and indifferent.  This one was good - but not great.  The supposed "Buffala" mozz was fresh - but not as creamy as some.  The tomoto was a thickly cut beefsteak.  

I definitely reccomend the chicken liver app and the beet salad with lemon zest, walnuts & fresh micro-watercress.  Both "sang" on the palate.

My DH had pasta for his app - and I had 2 delectable bites.  One of the fresh tagliatelle (WOWZA!) and a second mouthfull of the thick, meaty bolognese.  I would order this again for sure.

Entrees were just as good as the apps with Osso Bucco, Shortribs, Ribeye Steak and RACK OF LAMB (Best in my opinion - and I ordered the osso bucco - BFF had the lamb) were standouts.  Fresh Branzino fillet was served atop a mound of risotto puttanesaca - rich with flavor.  My good vegetarian friend has angel hair arrabiatta - which he loved.  (But at $16 I would NEVER have ordered.)

Service between courses was perfectly timed.  Not too attentive, not too stand-offish.

Desserts ROCKed.  Yes, it's trite - but 3 out of 4 of the ladies (myself included) ordered the molten chocolate cake (allow 10-15 minutes for prep - we were in NO hurry).  Served with Vanilla Gelato - it was plate-lickin' worthy.  A friend had tiramisu - looked more like a layered torte - another had a luscious sour cherry tart - which was more like a glamorous muffin top.  (I happened to enjoy the bite I snagged of it.)  Last but not least 2 of the gents tried the rich, yet light & fruity lemon pudding.

We were all treated to a chocolate covered strawberry on each plate (which I requested).  Many of us had coffees - and I had a lovely cappucino (yes, I know that nobody in Italy drinks capp past 11 AM - but hey - I wanted one - and it was damned good.)

What a lovely evening.  Pricey as heck - and in my opinion this is a "special occaision" or "expense account" restaurant - but if some wants to take me here?  You bet I'm goin'!  And I fully intend to grab a girlfriend or two and order drinks & apps at the bar.  Those chicken livers are calling me...

I love it here.  I just do.  The table by the window - especially when the weather is nice.  The bar with it's unique wine storage, and especially the food.

Trennette pasta is house made in saffrom suace.
The stuffed tomatoes (side dish) are so yummy
The mixed antipasta platter is near perfect.

So what if the staff is aloof?  The receptionist cold and sterile?  The decor is sleek and not warm and welcoming - but beautiful nonetheless.

I love eating here.  It ain't perfect - but I feel 4 stars is too low.
I'm giving it 5.

The fish - oh I forgot about the fish - whatever the special fish is - GET IT!!!!  It will be fresh and delectable.

Just got yet another GREAT order from Peregrine - freshly roasted Brazilian Cerrado - and right on time for our Thanksgiving feast.  If you have not had your FREE (seriously - they will come right to your home or office) bespoke coffee tasting yet - you need to check this out. right. now.

Kevin & Louise, the owners are so accomodating and they roast up some of the best KenyaAA, Kona, Guatemalan (DH's fave) and the aforementioned Brazilian.

I LOVE PEREGRINE!!!

Update!  In November 2014 they opened at Penzey's at the Bourse in Center City.

Can't wait to go!
A super-small theater - and not a bad seat in the house.  (It's so small that even the back row is fine.)  Support your local theater!!!

Where do I begin?  Well - for the Green room dining alone it's 5 stars - please see my review of that - but this is for the hotel.

Wow.

Impressive - from the valet parking and reception upon arrival, to the $40 rosew petal turn downservice to the $25 lavendar relaxation bath complete with those FAMOUS and delectable macaroons (get a box to take home!), our King Room with sitting area and huge tub was well worth the nearly $400 per night.  (Room about $300 dining package in Green room well worth the extra $100)

Bellhops, Front desk, concierge and all staff were attentive without being obtrusive and our 1 night stay was heavenly and TOP NOTCH.

In addition there was a rockin' good Jazz Festival that just happened to be that same night at the adjaecent Rodney Square - so that was fun, and we peeked in on one of 2 lavish weddings held at Hotel Dupont that Saturday.  What a great venue for a wedding!

My DH gets brownie points for at least the next 3-5 months!
We have an anniversary getaway to remember.  Well worth the money.

Amazing!  A hair's breadth away from 5 stars - so I'mma gonna do it and give them all five - and especially Marina our kind, patient server who was so accommodating.

Firstly, my dining companion and I walked in 45 minutes EARLY for our 8 PM res.  This is a hostesses nightmare and we were prepared to be told to "sit at the bar" but we got a table (in the bar area) right away.

I had 2 of the tastiest Arnold Palmers you can imagine - made with the herb-infused house sun tea.

Everything we ate from the fluffy warm brioche rolls with ramp butter to the delicate "handkerchief" pasta (mine with umami rich rabbit, my friends was vegetarian) to the luscious side of garden beets (at least 2 varieties of beet - possibly 3 it was hard to tell) and candied orange peel and a touch of creamy fresh ricotta. - All was wonderful - but the real showpiece was the special of SEASON ONLY squash blossoms (which I love!!!) delicately fried - stuffed with goat cheese and herbs.

Calorie-city!  But so tasty - and we shared an order of 4 - so 2  seemed just about decadently perfect.

We also splurged and shared a Millefuille (more like quatrefuille - please tell me somebody gets my jokes...) of thinly sliced banana, toffee and chocolate served with a rich yet delicate quenelle (aka the Quenelle from hell) of dark chocolate sorbet. 

Wow.

Beets (pun intended) the heck outta Parc.
Similar price points but somehow we spent WAY less (no $60 seafood cocktail tonight, thank you very much).
