Dinner for 2 with soft drinks and 1 dessert (no alcohol) was around $75 before tip.

I can't wait to go back.

GO TO TALULA'S. 
Go!
Go!
Go!

And ask for Marina - what a sweetheart.
Tatiana was a doll, too.

Great service, great food, precious decor (a little too cutesy for me, but it's Starry-eyed splendor in the grass.).

You got me!

Not sure if this is for the Hotel or the Green Room restaurant but believe me - both are 5 stars and well worth a visit.

There is also the DuPont Theatre which offers great plays.

This place gets 5 stars when it doesn't deserve it for Big Sue and Mountain John.  I cut my teeth at Juan y Pedro's and for me, it feels like home.  I knew Big Jen Ran when she tended bar here - and saw many great Dead-COver bands and jam bands and all kinds of great musical acts here.

A great, great, great place.  Even better in the dead of winter when the tourists have all gone away.

First of all, I don't even LIKE sports - but this has got to be the NICEST sporting goods store I had ever seen - or set foot in.  A huge selection of baseball bats, gloves, balls, basketball gear - you name it.

Got a sports fan who needs higher end gear?  Go here.

And the guys who work here are so helpful and nice.

A great, surprising find - in downtown Wilmington.

GORGEOUS - plus great products and top-of-the-line services.
Terrific!  (Expensive - yes - but appropriate for this "upscale" area).

5 star service from Jo Jo on a busy summer night - the place was hoppin'.  We needed to get in and out quickly and Jo Jo helped us do just that.

Pan-seared rainbow trout ($20) is always good for me and my husband enjoyed a southwestern chicken salad.

Nice place and very reliable.

This Wawa, we affectionately refer to as the "magic" Wawa as it is about 1/2-way between my home in Media, and a friend's home "out west".

It's got gas, food/beverages, a rest room and plenty of parking.
Everything we need to meet up 1/2-way and transfer our kids, sporting gear and other stuff from one friend's house to another.

Hooray for the "magic" Wawa!

I stopped in here on a whim - when I noticed the HUGE Grand Opening Sign (They just opened in Nov. 2012).
Place is brand-spankin' new - and all the staff used to work at the now closed salon in the Springfield Mall.

For $12 (plus $5 for 2 designs) I got a very good mani by Jenny. For the Grand Opening I was charged $15 total.
Cindy - the manager/type (senior technician??) was friendly and offered me green tea or wine.  I have since been back to see Jenny (she is great) for 2 more gel manis.

They have 8 brand-new sparkling clean pedicure thrones. (And 8 mani stations)
Meanwhile the place was empty on a Wednesday Morning.

A hot stone pedi is normally $30 - but I will go back before 12/31 to get the $35 mani/hot stone pedi special.

Can't wait to try it again - and it's new, so it's clean.
Give me 6 - 9 months and I will re-review.  SO many Nail Joints start out great and then decline.

Please - keep it nice and I'll be back!!!
We need more NICE nail salons in Media.

Trendy Nails and the staff - Nancy. Lily, Mandy, Peter (Kevin? LOL), and especially Jen and Cyndi take such excellent care of me and my 10 year old daughter's nails.  They are always happy to see us and make us feel welcome.

Best of all the gel manicures and pedicure last a long, long time.  (Regular manicure are good too - but i am now a dedicated gel gal!)

We are so thankful to have found this salon.

Clean, comfortable and excellent service!

I have only ever had take-out pizza from La Fourno - but it was GREAT (We got mushroom and plain cheese).  The owners are the best (LOVE THEM!) and are generous supporters of our child's school.

I don't even usually eat Pizza - but La Fourno's was really great.  (Traditional Neapolitan Style) Delish!

Can't wait to eat a full, REAL meal here.

The Broad Street run goes right passed our apartment.  Kewl!

Great fun to watch but there's no way you'll see me running in it.  My body was simply not designed to move faster than 4.5 miles per hour.

Ah well, I can dream...

Go, dim sum!!!!

So sad that they are out of business after nearly 100 years,

We will miss you, Harry Och's!

Penzey's rocks my spice world.
Yes, I am officially a spice girl.

Smarty Spice.

I love Sunny Paris
Sunny Spain
Shallots
Shallot Salt
Chives
Turkish Seasoning
Lamb Seasoning
Chinese 5 Spice Powder
Tellicherry Black Peppercorns
Sarawak White Peppercorns
Vanilla Sugar
Double-Strength Vanilla Extract
Parisienne Bonne Herbs
Rosemary
Garlic
True Ceylon Cinnamon
Penzey's Cinnamon
Baking Spice
Cake Spice
Brady Street Cheese Sprinkle
Minced Onion
Toasted Onion
Red Pepper Flakes
Mural of Flavor

So much more.

I LOVE YOU, BILL PENZEY!
Congratulations on 25 years of making food with love.

Absolutely the best!  Went to another event (smaller) - also buffet style.  Perfectly cooked salmon, chicken (bones in and roasted to perfection), rare to medium sliced of beef roast.

Fried sweet potatoes to accompany the beef.

A delicious fresh cucumber salad and the best rosemary-scented polenta I have ever tasted.

Lynn is the BEST and her helpers are very kind, caring people.

This SMALL branch of Walgreen's is located across the street from Hahnemann Hospital and gets five stars because of one reason: Pharmacist Vince Meo.

No - you won't like the questionable clientele - but
YES - you will love Vince Meo.  

He cheerfully fills my prescriptions and has given me manyhelpful pieces of information over the years concerning pharmacology and which prescription drugs I need.  He even saved me time and money once, when I was very ill one winter.

Helen at the front counter is a doll and the people who work here are so nice.

Bring your insurance card - and be prepared to WAIT if its busy - but Vince - man, I love ya!

I am treated so well here and have been since they first opened (I was not a client when they were in the Springfield mall years ago).  I will say, however, they are much more considerate of "regulars" than walk-ins so perhaps, call first and ask for an appointment with Cyndi, Jen or Nancy.  All 3 ladies are terrific and I get pedicures (regular and spa), manicures (regular, gel, Vinylux/Hybrid, French and nail art) and waxing (eyebrow or underarm) here as needed for both myself and my 14 year old.

We love coming here - the pedi chairs were recently re-done and are much nicer now.  Large selection of over 800 polishes (300 classic/hybrid) 400 gel and about 100 "dip" colors.

I tried 5 or 6 salons (including the much lauded "Zen Nails" and the now defunct and awful "Nail 452") when we moved here and Trendy's got my money and my vote every time.

Plus, you can walk over to Starbucks if they are too busy to take you right away (again - walk-ins).  Tip:  Come here on a weekday morning for much better service.  Saturdays and Sundays are crazy-busy.

Cyndi, Jen and Nancy are who I see (all 3 are equally wonderful).  A few of my other ladies have left and new ones are here but I do not yet know their work.  Cyndi's gel work is amazing, Nancy is great at everything and Jen's pedis and Classic or Hybrid manis are long lasting and meticulously applied.

Good nails are only as good as the strength of the nail technician and these 3 ladies know their stuff. Go Trendy!

Peregrine Coffee, owned by Philadelphia husband & wife team of Kevin & Louise is a true find and gem!  They offer a "Bespoke" ocffee tasting service where they will come to your office or home and fresh grind,brew and allow you to sample numerous types of single origin or single estate beans.

Ken is a true "coffee geek" and is extremely knowledgeable about all aspects of coffee production.  He buys his beans green and roasts them in the Peregrine Roaster in Tacony.

We had 5 friends over for a Bespoke Coffee Tasting party and could not have been more pleased.  They will even package smaller amount of coffee as wedding favors.  (Oh, where were they when we needed them 6 months ago!!!?)

All this, and to top it off they are the nicest, smartest people you could hope to meet.

We hope to have more tastings with them.

That KenyaAA was something to taste!  (So complex and delicious.)

You will never want Dunkin' again!!!!   (Don't even get me started on Charbucks.)

Le Virtu - I love you.
We were greeted so warmly by Fred - and sat at the bar enjoying delicious Italian wines by the glass.

We were seated at a corner table and started the meal with a delicious sausage and red peppers over polenta and fried olives (Crispy, hot and stuffed with porchetta - they are little bombs of flavor exploding in yout mouth).

So wonderful.

After the delectable apps (and foccacia dipped in tasty olive oil), our primi arrived - pappardelle (housemade) with rabbit ragu for DH and handkerchief pasta with duck ragu for me.  MEMORIES are made of this.

Who could eat more?
A secondi?
Not tonight...

But We did have something else - a perfectly made cappucino (yes, at night - I know, I know) for me and grappa for DH.

We also split a luscioud dessert of a fresh crepe with chestnuts paired with 3 freshly fried ravioli stuufed with chocolate and chestnuts (So sinful, yet so delicious.)

A mouthwatering, memorable, five star evening.

We love you, Le Virtu.
And thank you for participating in the Friends Select School "Dining with friends" promotion.

Hosted a private event here for 5 ladies and we were treated like royalty.
Fantastic service and wonderful manis & pedis.

I truly love this place!

Our party of 6 had a truly wonderful lunch during "Taco Week" at Condesa.  We all opted for the $22 three-course deal - choice of app, entrée and dessert.

The Aqua Fresca that day was a delightful guava, lemon and mint.  It reminded me of guava lemonade.  I had a splash of it over sparkling water to cut my carbs - and it was mighty tasty.

The fresh guac was truly flavorful with fresh cilantro and sliced mini-jalapenos.  Just the right amount of kick.

For an entrée I opted for the Platos of pork with onions and nopales - which I happen to love.  The pork itself was just perfectly seasoned and the right amount of fat and lean.  Juice.  Succulent.  Rich tasting.  And oh-so-not-Kosher.  Sorry, G-d.

3 of the 6 people got lamb tacos (on bluecorn tortillas) and everyone was raving.

For dessert there were a variety of fresh Mexican pastries and a moist, warm (again, delightful) Olive Oil cake.    Too many carbs for me - but worth the splurge.

The food, décor and service here (even the mod-chic ladies room) were all stellar.  So great.

Pricey, yes - but the $22 three course is a great deal if you can get that.

I can't wait to come back.

Just got another STELLAR Vinylux Mani from Cyndi and waxing from Jen.
Fantastic, long wearing (7-8 days!!!) and a great value ot $13 all performed in a clean, comfortable salon.

LOVE THIS PLACE SO MUCH!
A lovely scenic greenspace with trails for walking or running.  A great place to take your kid or your dog or both.  What fun on a spring or summer day!

OK.  I'm a convert now.
I come in 3-4 times per week (ouch - my wallet!) for green lemonaid - light on the apple, heavy on the greens.

Every now and then I get a petito beans & greens burrito which is way too much for breakfast and I am full until lunch or beyond.

The lady in the AM is so nice to me.

I am much more into this place at breakfast when there is no line.
Wish you could get lunch items at breakfast (I'd get a chicken burrito and take it to the office and eat it at lunch!)

Loving it here now for sure!

P.S.  Please put a hook in the ladies room to hang your purse on.
P.P.S.  Please consider posting a big, easy to read, professionally printed menu board up above to hlp the ordering process and lunch line speed.

Just had yet another astounding Gel Mani by Cyndi (Also ask for Jen, Nancy and Nita).  I.  LOVE.  THIS.  PLACE.

Clean, reasonable, fun atmosphere, friendly but BEST of all?  Top quality mani's, gels, hybrids manis and pedis/

I can't wait to return.

Attended a formal dining event here and everything from service to delicious food to the valet/car parking was TOP NOTCH.

Love it here.

We live walking distance from PAFA and I take my 5 year old here often.  She is well known in the (free) student gallery and the great gift shop.

Additionally, PAFA'a new annex (not so new anymore) was the site for my child's school's annual charity auction.  PAFA was a terrific venue for this and the administrative staff os PAFA were so friendly and great to work with.  

The exhibits change throughout the year and we are always looking out for the next "big" thing.

So happy to know about the art classes for kids and teens, too.

Now they get 5 stars!  They offer gift cards.
Between this and the $25 fruit baskets (I bought 4 of them at Thanksgiving time) and my everyday fruit & veggie needs, Gentile's can't be beat!

Much love!

The Clay Studio is a great find.  If you have kids - they have Clay Camps and programs for kids of all ages to learn about pottery and ceramic arts.

For adults there are ever-changing exhibits and great merchandise.

The organization is well run and we worked with Clay Studio to host a silent auction and reception there for the Friends Child Care Center.  Management was great and the have a kitchen facility.

Can't wait until my little one can go to clay camp (starts at age 5).

You can have your garage parking validated at Parkominium up the street.

Vernalicious trekked to the 'burbs and boy are we ever grateful.
The menu is limited - but everything is delicious!

I had the BLT & A and it was perfection at $8.50 - or add Smoked Salmon to it for $12.
Many others tried the pulled pork grilled cheese (or plain grilled cheese) and it looked great, too.

Thank you, soooooo much for hauling out to Chesterbrook and PULEEEZE come back.  We need you!

WhooHoo!  As good as you can get from a truck with door to door service.
Oh - and the lady called me "hon".  Adorbs!

I concur wholeheartedly with Emily.  My family and I have been coming here for year.  We especially crave the summer peaches.  

My nearly 4 year old daughter has been apple and blueberry picking here.
And don't miss the fresh-fried cider doughnuts in the main shop.  ($1 a piece or you can buy more and save.)  They are worth the calories.

I adore Solebury Orchards.  I hope yelping it won't give away our secret.

Brand-spankin' new.  I hope they can keep it this clean and well maintained.
Everyone is on their best behavior.  Fresh produce, pre-cut veggie trays and fruit bowls, gorgeous deli counter.

I will be back - but again, I hope it can STAY this way.

OMG!!!   Order the OMG -  it's so good!  A perfectly cooked REAL Italian Chicken Cutlet on a seeded Italian loaf (not a roll - a LOAF) with thinly sliced tomatoes, FRESH milky mozzarella (not that plasticky garbage) and pesto sauce (I get mine light on the pesto) which is fresh, bright green and uses a very goodtasting olive oil.

Near perfection!  LOVELOVELOVE IT!

Can't wait to try the pasta - and the salad with eggplant and mozz.

Matt Ridgeway (formerly at LaCroixand other top NYC restaurants) is back to his Buck County roots.  He has become a purveyor of unique charcuterie products, particularly honey cured bacon, guanciale, duck proscuitto, duck rillettes, and smoked salmon caviar.  (Steelhead)

Using his fathers home-avaiary-farmed honey and other local ingredients, Chef Ridgeway provides delicious products for chefs and home cooks.

He reall knows his stuff anf boy can he throw down.  Check out porcsalt!  (Even if you don't eat pork.)

Our group hosts not one but TWO parties here every year - one for the Holidays and one in late June.

Chris, Pat and the rest of the bartenders and servers treat us like good friends and keep the booze and tasty bar food flowing.

This time they had an EXCELLENT, truly excellent crab cake (sandwich or over a salad).  It was packed with crabmeat and very tasty.

Yes, this is a casual bar with "bar food" but every time I come it gets better and better.  Great classic rock tunes, your favorite sport on big TV screens and a place to just be yourself and relax.  There is no pretense at Oh! Shea's and we love them for that!

Support local and sustainable agriculture!
Shop here.  (And say hi ti PICKY of messy & picky - who works here.)

Some of the best seasonal produce and cheeses from local dairies.

I only wish they had larger digs - and i here they may be expanding very soon.

Hooray!  (P.S.  I think they may also be affiliated with the White Dog Cafe.)

I LOVE coming here.  The guy who runs the place is terrific and best of all - even among the dusty, cramped aisles - I get the very best price around for Eukeneuba bagged food and supplements for my pampered pooch.

No, it ain't Petsmart (and thank goodness for that!) but it is wonderful in its grimy glory.

Long live Delchester feed! (And you can go to Gentile's next door!)

The have "Black Velvet" apricots (Apriums/Pluots) - a succulent cross between plum and apricot, this summer.

Also Mango Nectarines.

They are CASH ONLY.

Don't forget to check out the refrigerator case WAY in the back where they stock Claudio's fresh mozzarella - straight from South Philly.  YUM!!!!

A well organized, well executed group trip (all 30 of us in canoes - no tubers nor kayaks this trip) for the 2.5 hour trip (Left in the AM at 9:30 AM (Actually got into the water at 10:05).

Dave, our bus driver, was friendly and helpful.

A wonderful and SAFE experience for all including our 10 year old and a friends' 4 year old.

We'll be back!

My 8 year old participated in the first annual Guac-Off (a guacamole conptetition) held at the Fleisher Art Memorial in South Philly.

We all had a blast preparing and serving guac for over 150 guests.

The folks at MANNA were terrific to work with and raised over $3500 to help feed critically ill Philly-area residents.  Their nutritious meals are literally, life-savers!  (And they taste great, too.

We support MANNA and the valuable work they do - plus they organize creative and fun FUNdraisers.  (Special thanks to Chef Keith, Katelyn, Lydia and Dan.)

Much love to MANNA!  (And don't forget to buy your holiday pies this year at one of the many MANN Pie in the Sky pick-up locations. (We like the pecan pie!)

Sometimes I find joy in the "little things"  - like the freshly baked anise biscotti from Termini Brothers.

Bliss!

Yes, you can EAT HERE - a very filling old-skool Polish lunch.  Our group of 11 tried nearly everything on the menu and it was all terrific.  Plus we got to go shopping afterward and stocked up on all our Polish faves like Ukranian style borscht, pierogies (oodles of different kinds) hams and kielbasi, chocolate covered marzipan and the BEST stuffed cabbage I have had since Czestachowa.

What a find!!!  Even takes plastic.

And they serve $3 beers.

Get your Griggstown Farm Duck Breast & Quail here!
Plus Pot Pies!

Plus all that great seasonal, local produce.

LOVE IT HERE!!!!

Today I snagged some purple string beans, white eggplant, miniature sweet peppers (expensive but so cute), and some raw-milk cheese.
Oh - and a box of teeny tiny red miniature cherry tomatoes.  Poppin' 'em like candy.

LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE!

We held a surprise 70th birthday luncheon at Chambers for 20 people and it was an amazing success. James (the manager - NOTE:  He left about a month later - fall of 2012) and I communicated for months beforehand and the actual day was picture perfect.

Delicious food (We offered a soup/salad course and a choice of 4 entrees) and wonderful service by Lucas and the other servers. People raved about the perfectly cooked salmon and filet mignon as well as the delectable chicken/penne dish.

Chambers even allowed us to bring our own cake - and graciously sliced and served it for us.

We are so very pleased with our 5-star party at Chambers!
I wish James was still around.
No issues - I got in and out quickly and picked up just a few needed items.  Granted, it was a Wednesday at about 12:30 Pm so not a peak time.

It's CLOSED.

So sad.

OMG - so good - even worth the ridiculously long wait (and kinda pricey if you add provole, long hots AND broccoli rabe.

But about twice a year I just gotta get a sandwich from DiNics in RTM.

YUM.

OMG!!!! I love it, I love it, I love it!  The chef-owner is a total hottie (but he IS married and has a brand new baby girl.) and man can he throw down!

This re-vamped BYO in Northern liberties (bring a nice RED!) served a mean duck breast with fraggola and a tasty Lobster Udon app scented with vanilla butter.

Sooooooo yummy.

We loved our 4 separate  meals here.

Only 1 bad thing - (and I almost downgraded to 4 stars). - once when we came with another couple (and ordered many things) they charged us for splitting an appetizer.  (We did not split any entrees - we ordered 2 apps and 4 entrees).  When we objected they removed it from the bill - but it just seemed cheesy to charge $5.00 to split an app.  (The split-plated it for us - but we did not request that and would have happily picked off each others plates).

Also, the desserts are kind of a downer.  (Only2 or 3 to chosse from and no pastry chef on site.)  Save room and head to Capogiro for dessert!

But you gotta try that duck breast.  (Cherry gastriche)  HEAVEN on a plate!

Let me preface this by saying that I am NOT a hoagie gal.
I don't "do" cheese steaks and I like to eat healthy.

But I must insist that Primo is the best - I get the Chicken Suprimo - as a wrap (that bread is fresh and yummy - but waaaaaay to many carbs pour moi.).

I also like Nonna's veggie - as a wrap - no oil, with fresh mozz instead of provolone.

This is the real deal!  Even for a non-hoagie eater.

I attended a company party at Winterthur and EBE was the entertainment.  For cocktail hour - the first song I heard when we arrived through the doors was a brass instrumental of Nikki Minaj "Starships".

I then went to the ladies room to freshen up and met one of the 5 vocalists (FIVE! 2 guys, 3 gals) who was super-sweet.

They played softer music during cocktails and louder pop and a few oldies during the party.

The also played "Happy" by Pharell 3 times.  (That was a bit much.) They also played "Starships" again with vocals.  

Very good bassist (in the back corner) and brass.

Terrific service and a toy shop for kids downstairs loaded with Melissa & Doug toys.
Mushroom items for gifts or for eating and they'll ship mushrooms to your loved ones.

An old educational display in the back teaches about how mushrooms are farmed.

Lots of fun - even if you don't like mushrooms.

Manna PA provides nutritious meals (3 meals a day, 7 days a week) for over 1,050 people with life threatening illnesses.

They may be best known for their annual "Pie in the Sky" fundraiser each holiday season (Thanksgiving pies for $25 or $50 and proceeds benefit Manna).

Definitely check them out.  I have bought pies for 3 years and for the last 2 have been a pie seller.

A great organization.

This is a review for RAINA CLARKE - who is an extremely gifted stylist and an expert in retro hair styles (30', 40' & 50's).  She did my hair in a pin-curl roller set for a photoshoot and it was great.  If I ever travel out toward Springfield - I will definitely see her again!  She rocks!

An asset to women and education - and the community.  Our 8 year old attended a girl scout leadership conference here and the student volunteers were just amazing.  

Gorgeous, pristine campus, beautiful architecture and a friendly vibe.

I hope our daughter can get in when the time comes! (ANd pray we can afford to send her.)

Now they get 5 stars!  They offer gift cards.
Between this and the $20 fruit baskets (I bought 4 of them at Thanksgiving time) and my everyday fruit & veggie needs, Gentile's can't be beat!

Much love!

It's rare for me to grant ANY starbucks a 5 star rating - but this is for SERVICE, SERVICE, SERVICE.  Isiah and David? was on point and greeted my like an old friend.  The other customers were all so friendly - it felt like a neighborhood coffee shop and not like a chain-Starbucks at all!

My drink (a basic latte) was perfectly fine, but the chit-chat made my day.
It made me realize how comparatively unfriendly my "regular" Starbucks (in Media) is.  And I am at that location several times per week!

Wish this was my defaut bux.

Shout out to Isiah and team for the beauty tips!  Ya'll rock some serious balayage!

Finally got back to Moro for a special occasion dinner with DH - and we were in for a treat.  FANTASTIC service and cocktails (All were $10) and great wines (as always).  DH had a smooth, delicious Malbec.  My cocktail (and later iced tea) had blood orange (aka Moro) juice in it.

Best bite of the night?  Watermelon salad with pine nuts and flash-fried basil.  Super delicious.

We enjoyed the risotto side (a steal at $5) and duck breast entree.

The ony disappointment?  The "classic" bolognaise sauce (atop perfectly home-made strotaprezzi - yum) had a sour vinegary note to it and I did not love it.

We were too full for dessert but nearly ordered the spring special - a strawberry rhubarb crostata.  (We passed - we were just too stuffeed.)

A memorable, beautiful, gourmet evening. Can't wait to return!

Does Wilmington know what a gem this place is???

Back again for the 4th consecutive year - and our 3rd year shopping for unique ornaments from Kathe Woklfahrt (The big white tent).  Our 9 year old loves it here - so we go (and spend) every Christmas.

Great fun and great for kids.

Lunch for 23 for my parent's 50th wedding anniversary (They just love this place - and especially Matt and Linda) was a terrific and memorable occasion.  We are so thankful to everyone here who cooked, prepped, served and cleaned up after us.

Especially delicious were the petit filet mignon and chicken zinfandel pasta entrees (which we have enjoyed before and are so happy to see they are still on the menu).

Chicken Sante Fe soup was tasty as well as crisp fresh beet and garden salads.

They even helped us cut and plate the 50th anniversary cakes.

THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!!

We have gone here for 3 consecutive years and our (now 8 year old) kid loves getting a sweet treat, picking out gifts, Russian Dollies, uber-expensive Nutcrackers, ornaments and everything you could want or need for your holiday celebrations.

We really enjoy this.

Sally and Ronnie were our servers again and they KNOW what they are doing.

We had exemplary services and top tier food and beverage from the moment we walked in and enjoyed beverages at the bar (Frose all day! Plus pints of Guiness for the dudes) to the time we were seated in the main dining room. 

Seafood Wedge is delightfully simple and well executed.
Do not miss the perfectly tender seared scallops.  WOW!

My friend was celebrating a special birthday (30 again??) so they brought out a dish of white chocolate house-made (and so thick and rich) ice cream with "Happy Birthday" written on the plate in chocolate. 
An elegant touch and a surprise for the birthday boy.

I highly recommend Blue Bell Inn for any special occasion, corporate dinner or fancy date night.

I happen to love this location of Starbucks - the people who run it make the difference.
There are usually several people sitting at the barstools chatting with the barristas.  It's alot of fun and makes dropping $4.72 on an iced tea or coffee that much easier.

Good thing come in small packages....
When you enter (cram into) Sue's tiny storefront - the myriad and variety of vegetable and fruits is just astounding.

It's amazing what they can pack into that store.
Great prices - and yes, the long lines move quickly.

Berrie& cherries in July, and a feast of apple varieties in the fall.

LOVE SUE's!

Still lovin' PAFA - even moreso after seeing the Henry Ossawa tanner exhibit - and the yummy brunch sponsored by PECO.  We love the gift shop, too  - for unique gifts with an artsy twist.

Don't miss PAFA!

Support your local Dairy.

Yes, Rosenberger's Milk costs a few cents more than the store brand - but it is so worth it.  A great family business that supports our local agriculture.

I prefer the 2% myself...

OMG - this is the real deal, Jewish (not Kosher - you can get meat and dairy here) style deli including lox, knish, blitzes, great latkes, and thinly sliced amazingly lean corned beef.

Sooooooo good.

Don't miss that Matzoh ball soup - I got mine with noodles added.
The hit of dill in that broth is just like Bubbe's.

Service was great (COVID complaint), too.

Can't wait to come here again.

P.S.  I got 1/2 a lb of Nova Lox and 1/4 lb of sliced corned beef to go - the Lox was silky, fresh, thinly sliced and decadent (ACME from Brooklyn).  So. Darn Good.

I am loving this place.

3rd year in a row - and it's even better this year (name contraversy and all).
REAL German merchants at a few of the booths (not all) selling chocolate covered fruit, nuts, Nutcrackers, ornaments, plush animals and everything.

And this year there is a $2 a ride carousel that my 6 year old can't get enough of.

And she got to see Santa - with way less of a line than at Macy's (aka Wanamakers).

We will be back again and again from now thru Xmas day.

LOVE IT!

For excellent customer service and everything from wedding jewelry to watch repair, you just can't beat Carroll's Jewelers.  They've been in the D-town shopping Center for EONS and are still family owned.  Jeweler Joel Robinson will give you an honest, no bull-S$$t appraisal of your stone - whether you bought it from them or not.

I trust them.  

And of course, they have just plain gorgeous jewelry from reputable lines at the best prices.

You can also count on them to tell you honestly what the prices for gold and platinum are - which can help you greatly when you shop.
Excellent and free - and they have a horse farm in the center.  Lovely.

OMG - what have I been waiting for?
This place is amazing.
The 1/2 rack platter (2 sides and 2 slices of white bread) is $16 and huge.
Can't wait to try the brisket and chicken.

Go early - they do sell out.

My office-mates adore the burnt ends.  (They sell out quicker).
Terrific!!!

Fantastic!  I love and support REAL Butchers whenever possible as they are a dying breed and we NEED them.  Steaks?  (T-Bones for 9.99 per lb, Ribeyes for 13.99 perlb) Chicken?  Lamb?  Veal?  Sausages?  Even Dog Food (scraps??)!

Love this place and can't wait to become more of a regular.

Wow! Blown away by the quality, variety and freshness of my sashimi lunch special at Qu.  $14 plus tax and tip was money well spent, and served by the delightful Miss Yvonne. 

This place is brand-new, so new that the liquor license isn't even here yet (Gotta love those PA "blue laws")!

Nevermind, this place is gonna catch on fast.  I only hope that they maintain this level of opening-month quality. Everyone is clearly on their best behavior.

Keep it up, guys!
I'll be back and I'll be watching.

Stopped in with my almost 8 year old and my MIL for flower cutting ($6 per 1/2 pound - our bunch was about $4.00) and blackberry picking.  (The berries were not quite ready that week - wait ONE more week.)

Cider donuts and NEW Cider Ice are a tasty treat.

Such a great place!  (Closed Mon, Tues, Wed).

Love it.

Got some rare (springtime only) petit baby turnips today.  You can eat them raw or lightly steamed.  Delicious - slightly radishy - and highly nutritious.

Also locally grown straberries that are actually red all the way thru.

And heavenly japanese eggplant and pure, clean Belgian Endive.

I am in heaven in this cramped, tiny, NYC-style market.

I just have to review Doug's Place.
Doug has been cutting my brother's hair since he was 5 years old - and he's over 30 now.

His home-like setting in Doylestown is a great place.
I hope he never retires.

We love you, Doug - my father has gotten his hair cut here for over 40 years and my "little" brother who is now all grown up went here throughout his younger days.  We love you Doug.  Please, please, please don't retire.

The Flams.

Fantastic - chock full of free events.
Just wish the restrooms were open and accessible during non-event days.
Brand new (ok - a few years old) in venue terms and clean, spacious and plenty of seats.  Expensive.  We have seen numerous concerts here.

Needed watch bands pronto and Joel and the team at Carroll's delivered!  This store is one of the foundational stores in D-town and it is still in the shopping center (near the Acme) today.

We love Carroll's Jewelers.

Yum!  What a great idea.  Wish I had thought of it.
Jules has terrific gourmet-topped, thin crust pies.
I love the pie with Artichoke hearts, arugula and chopped fresh tomatoes.

They offer gluten free alternatives and its a SUPERB place for families with small children.

My only complaint?  No "white" milk - only chocolate.

Had a 5 star experience tonight dining out with a gal-pal.
We started off with delectable cocktails - I had a classic mojito with a few pieces of fresh pineapple muddled in.  Delicious and refreshing.  She had a purple concoction garnished with an orchid.  It had Chambord and Vanilla Vodka and other things in it.  So good!

We shared nearly everything.  The Horiatiki Salad was terrific (Though $15 for a plate of mostly tomatoes in olive oil and lemon juice is a bit steep.)  The trio of dips and spanakopita (which seemed a bit borekish) were great.  Entrees of Moussaka and (again? ) Dorado (Because it's cheap - they offer Dorado aka Mahi-Mahi as a fish du jour often.) were tasty and filling.

Dessert and tasty La Colombe coffee rounded out a teriffic meal.
Kanella (Cypriot, not Greek)  is still my fave - but the service from Mark, a prime window-side table and a groovy mood (Thanks, Bacardi!) made this a 5 star Etsia night for me.

We had never been in here before but we have supported A Woman's place in the past.  My 15 year old snagged a REAL fox-fur jacket for $45!!!!  And for jusy $7 more a Jean Jacket, a top and 2 pairs of paints.

7 items for $52.

WOW.

We hit it big!!!

We come in about once a month - this last time for wings & pizza for me and my 10 year old and her 10 year old friend.  The owner is terrific and treats us so nicely.  Kids love the cane-sugar-based sodas (Watermelon and Huckleberry).

Pizza is quite good here.

A great value, too.

They also cater many meals for our elementary school and the teachers love the food.

This brand-spankin' new Chick Fil-A (on a busy corner of Route 1 & Pennell Road (452) has a double drive-thru, a play room and GREAT customer service.

So far we love it for our 7 year old who can play and eat (And we usually get out of there for around $20 for the 3 of us).

Not the healthiest choice - but the side salad (skip the cheese, croutons, sunflower seeds and dressing) is good - and we enjoy the occaisional fried chicken sammy with diet lemonade.

There is also a Chick Fil A inside the (nearly dead) Granite Run Mall.  This is not it.  This is the NEW Chick Fil near the CVS.  They also do fundraisers for schools and community groups.  (I'll definitely be looking into this!)

Stop by!

Yeah, baby!  They now are open for dinner!!!!!

Those blintzes rock.  Took my 5 year old here for Shavuos.  Wow!!!

Try the sidekick sampler!!!!!

Oh - and the kugel is better now than when I went before.
LOVE IT HERE!

Stunning!  A treasure!  Not to be missed!

Especially in springtime when the azaleas and rhododendrons bloom, this place is just GORGeous!

Great for kids, adults, older folks - everyone.
And - if you join the Pennsylvania Horticultural Society you can visit for free!

Ercolino Leather & Shoe Repair was our go-to place for YEARS.  (And they were just about the only game in town for years as well.).  Mr. Ercolino could fix just anout anything.  Shoes, boots, handbags, leather jackets/pants.

They were a needed service and a mainstay of the Doylestown community.

Super fast response to an emergency heating call.
Courteous and professional.

A bit expensive (emergency) but cheaper than Horizon.

We took our 5 year old daughter to a Camden Riversharks game at Campbell's field on a perfect evening.

She enjoyed herself immensely - and we did too.  The weather was perfect.  No rain, not too hot, not cold.

She posed for a picture with one of the mascots (Blooper), the other shark (Finley) was unavailable.

We waited 50 minuted (and spent $5) for her to get on that darned "bouncy castle" but she claims it was worth it for the 4.5 minutes she spent inside.  (Note to self:   skip that next time.)


Seats were comfortable and had cup holders.  Food is pricey (and basic ballpark fare) as we anticipated.  Parking was $5.00

A great alternative to a Phillies game and GREAT for kids.  Next time we'll ride the (small) $1 per ride carousel.

NOTE:  Most concessions and atttractions shut down at the 7th inning.

Chick-Fil-A Lima has sponsored 2 school fundraising events now for my child's elementary school.  They do a thing where on a certain day during certain hours (for us it was a Tuesday night from 5 - 7:30 PM) for everyone who mentions XYZ school they give the school 15% of the sales.

We packed the place with hundreds of families and it was a win-win for all involved.

The kids loved seeing some of the faculty and staff running the counter (and the principal bussing tables!) and the restaurant (and school) makes money.

Great job, Chick-Fil-A!

Thank god they are here!  Philadelphia is a holistic wasteland (or should I say "waist-land - people here are FAT!) and we veggie types need places like this.

I gotta have my grass - wheat or otherwise.
I also get mixed green veggies (no carrot- they charge me more but I don't care - I want it GREEN!).

I need them and they have a reliable fresh product.

Gotta have my juice!

Fantastic experience today - on a Monday at lunch.
Got some hot (prepared) foods and a pack of Genji Sushi for a quick take-out lunch.

Pricey (over $20) but worth it.
Got in & out fast and ate well instead of pre-processed junk from the office.

I have watched it on TV and live in the freezing cold.
Both are great fun - and this is one heck of a LONG parade.

It takes the whole day.

Nothing like watching Sou-filly plummers and electricians wear feathered headdresses and shake their butts to the beat.

My little girl ADORES them.

Fancy Brigades are my faves - and she loves the comics especially Froggie Carr's crew. Also Fralinger's and the South Philly Vikings!

Oh and the string bands are fun, too.

Best in the City.  For real.
Best Valet, door personel, securit, rooms, cleanliness, service and food.

GREATEST frikkin' food.

If you can stay here - or play here - DO IT!

The owners of the Wayside Market (and their 10 (yes, ten) children and staff are amazing people.  Great food - and a few staples like milk and drinks - plus a deli counter - oh and they make pizzas and calzones. And wings!

Catering - great.
Eat-in area - so cute.

A very pleasant place and terrific customer service.
Family friendly, too.

I give much respect to our over-worked, over-stressed police department. They have alot of idiots to deal with - not to mention violent and non violent criminals - on a daily basis.

The police around 30th Street Station have been very helpful to me.

I support our law enforcement and fire fighters.

Yay!  Hooray!
I got green juice today (paid extra for it though)!

I got a medium (16 oz) juice of Kale, Celery, Cucumber, Lemon, Green Apple and a bit of ginger for like $7 or so.  Plus I got wheatgrass on the side (2.95).

Ten bucks for juice.  Oy vey!
But my body is so thanking me.

What a terrific store for jewelry and accessories.  Friendly service (not pushy) and oodles of beaded, silver and hand-crafted jewelry.  Purses/Back packs, scarves, hats, gloves and winter wear.  Headbands, bows and hair accessories.

Funny how I have never notice it before - it's only been here for 28 years!
Right next to Fellini's on State Street.

Can't wait to do more gift shopping here - and pick up some things for myself and my daughter.

Bliss.

Friends don't let friends drink Charbucks.
Try Caffe Maida for some first-class real-deal Italian Espresso drinks, and delicious gelato and pastries (mostly Bindi - but still fine).

I had an iced coffee (pretty basic, I know) and it was terrific.

Clean digs (including the restroom) and Viceland on TV. 

I was so pleased.

OMG - I'm gonna do it.  I'm gonna go all out and give Fri. Sat. Sun 5 well deserved stars.  Tonight was my innaugural experience here - and (even with no reservation - on a Sunday night) we got a great table.

We had 2 lovely female servers and everything my friend (a fellow yelper) and I ate was just wonderful.

We both started with salads.  She had the Goat cheese, walnut and mixed greens, I had the beet and fresh fennel salad - and subbed goat for bleu cheese.   My salad was truly dreamy - and almost like eating 3 salads in one.  It was artfully presented ring-mold style with the top layer (salad No. 1) being a mache mix in a light and PERFECTLY balanced vinaigrette (just the right blend of acid and oil).

Under the mache layer was salad #2 - a crunchy, cold layer of shaved fresh fennel with (again) the perfect dressing ratio.  Now - you must understand that I am the quintessential "on the side" kind of gal.  I almost always ask for dressings and sauces "on the side" - but here I did not - and I am glad.  The salad was PERFECTLY dressed.

Around the edge of the plate was sub-salad number 3 - sliced, sweet, red beets and toasted pine nuts.

This salad was worth every blessed penny of the $12.

For an entree I chose a "small plate" (which was not small -more like medium size) of 8 butternut squash filled ravioli in a delectable brown butter and sage sauce.  (Not diet friendly - but I asked for light on the sauce and it was not too heavy).  The pasta was tender and perfectly cooked and every bite was delicious.

For dessert we shared a (dated, I know - but this one was awesome) molten lava cake, served with 2 generous blobs of home-made whipped cream - each topped with a strawberry fan.

2 cups of coffee later (the house blend is custom roasted for Fri. Sat. Sun. and it is yummy) we were so darned happy!

What a wonderful evening.  The ambience (this is a GREAT date place, dimly lit, romantic vibe), music (mellow '60's), service and food were all TOP NOTCH.

This ain't no Garces/Starr/Industrial place.  It's not slick.  It's an urban townhouse rest-o and as Arnold Schwartzenager might say...

"I'l be baaack..."

I can't WAIT to go back.

I have known rebecca Michaels since she got her start as a pastry artist in NYC - and I knew her ex husband, too.

How wonderful that we both relocated to Philly just a few months apart.  Her Vermont Cheddar Apple Cake was served way back when at my party on the Upper East side - and now I can just walk over to RTM (Reading Terminal Market) for a blondie or a cupcake whenever I want.  (Diet permitting.)

I wish Rebecca and Flying Monkey all the success in the world!

Keep on baking, ladies (and gent.).

Oh - she used to make great chocolate truffles, too.  Don't know if they are offered these days.

Don't miss the specialty cupcakes.  WOW!!!  She gives Buttercup and Magnolia (bakeshops in NYC) a run for their money.

Go, Monkey, go!!!!

OK - they are probably only worth 4 stars but nostalgia and YEARS of knowing the Gross family (Harry Gross is long dead - RIP) and many people who worked here - when D-town was a much, much smaller town.

The fried and oven roasted chicken are mouth-wateringly delicious.  They also make very heavy (but I think tasty) potato salad and cole slaw.  YUMMY all-white meat Chicken salad, too.

VERY expensive for what it is - picnic food - but we love to get take out meals from Gross'.

Years ago you could get the most amazing frozen meat (and cheese - but I liked the meat better) ravioli here, too - but alas, no longer.

Want a neat idea for a quick picnic?  Don't feel like cooking?  Like tasty chicken?

Try Gross'.

It's NOT at all gross.

Tim and Bob at the bar gave my friend and I top-tier service during Thursday night happy hour - and happy, indeed, we were.

The $7 wedge salad was so good we ordered 3 of them between us.
Burrata (also $7) was rich and served with what appeared to be a whole tomato.  Once cut open, the tomato had been cored and stuffed with a delicious pesto.  Interesting presentation.

The tuna tartar is still on the bar menu ($10) but has been re-vamped and is better than ever.

Drinks are just $5 for the delicious sweet-tea-like Daly Pear and the always tasty William B. Pitt Mule (A Szuszhed-up Moscow Mule with Cinnamon and other spices) were terrific.  

Can't wait to come back.
The decor and great, great music (pop, rock, classic and hits) make this place just about "As good as it gets".

My sister in law (and her mom) get their T-giving turkeys here (and Easter and any time the need a turkey) here.  How they raise a 22 lb bird without growth hormones is beyond me - but that was a big and tasty bird!  (Not dry or tough or stringy at all).

Delicious!

My 11 year old dim sum loving daughter and I enjoyed an inexpensive and satisfying lunch at Tom's.  We were treated well and even though they do not yet have Moon Cake (nor egg tarts, nor Bubble tea - please consider serving Bubble Tea!), we ate to our hearts content.

The mammoth triple steamed bao ($1.95) is big enough to share and stuffed with mustard greens, eggs and shrimp paste.  (Next time we'll try the meat bun).

For dim sum we had the superb Shanghai Pork Soup Dumplings.  #Bliss.
The har gao (crystal shrimp dumplings) were tasty (kiddo's fave) but my favorite were the pan fried beef dumplings.  Wow.

I am sold and can't wait to return.  Next time we shall try the scallion pancake and 2 kinds of Shu Mai.

Never met a dumpling I didn't like - but these are terrific.
Chinatown (a cleaner, more yuppified version) has come to "downtown" Media!

Update:  We went again on 8/15 and who did we see working there?  SABRINA!  We love her.  She introduced us to the fabulous sweet potato cake for dessert.  We also tried the Shanghai Shumai (very good), more har gao (LOVE THEM) and an order of the pork & chive dumplings.   One of the best bites?  The cold, marinated sliced pork.  Soooooo good.

As her website states, Celeste serves up the finest cheesecake in town.  Specializing in classic pinup and burleque photography, Celeste and her team of make-up and hair stylists can transform even an ordinary house-wife into a vampy vixen or pinup.

She offers a variety of packages in her private studio in overbrook.  I did a pin-up photo shoot and it was a blast.  Can't wait to do it again some day!  Celeste is one in a million and I just love her work.

Just had my 3rd photo shoot with Celeste (and Jessica - the makeup/hair artist). It was soooooooo much fun.

Can't wait to see the proofs.

And...  They are amazing.
I love working with Celeste for the "best cheesecake in town".

Back 10 years later for yet another "special" birthday and Celeste and her hair and makeup team (Raina was not there - I had Jessica who was also great) are world-class. Her overbrook studio is comfortable, clean and so very retro.  LOVE LOVE LOVE.

I chose one set with a $75 upgrade for a beach theme.
My goal?  To make it not look like 10 years went by.
I get the proofs in 2 weeks.

Can't wait.

If you have ever, ever, ever wanted to do this - run to your phone and call Celeste (or book online).  It's well worth the money and I can't wait to come back again in 5 or 10 years.

Seriously.
Can't say enough great things about Celeste as a person and as a professional photographer.

Hosted a "Ladies Night" Happy hour with 6 of my friends.  Service from Allan was terrific and the drinks ($5 specialty cocktails and wines) and food (mostly we got small plates) was very good.

A great choice for a fun night out.

It's 2021 and boy, how the world has changed.
My kid is 16 - and a vegan

But We still enjoy Tom's Dim Sum (Delicious steamed broccoli, vegetable dumplings)

I am not a vegan so I get Har Gao (Crystal Shrimp Dumplings) and dip them into the delicious sweet soy/vinegar sauce.  So satisfying.

Love it here.

My 13 year old still adores the Shrimp (Har Gao) Dumplings, Soup Dumplings, Meat Bun (big and fluffy and $1.75) and Shanghai-style Shiu Mai at Tom's.

Also faves include the cold, marinated roast pork (Chinese Salumeria at its finest), and believe it or not excellent Chicken & Broccoli and Pork Fried Rice. If you LOVE garlic - try the thinly sliced roast roast with garlic (appetizer).  So tasty!

We just love it here - and lunch for 2 is never more than $30/$35.

Kremp - and Leslie Kremp is my go-to source for local flowers.
I have placed orders for Mother's Day (2012 and 2013), friend's birthday's, baby showers and many other things.

They even did my wedding back in 2008 and I have loved them ever since.

And no visit to the PHS Flower Show is complete without a bunch of Irises and Roses and uber-cheap prices from the PHS Marketplace at the flower show every year.

WE LOVE KREMPS!

I have been going to Tommi on and off for over 2 years - and they do offer groupons from time to time - which are a great value.

This time I had a facial with Liana and she is terrific.
My skin looked and felt amazing afterward (I never judge a facial until at least 24 hours have ellapsed ) with no breakouts.

She also did a lip and eyebrow wax for me and they were great, too.

Tommi is a relaxing beautiful spa and I love to come here.

So glad Tierra is still here - she is a great massage therapist.

My 4 year old can't get enough of the big wooden slide at Smith Playground.  The house is also great - but many of the toys are old and dirty - so bring Purell!

The outdoor playground areas are terrific on a sunny day - and all this is FREE.

For a small fee you can rent a space to have your child's birthday party here, too.

I feel a little silly updating my Tommi review so many times - so this will be my last update for a while - since now I am going here regularly.

Tommi has become my new "spa of choice".

I had a delightful massage with Tierra, and I can't wait to get another pedicure here.
Massages and pedis - I will go to Tommi!

Had my rings cleaned and polished here just prior to Xmas.
Such lovely people and great service.

Ray Feldman, sadly, has passed away and he will be missed.
So glad we bought a platinum wedding band here.

We love and trust Barsky's.

I just had a spa pedicure with...

...None other than Larisa (formerly of the now closed Ettore).

She remembered me - before I came to my senses and remembered her.  And yes, she is still a wonderfully talented nail technician.

Nikki and Tom were kind to me as always.  Cliff and Tierra (my go-to massage therapists) are there and all is right with the world. Vera still does facials on Saturdays.

Let's hope that Tommi can iron out their staff and management kinks and build a good spa.  I know they can do it!

Meanwhile - definitely go have a massage or spa pedi here - it's now $65 for the spa pedi - which is pretty fair.  Good products too.

Sweet!

Old City and Passero's have some of the BEST coffee drinks in Philly.
I had a delicious Cafe au lait here for under $3.00.

Remember - "Friends don't let Friends drink Charbucks!"

Came back a second time for a "regular" $14 mani.
Yu is a real pro and I love her!

I also like Tina who did my pedi last time and gives a great massage.

I will be a regular at 4 sisters for sure!

Love Kremp's!  They did 2 mother's day orders (my mom and MIL) as well as an Easter order for me this year.  Less than $150 for all 3 orders and just the flowers I wanted.  (No filler, no cheap glass vase.)

So pleased!

We love Kremp's and a shout out to Leslie Kremp!

We get loaves of sourdough through our company's CSA through Philly bread - big, perfect loaves that smeel and taste so good.  Eat them when they're fresh.

Carb-a-licious!

Had an amazing experience - and impeccable service from Michael - at White Dog for an Early (5 PM) Friday night.

The seafood platter for two is expensive but amazing.  4 oysters, 4 perfect shrimp, Tuna Tartar ($16 on its own for a larger serving) (delicious) and delectable lump lumps of crabmeat.

The famous mushroom soup is a rich treat.
Try the Cauliflower with parmesan, too.
Crab rolls (like a lobster roll) were sweetened with honey (odd but great) ad served on a hot dog bun.  (Decidedly un-white-dog).  $18.

A strawberry bellini ($10) was so good I could have downed 3 of them.
The cheese plate for dessert ($16 for 3 selections) was terrific, too.  Try the red leaf goat cheese.  Quince, Honey, Apples. Dried Cherries and MARCONA Almonds, baby!

I am in my happy place.

Billy sells his home-made salami, sausages and charcuterie (sp??) at the Media Farmers Market on Thursday from 3-7.  Nice guy and best of all - a top-quality product.  (Uses some D'Artagnan and other more local sources.)

The porkette with broccoli rabe and provolone is terrific.
As is the Chicken sausage with spinach and sharp provolone (a bit salty).

Can't wait to get some more.

5 stars for a great massage with Tierra (who is still there thank goodness).
Go see her now!

I love coming to Tommi - they treat me very well.

Things are getting better & better every time I visit Tommi.
Today I was up at the CRACK of dawn (on a Saturday anyway) to snag a 9 AM appointment with Vera - a russian facialist/esthetician with 20 years of experience.

I am a former esthetician myself and extremely picky about facials and who I let go near my face.

Vera is terrific.  the products (she used primarily anti-oxidant/anti-aging stuff on me - it's nearly winter and my skin gets dry) are gentle and hydrating. The facial lasted exactly 60 minutes (I was seen at 9:05 and got out at 10:05 AM). I wish I could remember the name of the product line - it starts with an "H" and I had never seen it before.  The grapeseed scrub and anti-oxidant mask were nice - and I may purchase.

I respect her opinions and trust Vera.  I will definitely come see her again (but probably not for a while since I tend to do alot of my own skincare.)

Next up - I am due for a massage and booked an appointment for December.

I will let you all know!

I give Smoke's 5 stars for one reason.

Kenn Kweder.

Yes.  I love this man.
Really.  But not in a sick, stalker, psycho kinda way.

Anyhow I spent many a late night in the early nineties watching Kenn and drinking watered down gin & tonics and eating greasy chicken wings.  Back then you could even SMOKE inside Smokes.

Ah the good old days.

Jammed with Penn Kids - but the nostalgia factor runs high for me here.

I am back in the area - and now the owners know me - and they REMEMBERED me.
I just love the lunch specials here (huge portions - I take about 40-50% home) and so delicious.
Fresh, hot pita.  Delicious sides and sauces, and fluffy long-grain rice (Persian Style).  Chicken, Beef, LAMB - so juicy and savory and wonderful.

I have missed it here - and now I will be back - at least until early 2-17.

Don't forget they serve a terrific dinner, too - for take out or dine in.  (Very casual for dine in.)

Much love to the crew at Kabab Café.  Keep doing what you are doing.

OK - they did it!  They got the 5th Star (but I also do love Salumeria for my grating cheeses).

What a great place.

I have known Michael Colabelli (I just KNOW I spelled that wrong) for years - since the '80's - and his father before him who owned the shop (It's now it the 3rd and 4th generation.    They are a well-run business that has stood the test of time and provide affordable cuts and GREAT colors to the Penn campus and beyond.

I love them.

I have known Jay Sand & his wife since High School and this is a truly wonderful program.  He has always been a talented guy - and this proves it.

Kids just thrive here.

Talluto's, Caludio's , DiBruno's, Spice Corner, Superior Ravioil...

The stuff of culinary dreams.
I am loving the Italian Market soooooo much.
What a treasure to Philadelphia.

Fresh fruit & veggies - and all the great Italian meats, cheeses and olives - plus fresh pasta and ravioli from 2 great sources.

I'm in love.

This is NOT closed - in fact, it recently opened to the public in Nov. 2010 and is GORGEOUS.

A content-rich (spend 2-3 hours there easily, 90 minutes is too little) 4 story museum that chronicles American Jewish life since the mid 1600's.

I became a member (just $54 for 1 person, $72 for a couple) which gets you free admission for an entire year.

I can't wait to go back, as I did not get to see (or rather read - there's alot to read) everything I wanted to.

Oh - and they have a Kosher-Dairy cafe with Matzo Ball soup, Kugel, tuna & egg salad and other tasty looking food!

A great find!  A wee bit more expensive (mani is $14, gel mani 424, Pedi $25, spa pedi $47 - mani-pedi combo is $35) than the usual - but a better service.

Tina did a great mani-pedi for me and got me out the door in time for an imprtant meeting.

I will definitely be back.

Cash for tip - but credit card is OK.

Had another FABULOUS facial (this time no Groupon so the full price is $90 - but still worth it in my opinion - if you get Larissa or Liana.  Lan is gone.)

I also love massages with Tierra (as Cliff has also left).

They treat me so well here now that I really can't think about going ayywhere else.
(Except for the occaisional jaunt to Ursula's).

Beautiful spa with great staff.
An now that the receptionist downstairs is actually friendly, I am sold on Tommi.

I just wish they'd put a little more effort into the esthetics "backbar" and use better known products. (Or at least products where clients can purchase the retail equivalent.)  A plus:  Tommi carries (a little bit of) the Hylunia line - which is little known but very good.  (The grapeseed scrub is awesome.

I became a founding member and am so glad I did.  I have now been 5 times - and twice with my 7 year old who really enjoyed alot of the exhibits.  Great use of video and audio elements (and computers).

Great special events for members - and a nice gift shop and cafe.  The shop has great Hannukah and Passover gift items.

The "Members Night" is great - they open the museum from 6 - 8 PM and only members  and their guests can visit then.  It's quiet and peaceful.

We love it here.

I am giving K of T a 5 stars - mostly for the following LARGE party event I am going to describe.  In reality this is a 4 star place, but the way our group of 31 people (20 of which were children ages 2-7) was treated deserves kudos.

Kumar and Mohammed helped me to plan and execute a large Indian dinner for my 5 yesar old's Pre-K class, their parents and siblings.

Orinigally we planned on 12 -15 guests and each family would simply order what they wished and pay for their share.  Well plans changed..  and the guest list ballooned to 20, then 24, then 27 and finally 31.

We decide to go to a set menu - and people got to choose from 5 entrees including Chicken Tikka (plain for the kids or Masala), Lamb Korma, Shrimp Shag, Malai Kofta (for our vegetarian friends) or 3 kinds of Biryani.

Appetizers were great and included a smooth Muligatawny (Lentil) soup, Crispy Samosas (yum!) and Chana Chat - chikpeas in a tamarind sauce.

The kids plowed their way through 18 Lassi in Mango, Strawberry and Pomegranite.

We had our tables arranged in a large "U" shape for lots of interaction.
I only pity the other diners that night (a few tables on a Wednesday night) who witnessed the chaos.  Those kids had a BLAST.

The servers and kitchen worked hard - and in the end the dinner was enjoyed very much.  Plus we introduced a whole group of young children to many new foods - including the yummy breads (which the loved) naan, paratha and poori.

It's not on the menu by itself - but ask them to make you a poori - it's (fattening and) delicious.

Oh - and those who stayed for dessert (many left early for bedtime) enjoyed Mango and Pistachio kulfi.

THANK YOU to the staff of King of Tandoor.

Motions was recommended to us by Donna at Broadway Bound Dance Academy in Media, boy are we ever glad. (They even gave us a 10% discount for BBDA and/or IceWorks)

Leotards, ballet shoes, tights, lyrical and praise dance costumes, footwear for ballroom, accessories, just about everything a dancer, gymnast, figure skater or active person might need.

Spacious shop with a super clean restroom and 2 changing rooms.

They even have a small ballet barre and mirror for when you are fitted for shoes.

Donna - (also named Donna) who works here was so great!
We'll be back - you can bet on it!

Update 2015:  SO SAD!!!!  They are closed.
Such a shame.


A great old-school German Wurst-maker.
They also supply to Steven Starr (Frankford Hall).

The Weiss Wurst and (believe it or not) Liverwurst are excellent.

I hope they stay open for many more years of success.

I get sausage from Billy and his crew at the Media Farmers Market - and I just pulled a link of pork/broccoli rabe/sharp provolone outta the freezer, defrosted it and grilled it up.

Served it in 1 inch chucks over orzo pasta.

BLISS.

These are some of the best artisanal (Wilmington Made) links ever.
Please make more chicken and turkey with greens (spinach, rabe, kale whatever you got!)

Seasoned to perfection.

Love!

I am dithering between 4 & 5 stars - because we did have 2 dishes that were NOT 5 star - but the decor, service and most of the food was great.

The wood floors, wall paper and paint are just stunning - and OH, that gorgeous bar!

We arrived early and sat at the bar - so we were able to order off of the Happy Hour Menu, Dirt List and Dinner Menus.

The 2 female bartenders were great and the vast array of home-made biters boggles the mind.  Drinks do contain bitters - so I asked for mine light on the bitters and that was a good thing for me.

The highlights of the menu were the corn with aioli (so sweet and fresh), golden beet/avodaco terrine-like salad with cucumber dill sauce and rye bread (a Horizon's holdover and fave) and the in-season heirloom tomato (at least 3 varieties on the plate) and mushroom salad over a thick green-goddess puree.

I am loving it here and can't wait to return.

There were at least 3 desserts we wanted to try (can't believe some of these are vegan).  Pot de Creme? But alas - we were just too full.

See you again, soon, Vedge!

It's a little more expensive than other fro yo joints, but yogorino rocks!
The chocolate sauce with torrone in it is my 5 year old's fave, and I love to top it with fresh fruit (they even had kiwis and nectarines.).

Yummy!

And if you get a small (and only get fruit - not pistachio or chocolate) it's not as bad for you as some other treats.

We purchased my solid platinum, high-polish, 3 mm, comfort-fit wedding band (got my husband's at Carroll's jeweler's in Doylestown and the e-ring at Blue Nile - we really shop around.) here at Barsky's.

Ray Feldman, our sales consultant really know the jewelry biz - and pulled no punches in getting us the best deal for the gram weight of the ring.  (Platinum prices were sky high at the time.)

I would definitely consider Barsky's again.  We had a great experience.

This place is getting better and better - faster checkouts, they take credit/debit/food stamps (and cash).

Be a little cautious of the very cheap aisle (on the left) - it's "Eat now or forever hold your peace" but i saw a lady with a big bag of Donut peaches for $2.73 (89 cents a pound!).

Today I scored some pluots, nectarines, cherries, baby bell peppers, BIG spotless white mushrooms and a bunch of leeks.

I also ran into an old friends.  5 stars at RTM and IOVINE's today.

I haven't been to Shiroi in a very long time - their other restaurant Doma is closer to home and is now our go-to place - but Shiroi never disappoints me.

We are even planning a big party here in April.

Love the spicy tuna hand roll here, house-made tamago, ohitashi.

Sublime!  Fresh and yummy.

I returned at the RR with good friends and colleagues last night and we were treated to stellar service (Thanks, Dave!) and fantastic (El Rey) food.

We ordered literally "one of everything" - cheese plate, charcutterie platter, chrimp cocktail, salsa/guac and chips, 3 kinds of tacos and gorditas.  All were terrific.

Drinks ($8 for the special to $12 for bartenders choice) are works of art and magic.  Such mixology.

However my simple glass of Marqui de la tour with a swirl of fresh raspberry in it was a refreshing treat.  Try the Meloni Swizzle.   Also the "Blackmail".

YUM!!!!!

Love it here.

Love coming here for all my Italian Market needs without schlepping to Souffilly.  Correpolese Tomato Pie on the weekends, good Parm, prepared foods, San Marzano Tomatoes, Eggs, Milk and Bread.

Love it here.

Stop here and at Ok Lee  (as aforementioned) to nab the freshest produce and a few bargains that must be consumed quickly.

Fresh berries and citurs are cheaper here than the grocery stores.
A large variety of greens and apples as well.

A great place for the home cook to buy whatever is needed.
Gotta love it!

OMG. This is truly "as good as it gets" for a Qdoba.  They have a Bar! A BAR!!!!!! In a Qdoba.  I can't believe it!  And Kelly the bar tender is fantastic.  Love her.

The house margarita  (regularly 4.50) is just $2.50 during Happy Hour.  Plus free chips and salsa or queso???  OMG run here!!!  Before they come to their senses.

I am so shocked, surprised and PLEASED.   Puts the shitty Springfield Qdoba to SHAME!   Wow.

This is my favorite sushi spot in Philly.  And I have been to Morimoto (twice), Raw, Fuji Mountain, Mizu and many, many others.  Shiroi is not a "show place" but it serves very fresh product with a wide variety of fish.  The kitchen entrees are well prepared and there are some great values to be had.  The Tuna Lover's platter and Vegetarian Special (a bento box) never disappoint.  I enjoy eating here and have many times and intend to come back many more times.

I used to work at the Mercer Museum - as a summer day camp counselor \many years ago.  We would take the kids to Fonthill for tours as well.

Anyhow, Fonthill is the steel re-enforced home of Henry Chapman Mercer who also built his workshop & tile works right next door.  His beloved horse Lucy and dog Rolo took part in the construction.

Kids and Adults can both learn from the one hour tour at Fonthill.  A trip to the Mercer Museum is also a must.  (Especially during the annual Folk Fest.)

You can also get married on the grounds of Fonthill. and it's a great place to have a picnic in the summer or fall. Christmas is a gorgeous time at Fonthill with an enormous tree in the great hall and candle-lit tours.  (Not sure if they still do these.)

What a marvelous piece of local history.

You gotta love this place.  The unique selection, the Amish, VietNamese, Asian, Italian and American stands all crammed in together.  Sure it's a bit grimey and can get mobbed at lunchtime, but give me Iovine's Produce, Och's Chicken Breasts, Some Tom Kha Gai from Little Thai Market and a hot fresh macadamia nut cookie from 4th St and I am good to go.

It is a blessing to live nearby.

Such wonderful foods - freshly grated Parmegiano Reggiao, fried eggplant slices, deli meats and cheese, long hots, pastas.

So great.

They also stock Corropolese tomato pies!

Love it so much.

They did our wedding flowers and came in at just under our budget of $1,000.  Amy was terrific and the flowers were upscale and just what we wanted.

They were excellent in their communications via email and phone.  We paid for our wedding in 3 installments.

Most of our flowers involved Bluebird roses, blue hydrangea and different colored irises (light & dark blue and purple).  The colors were vibrant and the arangements, bouquets and boutenieres (all but one - which contained white freesia) survived our 96 degree wedding day.

The flowers on the cake were gorgeous, too, as were the 10 small centerpieces.

We love Kremps.

Shiroi - how I've missed you.
The sushi chef who knows me "by face".
The older waitress who brings me genmaicha.

The incredibly fresh sashimi.

I miss it here so much!  I stop in whenever I can - which is about once a year now.

2 word have restored my faith in YSP.

Danny Bonaduce.

I don't come here often - but when I do, I make it count.
To me, the "hots" are the clear attraction here - and the plain hot donut that comes when you order fried chicken.

I walk it - get ONE (and only ONE - although I would love two) hot, eat it on my way to getting coffee and go.

This time I got Cinnamon Brown Sugar and it was HOT and fresh and just a bit greasy and perfect.

So bad for you, but so good.

Oh - and at 11:30 AM on a Wednesday?  No line!

Hallelujah!  Penzey's is here!
I am so grateful there is a Philly location (alas, Chestnut Hill is closed).
Picked up some Shallot Pepper, BBQ 3000, Onion Powder and Chicago Steak seasoning.

I have been a HUGE Penzey's user for years.

Welcome to the city!!!!!

Most people LOVE the Barnes Foundation - and I bet the new Center City space will be a true spectacle.

My parents had dragged us here since childhood and mom is/was a member and supporter, so we kids had art & culture shoved down our throats.

Thus, I too, love the Barnes foundation.  And the arts.

Thanks, Mom!

Omg! Came back to Shiroi after nearly 7 years and they treated us like celebrities.  The tuna lovers plate ($42, includes 2 pieces of chu-toro), naked tuna on crispy rice, oshi-tashi with bonito and succulent salmon tartar were all sheer perfection.

Swimmingly fresh.

Fabulous service, nothing "shi-shi" or hipster or fancy, just amazingly good sashimi, nigiri and maki.

We love you and sister-restaurant Doma, too.

Run, don't walk, to Shiroi Hana today!

Three cheers for Ethan who provides amazing customer serviceI stopped in on an early Monday morning (They open at 7 AM) to get a dozen "hots" for my work colleagues.

So fresh (made to order) and wonderful.

$15 a dozen puts Dunkin to shame.

I can't eat donuts often - but when I do, I make it count and FedNuts ROCKS.

OMG - a BIG 5 stars for Melissa (not Missy!) who has now been cutting my 6 year old's hair since September.  She is great (the place - probably 3 stars - but she gets 5).  So patient and great with my little one.

And for $12 - what a deal!!

Thanks again to Danny Bonaduce (love him!  and he married Amy - a yelper - so Go Danny!) for sending us to Supercuts.

They make my kiddo SuperCUTE.

Brand-new, super clean and well-run (double-lane drive thru) Taco Bell.
They ripped down the ancient Burger King and now this Taco Bell is hoppin'.

I don't eat this food but my 16 year old likes it so about once per week (less if I had my way) I let her get it.

Clarice at the cashier window (They have 2 windows - you pay at the first and pick up food at the 2nd) was friendly and fast.
